loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth G. is from the village of Villa Victoria Echague. She is 47 years old. Elizabeth is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Elizabeth is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling electronic and card mobile loads in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elizabeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elizabeth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy electronics products for resale

loans.name: David Samuel Techera

texts.en:
David Samuel Techera S. is a 42-year-old gentleman who services electronics for his customers for a fee.  He is married to Clemetina Asatali, and together they have four children ages 12, 8, 6, and 4. 

He runs his business in Lumakanda Eldoret, Kenya, and has been in this business for about six years.

David was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and has no history with any other MFI.  He is applying for a second loan of Kshs 40,000 from KADET LTD which he plans to use to purchase more spare parts like dozens of IC, transistors, wires, and nuts .

In the future, David wants to expand his business. His deeper desire is to see his children realize their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To purchase parts for electronics repair business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn A. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 30 years old. Evelyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. 

To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP when she sells her raised animal.

In 2009, Evelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. 

Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Evelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Susana Tepkemoi

texts.en:
Susana Tepkemoi K. is 51 years old.  She is married to Silvester Kiplagat who is a farmer and is also a source of additional income for the family. They have four children of age 28, 26, 24, and 20 years.  Their residence is in Kapsowar in Eldoret Town. 

She has been operating a cereal store and at the same time selling second-hand clothes.  She has been in this business for 25 years and earns a monthly profit of Kshs 20,000.

Susana learned about KADET LTD through a credit officer.  She is applying for her first loan of Kshs 37,500 from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to buy five sacks of maize and the remainder to buy one bale of second-hand clothes. 

With the anticipated profits, she plans to pay her children's school fees.   In the future, Susana wishes to build rental houses and live a more comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy maize and second-hand clothes for resale

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita A. is from the village of Divisoria Santiago. She is 54 years old. Benita is married and has 4 adult-aged children. 

To make a living, Benita owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a transportation business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motorcycle transport in the local community. Benita has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Benita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. 

Benita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand her services. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Benita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy materials needed to expand business

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is a resident of Faisalabad, which is a big city in Pakistan famous for its textile industry. She is 29 years old, married to G. N. and has 3 sons and a daughter. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education.
 
Bushra supports her family by stitching clothes for her neighborhood clients. She has a good number of clients in her area and she receives regular orders from them every month. 

Her husband has a shop where he sells different crockery like glass sets, dinner sets, etc.  to his customers for good profit. His shop is in the market and he has been running this business for the past 7 years.  

Bushra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy crockery in bulk quantity to sell through his shop.  Bushra is hopeful that her husband has good experience in his business and with this loan investment, his business will surely get improved and help Bushra improve the living standard of her family.

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her 1st loan application.   

Note: In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Bushra.

loans.use: To buy crockery for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Last payment to fully own the bookstore

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith N. lives in Kitawuluzi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has seven children, two of whom are in school.   She also takes care of additional family members (her niece and her grandchildren).    Edith has a retail shop business.  She has been in this business for eight years, and she works seven days out of every week. 

Edith sells her products in a shop, retail.  Edith has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more merchandise such as bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil.  She also generates additional income through roasting maize and cassava for sale.

The main business challenges for Edith include   transportation and seasonality .  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop. Edith lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: buy more  bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Margaret Nyambura

texts.en:
Margaret has practiced farming in Olkalou town since 2007.  She is a 30-year-old single mother of two children. She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount as capital to start selling shoes.  She already has a shop which she has been using to sell her farm produce such as potatoes.

In future, Margaret hopes to grow the shoe business and become a leading shoe retailer in Olkalou town.

loans.use: To start selling shoes

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Mrs. Cheng S. is a 28 year old married mother who currently lives in Kompong Tom province in Cambodia. She is married with two school-aged kids. To earn an income for living, Mrs. Cheng S. sells a few products such as perfume, fast food, plastic products in front of her home. Another source of family income comes from her husband who works as a building worker. Because selling is a profitable business for the family, Mrs. Cheng S. requested a loan to provide additional capital to purchase more items for selling.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Sokota Ene Sentero

texts.en:
Sokota has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town for the last two years.  She is 54 years old and married to Sentero P.. She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the cash to buy 12 goats which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

In future, Sokota hopes to grow her business and become a large-scale livestock trader in Naivasha Town.

loans.use: To buy 12 goats which she will rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Rempeyian Ole

texts.en:
Rempeyian has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town for the last three years now.  He is 36 years old, married to Senet Ene Rempeyian and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan from KADET.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy 10 goats and 15 sheep which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

In future, Rempeyian hopes to be supplying animal meat in large quantity to the Kenya Meat Commission.

loans.use: To buy 10 goats  and 15 sheep which he will rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Tadjikan

texts.en:
Tadjikan I. is a widow with two grown children who lives in Nooken village, in the south of Kyrgyzstan.  In 1990, in order to support her family, she began her business in cattle breeding and cotton cultivating. Using the amount of 50,000 Kyrgyz Soms to purchase livestock and plant seeds, Tadjikan worked hard to make her business successful.  

Today, she has four milch cows and fourteen sheep and earns about 5,000 Kyrgyz Soms monthly. To reduce expenses for the livestock's foraging, she pastures her livestock in mountainous areas with native grasses. Currently, Tadjikan’s four grandchildren live with her, which further added to the family’s expenditures so she had to make strong efforts to earn their living. That’s why Tadjikan is applying for a loan of 100,000 Kyrgyz Soms to buy cattle, which will allow her to enlarge her business. 

In future, Tadjikan dreams of seeing her grandchildren educated and progressive people. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna A. is a young woman married to Ismael and a mother of six daughters and two sons. The family own a small rabbit farm where they raise rabbits for sale. Muna came to FATEN and asked for a loan in order to purchase more rabbits and feed to answer the increased demand, as Al Adha feast is coming soon.

Muna, her husband and one of her sons work on the farm, while the rest are school students. Muna and her husband aim to increase returns and enlarge the farm, especially because they are a big family and Gaza has a lot of farms, which increases competition.

Muna's husband appears on the farm in the picture here since the conservative background Muna comes from prevents her from having her picture online.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
 
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase rabbits and feed

loans.name: Albert

texts.fr: Albert N. est commerçant, et il vend beaucoup de choses dans sa boutique à Nyamata.  Il a 28 ans, il est célibataire, et il n’a pas des enfants.  Avec son prêt, il veut acheter les haricots, sorghos, et il veut acheter les articles de détail de sa boutique.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’augmenter d’autres articles a sa boutique, comme kaunga (farine de mais), et les boissons Fanta, pour améliorer les activités de commerce.  Albert voudrait devenir un gros commerçant, et il voudrait aider ses parents dans toutes choses qu’ils veulent.
texts.en: Albert N. is a businessman and he sells many products in his shop in Nyamata. He is 28 years old, single and does not have any children. With his loan, he wants to buy beans, sorghum and other retail products for his shop. His strategy to expand and improve his business is to increase the quantity of other products in his shop, such as "kaunga" (flour made from corn) and Fanta drinks. Albert would like to become a significant businessman and also help his parents to have everything they want.

loans.use: To purchase beans, sorghum and other retail products

loans.name: Joyce Punyua

texts.en:
Joyce, 23 years old, practises livestock farming and also operates a retail shop in Naivasha town.  She has been doing this since 2008. She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to buy two bags of maize, three bags of beans and five boxes of cooking fat which she will sell from her retail shop.

In future, Joyce hopes to grow her retail shop to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy 2 bags of maize, 3 bags of beans, and 5 boxes of cooking fat to sell

loans.name: Pom's Group

texts.en:
Four people form this group loan. They are living in Krabau village in Kandal province. This group selected Mrs. Pom C., a 28-year-old married woman, as the group leader. Each member of the group will use their portion of the loan to support their different purpose. 

Mrs. Pom C. earns her living by vegetable selling. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. So she would like to ask for a loan to buy more vegetable to enlarge her business activities. Her husband, Mr. Preap BunthoE., 40, works as a body guard. With both their  businesses, they are able to earn a good income to support their family. This couple has a child who is 2 years old.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to enlarge her business activities.

loans.name: Beatrice Jepkorir

texts.en:
Beatrice Jepkorir C. is 23 years old, married. They have one child who is three years. There residential place is in Kapsowar, in Eldoret Town. Beatrice sells second hand clothes and has been in this business for the past two years. She earns a monthly profit of Kshs.10,000.

Beatrice learned about KADET LTD through marketing awareness done in the area. She is applying for her second loan of  60,000 Ksh. from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to buy six bales of second hand clothes. With the anticipated profits, she plans to save and purchase a plot of land.

In future Beatrice wishes to expand her business and also built rental houses. Her deeper desire is to see her child realizing their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy six  bales of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Risa Ole

texts.en:
Risa, 24 years old, has been rearing and selling animals in Naivasha town for the last two years.  He says the business has been profitable.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy goats and sheep which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

In future, Risa hopes to open a wholesale shop in Naivasha town which will supplement his livestock income.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Nhoung

texts.en: Mrs. Nhoung R. is a 40-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Tom Province. Nhoung R. is married to Mr. Chan Lorn, age 40. This couple, who work together in the farming business, has given birth to three children, all of whom are single. Due to the coming harvesting season, Mrs. Nhoung R. should generate around $2.33 of profit a day to meet the needs of her family. This is the rice harvesting season so Mrs. Nhoung R. needs capital to purchase many sacks of rice to store. She will sell them when the rice is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: To purchase many sacks of rice to store. She will sell them when the rice is commanding the highest price.

loans.name: Lekiremu Ole

texts.en:
Lekiremu, who is 42 years old, married to Lungat Ene Lekiremu and the father of three children, has been rearing animals for sale in Niavasha town for the last two years. He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash to buy 10 calves which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Lekiremu hopes to buy a truck to transport his animals to the market when he wants to sell them.

loans.use: To buy 10 calves which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie M. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (five orphaned nephews and nieces).  Sophie has a business that sells Bitenge African Attire, batiks and dresses.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Sophie sells her products from home, by means of wholesale/retail.    

Sophie has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO that she will use to buy rolls of African attires and dresses.  She also generates additional income through part time work as a nurse and councilor in Kampala city council.  The main business challenges for Sophie include thieves and licenses.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a permanent business premise in Kampala city.  Sophie lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of African attires and dresses.

loans.name: Altanhuu

texts.en:
Altanhuu A. is 42 years old and lives with his wife and four daughters in Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. The family all live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His younger daughter, age 10, attends a local secondary school and the youngest daughter is in kindergarten, while his wife cares for the family’s livestock herd.

Altanhuu is also a herder and operates a mobile dairy trading business that prepares and sells milk in the local community.  After many years of running his business Altanhuu has gained a reputation amongst his customers as a reliable supplier of milk.  He sells a high quality of milk and therefore his sales are very good.  Herding and raising livestock is a difficult job that requires a lot of persistence from the herder.  Altanhuu is a very clever and hardworking man and says, " Further, I would like to continue to herd our livestock and live well."  Altanhuu is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase hay in order to feed his livestock.

loans.use: To purchase hay to feed his livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old married woman from Lebanon.  She has many years of experience working with mobile phones.  She began as an employee in a mobile phone shop and opened her own store four years ago.  She got married recently and she is planning to have a child with her husband after improving her life situation. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve her shop by adding new décor and adding new merchandise consisting of new mobile phones and rechargeable cards to her shop. The majority of mobile phone users in Lebanon purchases these prepaid cards; it is less common to have an annual phone contract. In the future, she is looking to further expand her business and increase her capital.

loans.use: To improve her shop by adding new décor and adding new merchandise consisting of new mobile phones and rechargeable cards to her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To organize a wedding party.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza M. lives in the Kyebando Nsooba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has 6 children, three of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (a grandson). Tereza has a business of rearing chicken. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Tereza sells her products from home, by means of wholesale and retail.  

Tereza has requested for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bags of chicken feed. She also generates additional income through hair plaiting.The main business challenge(s) for Tereza include seasonality and poultry diseases. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own 2000 laying chickens. Tereza lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed.

loans.name: Sao's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four low-income people who live together in Siem Reap province. Sao S., age 24, has been selected to be the leader of the group. Sao S.'s husband is a local fisherman. This couple has been married for many years, and they have only one child who is still studying in school. She and her husband have been living O. a fishing boat O. the river for a few years. They always get up every morning, drive their boat towards the middle of the river, and then fish. After fishing is done, they hurry to bring their fish to the busy market and sell to the regular buyers. Sao S. will use his loan to purchase some fishing implements for fishing.

The other three borrowers include: 
Mrs. O., a fish porter, who is asking for a loan to repair her broken house.
Mrs. S. will use this loan for repairing her broken house.
Mr. M. is applying for a loan to buy housing material for mending his old house.

loans.use: To purchase some fishing implements for fishing.

loans.name: Tinyoya

texts.en:
Tinyoya has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town for the past two years. She is 24 years old, married to Samson Mutura and they have two children.

Tinyoya was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the cash to buy three cows which he will sell later at a profit during the peak season.

In future, Tinyoya hopes to open a retail shop in Naivasha town to supplement his income from livestock farming.

loans.use: To buy three cows which he will sell later at a profit during the peak season.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 38-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is the father of 3 school-aged children. He has many years of experience working as a sanitary man repairing toilets, faucets etc. He works on a freelance basis upon request of the clients. In addition, He takes home projects and finalizes all the sanitary work on it.  Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his business level and to purchase new repairing tools needed for his business purposes. He has the opportunity to expand his business into other areas and he needs to be equipped with all the materials needed. In the future, he hopes that he will be able to open a small sanitary shop. He will provide the project entrepreneurs with the materials and the manual labor.

loans.use: To purchase new repairing tools.

loans.name: Lukiya

texts.en:
Lukiya N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, three of whom are in school.  Lukiya has a business of selling second and new clothes. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Lukiya sells her products from home, by means of wholesale and retail.  

Lukiya has requested for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand clothes. She also generates additional income through brick laying. The main business challenge(s) for Lukiya include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing clothes herself. Lukiya lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity but has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.ar: مصطفى في عمر 43 سنة متزوج وعنده  ولدان يحب اولاده وعائلته كثيرا يعمل بجد ونشاط  لديه باص لنقل الطلاب  له في عمله ما يقارب 13 سنة يحب عمله ويسعى الى تطوير نفسه وتأمين كل احتياجات عائلته يريد من خلال اخذ قرض من المجموعة الى شراء فان جديد لتوسيع مصلحته  مستواه التعليمي متوسط لذلك يريد ان يحسن وضعه المادي والاجتماعي ومساعدة اولاده على استكمال تعليمهم زبائنه هم من جيرانه واصدقائه طموح وجدي جدا بعمله وملتزم من حيث تاريخه السابق مع  المجموعة.
texts.en: Moustafa is a 43-year-old husband and father of two who has for the past thirteen years been working diligently and proactively bussing students from the families of his friends and neighbors. Moustafa wants to further advance himself and be able to meet all the needs of his family, whom he loves very much. Accordingly, he is seeking a loan from Al Majmoua for a new van to further expand his business. His own educational attainment being modest, Moustafa wants to further improve his financial situation and help his children complete their schooling. Moustafa is very ambitious and earnest in his work, and furthermore very faithful to his commitments, as demonstrated by his history with Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase a new van to expand business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is the father of one young child. He has ten years of experience working as a sanitary man repairing toilets, faucets, etc. and also as an electrician. He works independently on a freelance basis, upon request of the clients. In addition, he takes small projects home and finalizes all the sanitary and electric work on it. He is the main income provider for his housewife and his baby. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase an electric power puncher and a compressor. In the future, he is planning to expand his business into other areas and taking bigger projects.

loans.use: to purchase an electric power puncher and a compressor.

loans.name: Phylis

texts.en:
Phylis is a single woman with one child who attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated her M-pesa (Mobile money transfer) business for four months. Her potential customers are passersby and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of theft in her place of operation. Phylis hopes to open two more branches of mobile money transfer services in the future. 

She decided to join Yehu to get loans to modify her business. With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase a money float for mobile transfer services and airtime cards for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a money float for mobile money transfers and airtime cards for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 55-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is the father of five children, two of whom are still attending school. He is the main income provider for his family. He has twenty years of experience working as a farmer. He has been running his own farm since 1995. He is specialized in cultivating bananas and citrus fruits. He uses plastic tents to grow his products. These tents also allow him to better monitor product quality as well as grow his products for more months during the year. He works independently in his business. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform maintenance for the irrigation system on his land. In the future, he is planning to add other type of vegetables and fruits to his farming.

loans.use: To perform maintenance for the irrigation system on his land.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia N. lives in Kyebando neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has six children, three of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). Olivia owns a retail business. She has been in this business for more than ten years, and she works seven days out of every week. Olivia sells her products from home. Olivia has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap. She also generates additional income through vegetable farming. The main business challenge for Olivia is seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to sell wholesale, which she believes will improve her standard of living. Olivia lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity, but she does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more soap, salt, and sugar

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Shodibek

texts.ru: Алиев Шодибек проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Вместе со всей семей занимается животноводством. Он в основном разводит мелка - рогатый скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 4 года. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en: Shodibek A. lives in the Varzob district.  He is 36 years old, married and has 5 children.  He has a secondary education.  Shodibek and his family are involved in animal husbandry.  He primarily breeds small livestock.  He has been involved in this business for 4 years.  Shodibek is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old married Lebanese man who is the main income provider for his household. He has seven years of experience working with tires. Since 2008, he has been running his own tire shop where he sells new tires and repairs old tires. He works independently in his business and has built a good reputation and become well known in his town. 

This man is requesting a loan of $1200 from the Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new wholesale tires to sell. In the future, he would like to continue to expand his business and increase his productivity. He expects that his business will continue to be successful in the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase tires

loans.name: Alamakan

texts.en:
Alamakan M. is a very energetic and hardworking woman who is married and has three children.  She started her business in 2000 to find a means of supporting her family. With an initial sum of only 3,000 KGS, she began selling drinks in the street near the local market. Her persistent efforts increased her business and she now earns about 10,000 KGS a month.    

Alamakan has requested a loan of 45,000 KGS to increase the range of food products she offers. She will purchase vegetable oil, sugar, and salt. With her increased revenue, she plans to expand her business and provide a good dowry to her daughter. In the future, her dream is to buy a car for her son to help him with his own transportation business. Alamakan believes in the prosperous future of her family and does her best to make this dream come true. 

About Bai-Tushum:

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. It uses Kiva funding to target especially vulnerable populations. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that leads to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable oil, sugar, and salt

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 41-year-old married woman from Lebanon. A mother of one school-aged child, she has been running a clothing store for the past three years. She used to sell clothes from her home and door-to-door almost ten years ago. She only sells kids clothes. She cooperates with her husband, who works as jeweler, to satisfy the household expenses. She has obtained her first Kiva loan and she is thankful for the results. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.. With this loan she will expand her store’s inventory to offer a variety of children’s winter clothes. She says the loan will help her diversify her merchandise selection. In the future, she is hoping to also sell shoes from her store because now she mostly sells clothing.

loans.use: To expand her store’s inventory

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Хусаинова Зарина проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 32 года. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Муж на заработках в России. Сама Зарина имеет среднее образование. После отъезда мужа занялась бизнесом. Сейчас она арендует торговую точку на центральном рынке района, где продает детскую и женскую одежду. Зарина в основном привозит товар из города. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 4 года. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Zarina H. lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 32 years old, married and has 2 children.  Her husband works in Russia.  Zarina has a secondary education.  She started her own business after her husband left for work.  Currently, she leases a retail outlet at the district's central market, where she sells children's and women's clothing.  Zarina primarily brings her merchandise from the city.  She has been involved in this business for 4 years.  She is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Nancy Wangari

texts.en:
Nancy has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  She is 35 years old, married to Geoffrey Mathenge and they have two children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her third loan.  She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and pay for labor.

In the future, Nancy hopes to buy more land and practice farming on a large scale.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
La Sra. Agustina tiene 40 años, esta casada con Augusto Baez Garcete y tienen tres hijos. 
Ella es propietaria de una despensa, anexo librería y fotocopias desde el año 1997 en su domicilio.
Inicialmente solo tenía una despensa modesta, poco poco fue equipando su negocio y aumentando su stock de mercedarias.
 Como ella es vecina de un colegio, incursiono en la librería lo que tuvo mucho éxito y se vio en la necesidad de adquirir una fotocopiadora por la cantidad de pedidos que tenia. 
Necesita de este crédito para culminar los detalles de la ampliación de su local, pues por la cantidad de clientes que debe atender sintió la necesidad de construir un salón mas amplio. 
 Ella desea brindar el mayor bienestar a sus hijos y poder garantizarles una buena educación para que puedan ser personas de bien en  la sociedad y lograr sus objetivos en la vida.
texts.en:
40-year old Sra. Agustina is married to Augusto Baez Garcete, and they have three children.

Agustina has owned a store with an adjacent school supply and photocopier business since 1997. When she first started, she had a simple store but gradually it grew as she added more stock.

As there is a high school close by, she started selling school supplies with much success. Then she saw the demand for photocopies and bought a photocopying machine. Now Agustina needs a loan to complete the extension to her store. Her increased customer base has meant that she needs larger premises.

She wishes to provide a better standard of living for her children and be able to promise them a good education so that they will grow to be upstanding citizens and fulfill their goals.

loans.use: to buy construction material to complete the expansion of her business

loans.name: Hamidou Ousmane

texts.fr:
Né le 19 Octobre 1988 à Zégoua (frontière Mali-Côte d’Ivoire), Monsieur Hamidou Ousmane D. est un célibataire sans enfant résidant chez son cousin à Sanoubougou II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Hamidou Ousmane D. n’ayant pas eu la chance de progresser dans les études, il s’est très vite initié à cette activité d’achat et vente des téléphones portables et leurs accessoires (façades, batteries, chargeurs, écouteurs, etc.) il y a maintenant dix ans. Son activité est menée dans sa propre boutique à la gare routière de Sikasso avec une clientèle composée essentiellement des voyageurs et surtout des transporteurs. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il bénéficié d’un premier prêt qui fut correctement remboursé. Ainsi, il sollicite un deuxième prêt lui permettant d’acheter à Bamako 24 téléphones portables de marques différentes, 3 cartons de façades, 25 chargeurs, 20 paquets de carte mémoire, 5 cartons de batterie, 5 douzaines d’écouteurs, une dizaine de montres différentes, des ceintures, etc. 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 230 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born on October 19, 1988 in Zégoua (on the border of Mali and Côte d’Ivoire), Mr. Hamidou Ousmane D. is a single man without children, who lives with his cousin in Sanoubougou II, one of the popular neighborhoods in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region in the Republic of Mali).  Hamidou Ousmane D. never had the chance to progress in his studies, so he quickly joined the business of selling cellular phones and their accessories (cases, batteries, chargers, head-sets, etc.), and has been doing so for ten years.  His business is run from his own small shop at the bus station in Sikasso with a clientele made up mostly of travelers and especially transporters of goods.  He is sought out by his clients for the high quality of his products.

With the goal of better serving his growing clientele, he decided to work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom he profited from an initial loan which was entirely paid back.  As such, he is seeking a second loan which will allow him to purchase 24 cell phones of various brands, three boxes of cases/face plates, 25 chargers, 20 bundles of memory cards, five boxes of batteries, five dozen head-sets, and a dozen different holsters, belts, etc. from Bamako.

With this loan, he looks to earn monthly profits of 230,000 FCFA which will be used primarily for family expenses, to pay the interest on his loan, and to invest the remainder in his business.

loans.use: To buy cellular phone accessories

loans.name: Drissa

texts.fr:
Né le 10 Janvier 1983 à Sikasso, Monsieur Drissa T. est marié et vit dans une famille traditionnelle élargie à Kaboïla II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Drissa T. N. n’ayant pas eu la chance de progresser dans les  études s’est initié à cette activité d’achat et vente des téléphones portables et leurs accessoires  (façade, batterie, chargeur, écouteur, etc.) il y a environ trois ans. Son activité est menée dans sa propre boutique au grand marché de Sikasso avec une clientèle composée de toutes les couches sociales et surtout de forains. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ une année. Il a bénéficié d’un premier prêt qui a été correctement remboursé. Dans le but de mieux relancer cette activité, il sollicite ainsi un deuxième prêt qui lui permettra d’acheter à Bamako 15 téléphones portables de marques différentes, 2 cartons de façades, 20 chargeurs, 18 paquets de carte mémoire, 4 cartons  de batterie, 2 douzaines d’écouteur, etc. 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 190 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Born January 10, 1983 in Sikasso, Mr. Drissa T. is married and lives in an extended traditional family in Kaboïla II, a popular neighborhood of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

Having not had the opportunity to pursue studies, Drissa T. (No. 2) started to buy and sell mobile phones and accessories (faceplates, batteries, chargers, earphones, etc.) about three years ago. He runs his business out of his own shop at the big market of Sikasso. His clientele consists of all walks of life, and especially fair goers. He is in high demand due to the quality of his products.

In order to better serve a steadily increasing customer base, he turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso about a year ago. He received a first loan, which was fully reimbursed. 

Wishing to strengthen his activity, he is seeking a second loan to buy more merchandise in Bamako including 15 different brands of mobile phones, 2 cartons of faceplates, 20 chargers, 18 packs of memory cards, 4 cartons of batteries, 2 dozens sets of earphones, etc.

With this loan, he expects to earn a monthly profit of 190,000 FCFA, which will be used primarily to bolster his business, help with the family expenses, and pay the interest on the loan.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Somoina Ene

texts.en:
Somoina O., aged 42, trades livestock in Bissil market in Kajiado, which is a busy market. She sells her livestock to the Kenya meat commission, Kajiado butchers and the people in Kitengela. She is married to Lepatu, who is a farmer, and together they have three children aged 20, 18 and 14 years.

Somoina was introduced to KADET LTD by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office. She has been running her livestock trading business for 10 years and she gets a monthly profit of 4,000 KES.

With the 20,000 KES loan, Somoina plans to use 10,000 KES to buy cows, 5,000 KES to buy goats and 5,000 KES to buy sheep all for trading. If the loan boosts the business, she will start supplying her cattle directly to the Kenya meat commission.

Somoina’s dream is to buy a pickup for transporting meat to Nairobi and cattle to the Kenya meat commission. She describes herself as hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: To buy cows, goats and sheep for trade

loans.name: Fousseni

texts.fr:
Né le 1er Mai 1969 à Sikasso Monsieur Fousseni T. est marié et père des 4 enfants résidant dans la grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Kaboïla II, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur T. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initié à cette activité de sonorisation depuis plus de 5 ans dont il dispose à la fois un discothèque et une salle de jeu devant le domicile. Il est beaucoup  sollicité  surtout lors des cérémonies de mariages, baptêmes, anniversaires, etc. En plus de sonorisation, il dispose un téléviseur avec lequel les jeunes viennent se divertir avec le jeu Play-Station.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire cette clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a  une année environ avec laquelle il a bénéficié d’un premier prêt individuel. Il sollicite un deuxième prêt pour pouvoir améliorer ses prestations de services en achetant, au Ghana  d’autres matériels supplémentaires à savoir un ordinateur pour le graver des sons et images, TV,Mine Chaîne, DVD, etc. 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 215 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour  contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born on May 1, 1969 in Sikasso, Mr. Fousseni T. is married and the father of four living in a traditional extended family in Kaboila II, a central district of the town of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali).

After trying many activities without success, Mr. T. went into the sound production business over five years ago. He has a discotheque and a   game room in front of his living quarters. He is very sought after for weddings, baptism, anniversaries, etc. In addition, he owns a TV set, and children come to him to play Playstation games on this TV.

In order to better meet the growing customer demand, about a year ago he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and already obtained one individual loan in the past. He is now seeking a second loan in order to improve his scope of services and to purchase in Ghana other necessary equipment, such as a computer with a CD and DVD recorder, a TV, a mini Hi-Fi system, DVDs etc. With this loan, he plans to achieve a monthly revenue of 215,000 West African Francs, which will be used to contribute to the family budget, pay off the interest on his loan and reinvest the rest in his business.

loans.use: Purchasing electronic appliances

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Agé de 38 ans, Monsieur Mamadou C. est marié et père de 2 enfants, il réside avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle avec ses parents et ses frères à Wayerma, un des quartiers péripheriques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Mamadou C. a grandi dans le domaine de la Quincaillerie puisque c’est le seul métier  de la famille depuis le temps de son père. Donc il connaît la quincaillerie en détail mais les moyens lui font défaut pour pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter. Il décida alors de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son deuxième prêt, le précédent ayant été remboursé par anticipation. Alors ce présent prêt lui permettra d’acheter 15 boîtes de peinture de 4kg, 14 cartons d’ampoule économique et quelque unités de colle, de baguettes, de fil, d’eau de javel, de grésil, de disjoncteur, etc. Ses achats sont faits au Ghana et en Côte d’Ivoire avant de les revendre en détail dans sa quincaillerie à une clientèle composée généralement de constructeurs de maison (architectes, entrepreneurs, maçons, etc.).
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 270 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mamadou C., 38, is married with two children, he lives with his wife and children in a large traditional family with his parents and brothers in Wayerma, an outlying district of the city of Sikasso (third regional administration of the Republic of Mali).
Mamadou C. grew up in the business of hardware, since his father started this family business. So he has a very good knowledge of the business, but he does not have the means to respond to the growing demand of his customers. He decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and from them he is receving his second loan; the previous one has been fully repaid. This loan will allow him to buy 15 paint cans of 4kg each, 14 cartons of energy-saving bulbs and some units of glue sticks, yarn, bleach, sleet, circuit breaker, etc.. His purchases are made in Ghana and Ivory Coast and he resells the products in detail in his hardware store to customers, generally home builders such as architects, contractors, masons, etc..
He expects to make through this loan a monthly profit of 270 000 FCFA which will be used primarily to improve his business, to contribute to family expenses and to pay interests on the loan.

loans.use: To purchase household goods

loans.name: Salankat Ole

texts.en:
Salankat has been rearing animals for sell in Niavasha for the last two years. He is 37 years old, married to S. Ene Lepinguiki, and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash to buy five calves, each at 5,000 KES, that he will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Salankat hopes to open a butcher shop from where he will be selling meat.

loans.use: To buy five calves

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Antonio trabaja con Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 1996, el es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable,  anteriormente pagaba su cuota en forma semanal  por esa razón tiene con nosotros  varios  créditos.
Gracias a su buena administración obtuvo buenas  ganancias que le ayudaron a ampliar su local comercial y su vivienda.
 Con este crédito piensan comprar algunos elementos de trabajos y el saldo usara  para  materia prima especialmente para abastecer las necesidades de fin de año, como siras, cervezas, vinos, lácteos y otros.
Su deseo más adelante es el de trabajar a mayor escala y poner una Confitería en un lugar más céntrico y de mayor  tránsito.
texts.en:
Antonio has been working with Fundación Paraguaya since 1996.  He is a very hard-working and responsible person.  He used to make his loan repayments weekly which is why he has a number of loans from us.

Thanks to his good management, he has obtained good profits which have helped him to expand his commercial premises and his house.

He plans to use this loan to buy some work items and the balance will be used to buy materials to supply end-of-year needs such as cider, beer, wine, dairy products, etc.

His wish for the future is to work on a bigger scale and to set up a patisserie in a more central location with more traffic.

loans.use: To buy merchandise: beer, soda, wine, dairy products and cider.  Products which sell well over the end-of-year season

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose D. is currently in the business of selling beans, fish, simsim and millet along Maridi road. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of millet and beans to sell. Rose is 30 years old and is married to a mechanic. She has 4 children; 2 of which go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a new type of business of selling clothes.

loans.use: To stock more bags of millet and beans to sell

loans.name: Barcilisa

texts.es:
La  Sra. Barcilisa tiene 41 años ,es madre de tres hijos menores  y esta casada con el Sr. Eugenio Nuñez.
Ella se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir para dama ,caballeros y niños ,luego de haber  trabajado varios años con un pariente logro montar un  pequeño taller con la ayuda de su cónyuge quien trabaja vendiendo frutas y verduras por la calle.
Ellos ya tienen buena clientela formada y necesitan de este crédito para la compra de telas en cantidad por los pedidos que tiene en esta temporada y las fiestas que se aproximan. 
Barcilisa    desea  abrir un salón y exhibir sus prendas  .
texts.en:
Mrs. Barcilisa is 41, married to Mrs. Eugenio Nuñez, and they have three children.
She makes clothing for women, men, and children.  After having worked for some years with a relative, she was able to open a small workshop with her husband’s help.  He is a street vendor of fruit and vegetables.

She now has customers and she needs the loan to buy fabric in quantity for the orders that she has for this season and for the holidays that are coming up.  Barcilisa would like to open a store to display her clothing.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers and embroidered edging

loans.name: Viola

texts.en: Viola N. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, onions, and cabbages in the market and is requesting a loan to stock more onions and tomatoes to sell. Viola is 21 years old and is married to a business man. She has no children yet. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a grocery.

loans.use: To stock more onions and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah M., aged 26, runs a retail shop in Bissil market where she sells maize, sugar, beans and cooking oil/fat. Her customers are Bissil livestock traders and people from the neighboring area. She is married to Enoch Nzau and together they have two children aged seven and four. She was introduced to KADET by the credit officer.

Peninah has been running this business for two years and makes a monthly profit of Kshs 24,500. With the loan she will buy maize, beans, cooking oil and sugar to increase the stock in her shop. If the loan boosts her business, she will open up a grain shop and specialize in selling grains.

In the future, Peninah dreams of supplying grain, wholesale, from rural areas to urban areas. Peninah describes herself as hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. operates a retail shop where she sells items such as bags of sugar and salt. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice, beans and sugar to sell. 

Grace is 24 years old and is married to a clerk. She has 3 children, 2 of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her shop.

loans.use: to stock more bags of rice, beans and sugar

loans.name: Edith Wawira

texts.en:
Edith Wawira, aged 33, is married to Elias N.. They have three children: a son in grade one, and two daughters in grade five and nursery school. She sells clothes at Syokimau Estate. Her husband is a driver. Syokimau is a busy market a few kilometres from Nairobi. She sells her clothes to lorry drivers and passengers in transit.

Edith was introduced to Kadet by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office. She has been running her business for the past two years and makes a monthly profit of Kshs 10,800.

With the loan she wants to buy more clothes for sale. If the loan boosts her business, she will open a boutique and buy a piece of land were she will construct commercial houses.

Edith, who describes herself as hardworking and focused, dreams of having a big textile store and rental houses in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes K. runs a business selling beans and rice at the market. She is requesting a loan to buy more stock to sell. Agnes is 26 years old and is married to a builder. She has 2 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to stock more beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La Sra. Blanca esta casada con el Sr. Jose  Oviedo ellos tienen 2 hijos menores .
Blanca empezó trabajando como ayudante de cocina en un restaurante de donde aprendió el oficio, ella ahora se dedica exclusivamente a la repostería con la ayuda de su cónyuge ,tienen  una buena clientela formada en el barrios donde vive y sus alrededores ,gracias al  esfuerzo y dedicación logran mantener a su familia con este trabajo .
El crédito será de gran ayuda para la compra de  mercaderías  en cantidad y así abaratar el costo. 
Blanca    anhela poder construir un salón y ofrecer mejor servicios a sus cliente.
texts.en:
Blanca is married to Mr. José Oviedo; they have two minor children.

Blanca started working as a kitchen helper in a restaurant where she learned the occupation.  Now she is exclusively into pastry making with help from her spouse.  They have a good customer base in their neighborhood and surrounding areas. Thanks to their effort and dedication they manage to support their family with this work.

The loan will be of great help to buy merchandise in quantity thus reducing their costs.

Blanca dreams with building a banquet hall to offer better customer service.

loans.use: For pastry sales.

loans.name: Morring

texts.en: Morring R. runs a business selling tomatoes, onions and beans. She is requesting a loan to buy more stock to sell. Morring is 29 years old and is married to a businessman. She has 1 child who goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to stock more onions and beans to sell

loans.name: Pereza

texts.en: Pereza M. is currently in the business of selling fish only at the market  and is requesting a loan to stock more fish and tomatoes to sell.  Pereza is 40 years old and is married with a husband who is a church leader. She has 5 children and her children all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business

loans.use: To stock more fish and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary K.  is currently in the business of selling fish at the market  and is requesting a loan to stock cooking oil, tomatoes etc to sell.  Mary is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a government staff worker. She has 3 children and her children all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: To stock cooking oil, tomatoes etc to sell.

loans.name: Hamzah

texts.ar: حمزه عمره 27 سنة  متزوج ولديه ولدان طموح يعمل في مجال تجارة السيارات منذ اكثر من 10 سنوات تاريخه الاقتراضي في المجموعة جيد جدا ملتزم  يحب عائلته ويريد لها التطور يهدف من خلال طلب  قرض من المجموعة  توسيع مصلحته وشراء سيارات جديدة  للمصلحة وهو محبوب جدا من محيطه واكثر زبائنه هم  اقاربه وجيرانه واصدقائه لأنه ملتزم بالعمل يواجه صعوبة في السيولة وقد اتيحت له فرصة الى جعل المصلحة خاصة له.
texts.en: Hamzah is a 27-year-old husband and father of two who loves his family and wants to help them advance. He has been working very determinedly as a car salesman for the past decade. His responsibleness has made him very well-liked by those he works with, with most of his customers coming from his relatives, neighbors, and friends. Enjoying an excellent credit history with Al Majmoua, Hamzah is now asking for another loan to purchase new automobiles to expand his business. He has an opportunity to acquire his own dealership, but is having problems with liquidity.

loans.use: To purchase new automobiles for car dealership.

loans.name: Nenisa

texts.en: Nenisa D. is currently in the business of selling fish, cooking oil, and tomatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more onions and jerry cans of cooking oil to sell. Nenisa is 28 years old and is married, with a husband that is a businessman. She has four children, three of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more onions and jerry cans of cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Nader

texts.ar: نادرعمره 28 سنة متزوج وليس له اولاد له خبرة واسعة بتلميع الكريستال لديه صعوبة مادية ومنافسة قوية في محيطه العملي يريد ان يطور نفسه ومصلحته لديه الالتزام التام بالتسديد وهو يطلب قرض من المجموعة بهدف توسيع عمله وتحسين وضع عائلته المادي يعمل ايضا في مجال البلاط  وله تسع سنوات في هذه المصلحة وله زبائن يتميز بعمله بالاتقان والالتزام وهو يهدف بالمستقبل ان يمتلك مصلحة خاصة به وهي مصلحة الكريستال والتلميع
texts.en: Nader is 28 years old.  He is married and has no children.  He has extensive experience in crystal polishing.  Nader faces financial challenges and strong competition within his field.  He hopes to be able to develop personally and enhance his business.  Nader is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to expand his business and improve his income and is fully committed to repaying this loan.  Nader also works in tiles. With nine years of experience in this field, he has managed to build a clientele.  He is very committed and aims to own his own crystal polishing business in the future.

loans.use: Tiles and crystal polishing

loans.name: Sayra

texts.en:
Sayra I. is 45 years old, single, and has three children.  Since her family has limited resources, Sayra is engaged in the bottle redemption business. She accepts empty bottles and resells them to large factories.  This activity, however, is not very stable and thus not always profitable.  In 2002, she decided to start her own business in cattle breeding.  She worked hard to develop her business and grew her monthly benefits to 4,000 KGS.  Now Sayra plans to use this loan of 60,000 KGS to purchase three bull calves which will allow her to earn income by means of livestock breeding.  In the future, she wants to give her children a good education.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.  Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan.  As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Leokadia

texts.en: Leokadia L. lives in the Kilokore neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children. Two of the children are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (a grandson). Leokadia has a bar business.  She has been in this business for eight years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Leokadia sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Leokadia has requested a loan of 600,000/- Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beers, sodas and jerycans of local gin. She also generates additional income through rental rooms. The main business challenge(s) for Leokadia include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to put up more rental rooms and also own a fully stocked bar. Leokadia lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity but she doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more beer, soda and local brew

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence K. is currently in the business of selling tea and rice in Thura market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice and sugar.  Florence is 24 years old and is married to a government staff member. She has one child who does not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: To stock more bags of rice and sugar

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty H. is currently in the business of selling beer and local brew and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Betty is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver. She has 5 children and 2 of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Khaled

texts.ar: خالد عمره 44 سنة لديه اربعة اولاد وزوجة يعمل في بيع القهوة والاكسبرس وايضا في مجال بيع السكاكر والزيوت والحبوب لديه رغبة في تحسين وضعه الاجتماعي  ووضع اولاده من خلال تأمين عيش افضل وتامين القوت اليومي لهم وهذا من خلال اخذ قرض من المجموعة لشراء مكنة اكسبرس قهوة وايضا مكنة ايس كريم لديه محبة من جميع محيطه وله زبائنه الخاصين ولديه تاريخ مشرف مع المجموعة انه ملتزم جدا وهو يرغب في فتح مصلحه خاصة له وتطوير نفسه .
texts.en: Khaled is 44 years old. He is married with four children.  To earn a living, Khaled sells coffee, espresso beans, sugar, oil, and grains.  He hopes to be able to enhance his sociA. standing through insuring a better living and securing daily income for his family. Khaled requests a loan from A. Majmoua to purchase espresso and ice cream machines.  Khaled is well-liked by those closest to him and has his own clientele.  He has established a good reputation with A. Majmoua due to his commitment.  He hopes to become a business owner and develop on a personA. level.

loans.use: Purchasing coffee machinery

loans.name: David Wathuko

texts.en:
David has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the past 10 years. He is 40 years old and is married to Damaris Wanja. They have five children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings, and to meet labour costs.

In the future, he hopes to use the anticipated profit to save and buy another piece of land to plant more potatoes; the climatic condition of this region is very favourable for potatoes.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potato seedlings, and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Pablo Fernando

texts.es:
Pablo de 29 años, es ebanista en un taller. Vive en una zona urbana llamada suburbio de Guayaquil y caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes. 

Su papa le enseño desde pequeño como hacer un mueble cuando creció y a la edad de 13 años empezó a realizar sus primeros muebles con ayuda de su papa. Después de un tiempo decidió que su profesión iba a ser ebanista en un negocio familiar. En la actualidad trabaja por contratos que le hacen sus clientes no tiene horario fijo porque trabaja con su papa en su propio taller. Hace puertas, anaqueles, juegos de salas, comedor etc. 

Para seguir con su negocio el quiere comprar con el préstamo pintura, laca, diluyentes para pinta muebles que tiene hechos. En el futuro quiere seguir trabajando como ebanista y ayudar a sus padres económicamente.
texts.en:
Pablo is 29 years old.  He is a cabinet maker and works in his own workshop.  He lives in an urban area which is considered a suburb of Guayaquil and is noted for the fact that the majority of its inhabitants are merchants.

His father taught him how to make furniture from an early age.  As he grew up, at the age of 13, he began to make his first pieces of furniture with his dad's help.  After a while he decided that his profession was going to be that of a cabinet maker in a family business.  He currently works from contracts that his customers make with him.  He doesn't work fixed hours because he works with his father in his own workshop.  He makes doors, shelves, living room sets, dining room sets etc.

To continue in his business he would like to use this loan to buy paint, lacquers and thinners to finish furniture which he has made.  In the future, he would like to continue working as a cabinet maker and help his parents financially.

loans.use: To buy paint, lacquer and thinner

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther N. runs a business selling rice, beans, sugar and cooking oil. She is requesting a loan to buy more stock of fish and bags of beans to sell.  Esther is 35 years old and is married to a businessman. She has 2 children who do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to stock fish and more bags of beans to sell

loans.name: Muyurina Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Muyurina inicia su ciclo Nro 20 con 15 socias. Maria es la Presidenta del Banco Comunal, tiene 28 años, es casada y tiene una niña D. 2 años. Maria se dedica a la crianza y venta D. animales menores como son cuyes, gallinas y chanchos, tambien realiza labores D. agricultura sembrando verduras como: col, lechugas, espinacas entre otros.
El préstamo que solicita Maria lo invertirá en la compra D. cebada para sus cuyes y afrecho para sus chanchos. Maria aprendió D. la crianza D. animales menores y siembra D. sus padres, ahora ella lo realiza independientemente con la ayuda D. su esposo, comercializa sus animales menores en los recreos D. Muyurina, los cuales tienen mucha demanda, las verduras que siembra las venD. en el mercado mayorista D. Nery García. Maria tiene en Finca 2 ciclos le gusta mucho las reuniones porque con ellas aprendió a ahorrar y trabajar. Su sueño es tener una granja D. cuyes y poder construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Muyurina communal bank is starting its 20th cycle with 15 members.  María, 28, is group President.  She is married and has a two-year-old daughter.  She raises guinea pigs, chickens and pigs and also farms vegetables like, cabbage, lettuce and spinach, among others.

The loan that María is requesting will be used to buy barley for her guinea pigs and bran for her pigs.  María learned how to raise small farm animals and farming from her parents.  Now, she works independently with her husband’s help.  She sells her animals, which are in high demand, in Muyurina’s markets and she sells the vegetables she grows in the Nery García wholesale market.

María has been with Finca for two cycles and she enjoys the meetings very much because she has learned how to save and work in them.  Her dream is to have a guinea pig farm and to be able to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy barley and bran.

loans.name: Edigina

texts.en:
Edigina is a married woman with two children who both attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She operates a business selling sacks door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high transportation cost of moving from door-to-door. She hopes to expand her business and sell wholesale in the future. 

Edigina decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase packaging sacks for resale and a solar panel for recharging phone batteries.

loans.use: To purchase packaging sacks for resale and a solar panel for recharging phone batteries.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño, tiene 43 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 24, 23 y 20 años. Se dedica a la comercialización de cereales y papa, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en comprar trigo, cebada, maíz, papa, arveja, abas, etc.
Faustina tiene un carro y acompañaba a su esposo transportando pasajeros a las ferias, asi comenzó a comprar papa y algunos cereales para su consumo, algunos parientes y amistades le hacían pedido y comenzó a vender, ahora los cereales que compra en las ferias los distribuye en los mercados de Playa Grau, Nery García Zárate, Magdalena.
Le gusta las reunions de su bancomunal porque ha aprendido a ahorrar, ser responsable y puntual. Su sueño es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios superiores y poder hacer el acabado de su casa.
texts.en:
Faustina is a member of the Communal Bank Retoño. She is 43 years old, married, and has 3 children who are 24, 23, and 20. She sells grains and potatoes. She is requesting the loan to buy wheat, barley, corn, potato, peas, beans, etc. 
Faustina has a car and accompanies her husband transporting passengers to fairs. That is how she began buying potatoes and some grains to use. Some of her relatives and neighbors started to take orders and she started selling. Now she distributes the grains she buys at the fairs in markets located in Grau Beach, Nery García Zárate, and Magdalena.
She likes the communal bank meetings because she has learned to save, be responsible, and punctual. Her dream is for her children to finish studying and finish their home.

loans.use: To buy wheat, barley, corn, potato, peas, beans, etc.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity bills.

For over ten years, she has operated a butcher shop, selling to neighbours and food vendors. Lydia faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the holiday season, the price for meat is very high, so fewer customers turn up. 

Lydia hopes to have a furnished well-equipped butcher shop. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business. With the Kshs 60,000 she wants to purchase ten pieces of windows, four pieces of doors and five bags of cement to renovate her butcher shop.

loans.use: To purchase ten pieces of windows, four pieces of doors and five bags of cement to renovate her butcher shop.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño, tiene 39 años, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos (21,17,15,13 años.
Gabriela se dedica  a la preparación y venta de alimentos (restaurante) tiene una concesión en el paradero de la Ruta No 6, su esposo se dedica a la elaboración de telares, carteras, tapices, cojines, etc.
Gabriela con el préstamo que solicita comprará, arroz, azúcar, aceite , fideos, papas verduras y todo lo necesario para la preparación de alimentos y una parte para la compra de lana para que trabaje su esposo e hijo.
Le gusta las reuniones de su bancomunal porque puede ahorrar, hay mucha solidaridad entre las socias, se ayudan cuando algunas de ellas tienen dificultades o problemas.
Le gusta las capacitaciones porque le hablan de negocios, salud, de como invertir su dinero, a no sobreendeudarse ya sabe como debe trabajar las juntas directivas.
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales y que tengan su propio negocio para que no sufran, le gustaría también tener un local donde pueda vender los trabajos que elabora su esposo pues ahora los intermediaros lo visitan y compran.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a member of the 'Retoño' community bank.  She is 39 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 4 children aged 21, 17, 15 and 13.

Gabriela makes and sells food (restaurant).  She has a concession at the bus stop of route number 6.  Her husband works with a loom making wallets, carpets, cushions etc.

Gabriela will use the loan which she is requesting to buy rice, sugar, oil, noodles, potatoes, vegetables and everything else she needs to prepare food.  The rest she will use to buy wool for her husband and son to work with.

She likes the meetings of her community bank because she can save and there is a lot of solidarity between the members.  They help each other when anyone has difficulties or problems.

She likes the training sessions because they talk about business, health, how to invest money and how not to get themselves too far into debt.  She now knows how boards of directors should work.

Her dream is for her children to be professionals and for them to have their own businesses so that they don't suffer.  She would also like to have premises where she can sell her husband's handicrafts as right now intermediaries visit them and buy from them.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, noodles, potatoes and vegetables

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria Luz es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño, tiene 32 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos (14,9,5 años).
María Luz, antes esperaba de su esposo, él se enfermo, lo operaron y ya no tenia ingresos porque el que aportaba la casa era él, una amiga le invito a ella y a su hermana a participar en las reuniones de bancomunal en Finca, ingresó y le dieron una semilla pequeña (crédito), con eso surtió un poquito de todo y se puso a vender en su casa y tuvo acogida pues la vecinas le compraban, al siguiente ciclo pidió un poquito más de semilla, en la actualidad vende en su casa abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, ganchitos, viaja a la ferias de la selva lleva abarrotes, verduras entre otros está contenta le va bien tiene, su esposo está mejor y se dedica  a la agricultura (siembran papa, cereales), los productos que sacan le lleva a las ferias y también lo vende en su tienda con el trabajo de la agricultura y sumado su trabajo se compraron un tractor que lo alquilan por horas.
a Maria Luz le gusta las reuniones de su bancomunal porque aprendió a trabajar y ahorrar, su sueño es comprarse un carro y poder llevar sus mercaderías a las ferias y construir su casa porque ya se compró el terrero.
texts.en:
María Luz, 32, is married and has three children (14, 9 and 5 years of age).  She is a member of the Retoño (Sprout) communal bank.

María Luz used to depend on her husband but he became ill and was operated on and had no income; he was the one who used to support the household.
