A friend invited her and her sister to participate in Finca’s communal bank meetings and they got a small seed loan that she used to stock a bit of everything and started selling from home.  Her neighbors started buying from her and her store was well received.

During the next cycle she asked for a slightly larger seed loan and she now sells groceries, vegetables, fruits and snacks from home.  She travels to the markets in the countryside to sell groceries and vegetables, among other things.

She is happy and does well.  Her husband is better and has been farming (they grow potatoes and cereals) which she sells in the markets and from her store at home.  With what they earned farming added to her funds from the store they bought a tractor that they lease out by the hour.

María Luz enjoys the communal bank meetings because she learned how to save and how to work.  Her dream is to buy a car so that she can transport her merchandise to the markets.  She wants to build her house, too; she already bought the lot.

loans.use: To buy groceries.

loans.name: Claudia Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. Claudia,  de 33 años de edad casada hace 11 años con el Sr. Edgar tienen  dos hijos una (niña de  9 años y un niño de 10 años, que se encuentran en edad escolar) viven en casa propia hace 2 años en el barrio Ferroviario. La Sra. Claudia se dedica  a la venta de abarrotes y venta de joyas hace  9 años. El crédito que se le otorgo a la señora Claudia  es para  Ampliar su negocio compra de (Cabina telefónica y tarjetas de telefónicas. La clienta manifestó su agradecimiento  dando gracias a la institución por haberle dado la oportunidad de crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Claudia, 33, has been married to Edgar for 11 years; they have two children (a girl, 9, and a boy, 10, who are school age).  They have lived in their own house in the Ferroviario neighborhood for the past two years.

Claudia has sold groceries and jewelry for the last 9 years.  The loan Claudia was granted is to expand her business by buying a telephone booth and telephone service cards.

She manifested her gratitude thanking the institution for granting her the opportunity to grow in her business.

loans.use: To buy a phone booth and phone service cards.

loans.name: Edward Nduati

texts.en:
Edward, 30 years old, has practised mixed farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the past eight years. He does crop farming and dairy farming at the same time.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy another cow for milk production.

In the future, Edward hopes to increase the number of cows he has so that he can produce milk on a larger scale and sell in bulk.

loans.use: To buy one dairy cow.

loans.name: Jose Juan De Dios

texts.es: El Sr.  José  vive la zona de Villa Obrajes ,es una casa donde el  y su familia  viven como cuidadores  ya que los dueños vienen solo  cada dos veces al mes , tiene una niña que esta en la escuela es su mejor inspiración y fuerza para trabajar por su familia , el sr. José es muy conocido en su trabajo el es transportista de la línea de minibuses  de sacaba, trabaja de lunes a sábado los domingos se dedica a su familia , el préstamo lo destinara para la compra de una radio de frecuencia para taxi , tiene un auto donde lo hará trabajar con un chofer , su sueño de don José es juntar dinero para la compra de un terreno y así tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
José lives in the Villa Obrajes zone in a house where he and his family live as caretakers since the owners only come twice a month.  He has a small daughter in school and who is his best inspiration and strength to work for his family.

José is very well known in his work in transportation in the Sacaba minibus line.  He works from Monday through Saturday spending Sundays with his family.

The loan will be used to buy a short wave radio for a taxi because he has a car that he will put into service with a driver.  José’s dream is to save enough Money to buy a lot in order to have his own house.

loans.use: To buy a short wave radio for a taxi.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina es socia del Banco Comunal tu Angel Lucy, es casada, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos (22,19,15 años).
Delfina se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para damas caballeros y niños como: pantalones, polos, casacas, camisas, chompas, etc. 
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en surtir su mercadería, ella viaja y compra en Gamarra de los mismos fabricantes.
Delfina comenzó con su negocio hace 20 años, trabaja con su esposo, antes se dedicaba a la venta de ropas interiores, calcetines y lo cambio por prendas de vestir tienen mas demanda, cuenta con un puesto propio en el mercado 12 de Abril.
Su vida ha cambiado desde que está en Finca, aprendió a ahorrar, a conocer sus derechos, desarrollo personal, sobre salud, la familia, negocio.
Su sueño es poder crecer en su negocio y tener su propia tienda comercial.
texts.en:
Delfina, 44, is a member of the Angel Lucy communal bank.  She’s married and has three children (22, 19 and 15 years old).

Delfina sells clothes for women, men and children like: pants, t-shirts, jackets, shirts, sweaters, etc.

She will use the loan to buy stock merchandise.  She goes to Gamarra to buy direct from manufacturers.

Delfina started her business 20 years ago.  She works with her husband.  She used to sell underwear and socks but changed to clothing items that are in higher demand.  She has her own stand in the 12 de Abril Market.

Her life has changed since she’s been with Finca.  She learned to save, to know her rights, to know about personal development, health, the family and business.

Her dream is to grow in her business and to have her own commercial store.

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria Luz es socia del Banco Comunal Tu Angel Lucy, tiene 41 años, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos (16-13-11-8). Maria Luz, se dedica a venta de polos y buzos para niños y adultos. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en comprar su mercadería, tiene demanda.
Maria Luz, antes se dedicaba a la venta de especería en forma ambulatoria, pero no se vendía a veces se malograba, decidió cambia por la venta de buzos y polos porque tiene bastante demanda sobre todo los fines de mes, sus compradores potenciales son del Programa Juntos.
Su sueño es abrir una tienda grande y ampliar más su mercadería, construir su casa propia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
M.ía Luz, 41, is a member of the Tu Ángel Lucy (Your Angel Lucy) communal bank.  She has a live-in partner and four children (16, 13, 11 and 8 years old).  M.ía Luz sells children and adult t-shirts and sweatshirts.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise; she has demand.

M.ía Luz used to sell spices itinerantly but sometimes she didn’t sell and went through hard times.  She decided to change to the sale of t-shirts and sweatshirts because she has quite a bit of demand, especially at the end of the month.  Her potential buyers are from the Programa Juntos (Government funded assistance program for the extreme poor).

Her dream is to open a big store and expand her inventory, to build her own house and that her children become professionals.

loans.use: To buy sweatshirts.

loans.name: Augusta Daniela

texts.es:
Daniela es socia del Banco Comunal Tu Angel Lucy, tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos (9 – 1 mes)
Daniela, solicita el crédito para aumentar su mercadería, ahora ya se acerca la campaña navideña comprará juguetes, panteones, leche, abarrotes en general.
Daniela comenzó a trabajar desde muy joven ayudando a su tía, viaja a Bolivia, Sicuani, Puno, comercializaban casacas de cuero, pero desde que tuvo a su hijita ya no puede realizar  viajes muy largos. 
Ahora se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general como: Arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, detergentes, etc. Estos productos los lleva a las ferias de la Selva se vende bien.
Le gusta las reuniones de su banco comunal porque puede ahorrar y su dinero gana intereses, sobre todo hay confianza es una institución seria.
En una oportunidad cuando fue a una de las ferias de la Selva Ayacuchana sufrió un asalto en el lugar denominado Tacuna.
Su sueño es construir su casa propia, cuenta con un terreno que le heredo su padre y tener un negocio propio en la selva.
texts.en:
Daniela, 30, is married and has two children (a nine-year-old and a one-month old); she is a member of the Tu Ángel Lucy communal bank.

Daniela is asking for funds to increase inventory now that the Christmas season is approaching.  She will buy toys, pants, milk and groceries.

Daniela started working with her aunt while still very young.  She would travel to Bolivia, Sicuani and Puno to sell leather jackets.  However, once her daughter was born she was no longer able to make long trips.

Now she sells general groceries like: rice, sugar, noodles, milk, detergents, etc.  She takes them to the markets in the jungle where they sell well.

She enjoys the communal bank meetings because she can save and her money earns interest.  Above all, there is trust because it’s a serious institution.

On one of the trips to a market in the Ayacucho jungle she was robbed in a place called Tacuna.

Her dream is to build her own house; she has a lot that she inherited from her father, and to have her own business in the jungle.

loans.use: To buy toys.

loans.name: Ruben Fernando

texts.es: El Sr. Rubén es el esposo de una cliente antigua de la institución muy responsable y de buena actitud el señor tiene un taller de tapicería de sillas, sillones y movilidades, atiende de lunes a sábado, también realiza los trabajos en su domicilio cuando tiene pedidos en cantidad con la ayuda de su esposa y de su hermano de vez en cuando, asimismo realiza trabajos a domicilios.  Tiene dos hijos los cuales son todavía bebés su esposa se dedica a la venta varios productos en tienda de barrio, también tiene su crédito en Bancos de Emprendimiento el cual esta cancelando puntual y sin dificultades, viven en un departamento en anticrético, ambos esposos son muy jóvenes y desean superarse con el tiempo, mas adelante desean comprar una movilidad.
texts.en: Mr. Rubén is the husband of a former client of the institution. Responsible and with a positive attitude he has an upholstery shop where he upholsters chairs, armchairs, and vehicles. He works from Monday to Saturday. He also works from home when he has orders with his wife’s help and ocasionaly his brother’s.  He has two children who are still babies. His wife sells items in a neighborhood grocery store. He also has a loan in “Undertaking” Bank which he is paying back punctually and without difficulty. They live in the Anticrético Department. The couple is very young and they wish to improve their lives as time goes by. In the future they wish to buy a vehicle.

loans.use: Buy material to upholster chairs, armchairs, etc. Other: fabric, wood, and other tools.

loans.name: Komlavi

texts.fr: Il est marié et père de 2 enfants. Il a 39 ans. Pour s'occuper de sa famille, il fait la vente de chaussure d'homme. Il exerce cette activité 3 ans deja. Il s'approvisionne en gros au grand marché de lomé et revend en detail au grand marché. Il sollicite ce pret pour accroitre sa marge beneficiaire.
texts.en: Komlavi D. is married and the father of two children. He is 39 years old. To provide for his family, he sells men's shoes. He has been in this business for three years already. He buys his shoes in bulk at the great market in Lomé and retails them at the same market. He applies for this loan to increase his profit margin.

loans.use: To buy men's shoes

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MERCAMUEBLE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Elizabeth; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de muebles, ella tiene un taller donde realiza muebles como mesas, sillas, camas y escritorios y después los vende en diferentes ferias, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de muebles. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar madera al por mayor.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
María Elizabeth, 29, lives with her life partner and two children.  She is a member of the “MERCAMUEBLE” communal bank located in Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She alternates her daily household chores with a furniture sales business.  She has a workshop where furniture like tables, chairs, beds and desks are made which are then sold in various markets.  She works from 7am until 7pm.  She wants to expand the business and is asking for funds to buy wood at wholesale.

She thanks all those who share in her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy wood at wholesale.

loans.name: Hermogenes

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MERCAMUEBLE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Hermogenes; el tiene 53 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 2 hijos; el socio se dedica a realizar diferentes tipos de muebles, el tiene una carpintería donde realiza sillas, mesas y camas y después los vende en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de Cusco, el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 a.m, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como madera, telas y pegamentos para hacer los muebles. 


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Hermogenes, 53, is single and has two children.  He is a member of the “MERCAMUEBLE” communal bank located in Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

He manufactures different kinds of furniture.  He has a carpentry shop where he makes chairs, tables and beds for subsequent sale in various markets in Cusco.  He works from 7am until 6pm.  He wants to expand the business and is asking for funds to buy such materials like: wood, fabric and adhesives to make the furniture.

He thanks all those who share in his dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy materials like wood, fabric and adhesives to manufacture furniture.

loans.name: Francisco Miguel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MERCAMUEBLE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Francisco Miguel; el tiene 35 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; el socio se dedica a realizar muebles como mesas, sillas y camas, el tiene un pequeño taller donde hace los muebles y después los vende en las ferias y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de muebles. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar madera al por mayor.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Francisco Miguel, 35, has a live-in partner and two children.  He is a member of the “MERCAMUEBLE” communal bank located in Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

He manufactures different kinds of furniture.  He makes chairs, tables and beds.  He has a small shop where he makes the furniture that he then sells in the markets.   He supports his children through this business.  He wants to expand the furniture selling business and is asking for a loan to buy wood at wholesale.

He thanks all those who share in his dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy wood at wholesale.

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas 1 Group

texts.es:
Lucia es una de los miembro del Grupo Mujeres Virtuosas 1, localizado en La ciudad de Hato Mayor, cuya economia depende de la agricultura y es una de las ciudades mas rurales de República Dominicana, en donde como muchas hay escasez de agua potable y de energía electrica y con una poblacion de dominicanos y emigrantes haitianos. Sus actividades principales son las ventas de alimentos en su colmado (una pequeña tienda de alimentos) y la venta de bizcocho. Lucia es madre de 7 hijos, de los cuales 5 viven con ella, siendo una madre divorciada. Nos dice que su reto o desafío más difícil es tener dinero suficiente para cubrir con las necesidades de su familia y su actividad favorita es atender su negocio.

Lucia está muy emocionada de recibir su segundo préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente su préstamo anterior y asi haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 5 años, el cual inició al recibir una herencia familiar y por su iniciativa de generar ingresos y ser util. Está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de un exhibidor o vitrina para colocar sus bizcochos y para comprar arroz, aceite, harina, vegetales, etc. para su pequeña tienda de alimentos. Planea utilizar sus ganancias para comprar una nevera y ahorrar. Su sueño es poder ver a sus hijos graduados de la universidad y poder vivir en una casa comoda.
texts.en:
Lucia is one of the members of the “Mujeres Virtuosas 1” (Virtuous Women 1) group, located in the town of Hato Mayor whose economy depends on farming.  It is one of the most rural towns in the Dominican Republic.  In this town, as in many others, there is a scarcity of potable water and electricity, and a population of Dominicans and Haitian emigrants.  Their principal economic activities are the sale of food in 'colmados' (small grocery stores) and the sale of sweet pastries.  Lucia is the mother of 7 children, 5 or whom live with her as she is a divorced mother.  She tells us that her most difficult challenge is having sufficient money to cover the needs of her family and her favorite activity is serving in her business.

Lucia is very moved by receiving her second loan from Esperanza Internacional, after having paid off her previous loan satisfactorily and thereby having taken a step towards the growth of her business.  She has had her business for around 5 years.  She set up her business when she received a family inheritance, through her own initiative for creating income and being useful.  She is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase of a display case to put her sweet pastries in.  She will also buy rice, oil, flour, vegetables, etc. for her small grocery store.  She plans to use her profits to buy a freezer and to save.  Her dream is to be able to see her children graduate from university and to be able to live in a comfortable house.

loans.use: To buy a display case and food

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MERCAMUEBLE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Cristina; ella tiene 56 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de muebles, ella hace diferentes tipos de muebles como mesas, roperos, juego de comedor y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar madera al por mayor.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Cristina is a member of the Communal Bank “Mercamueble”, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 56 years old, married, and has four children. Cristina divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling furniture. She makes different types of furniture such as tables, wardrobes, and dining sets. Through this business, her children are able to get ahead. Cristina wants to improve her business, so she is requesting a loan to buy wood in bulk.

She is grateful to those who have helped fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the established deadline.

loans.use: Purchase wood in bulk

loans.name: Carolina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carolina, reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután, vende atol y pan, tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, se dedica a la venta de atol y pan todos los días de la semana, trabaja con tres personas más que le ayudan  a vender, tiene ya 2 y medio de realizar esta venta y lo realiza de forma ambulante.
Actualmente solicita un  préstamo para la compra de leña, ya que esta se encarece y se le hace más fácil y económico comprarla por grandes cantidades  y si le alcanza el dinero también comprara ingredientes para preparar el atol, como por  ejemplo el Azúcar, esto le aumentara la producción y la oportunidad de tener mejor provecho de las ventas.
Carolina tiene como objetivo buscar la manera de atraer a más clientes para recibir mejores ingreses que le ayuden a solventar sus necesidades, quiere que su negocio prospere para darle estabilidad a su hogar.
texts.en:
Carolina resides in Jiquilisco, Department of Usulután. She sells corn porridge and bread. Carolina is 25 years old and lives with her husband and children. She sells porridge and bread every day of the week. Carolina works with three employees who help sell her products. She has been in business for 2½ years and works as a street vendor.

At the moment, Carolina is requesting a loan to purchase firewood because it is expensive. It is easier and cheaper to buy in large quantities. If there is money left over, she will also buy ingredients for making corn porridge such as sugar. This will increase her production and provide an opportunity to generate more sales.

Carolina aims to attract more customers so that she can generate more revenue to help meet her needs. She wants her business to prosper so that she can provide stability for her household.

loans.use: Purchase firewood

loans.name: Edidt

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MERCAMUEBLE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Edidt; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de muebles, ella hace diferentes tipos de muebles como mesas, sillas, camas y después lo vende en la feria de muebles que se llama mercamueble, ella atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar madera al por mayor.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Edidt is a member of the Communal Bank “Mercamueble”, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 33 years old, in a common law marriage, and has four children. Edidt divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling furniture. She makes different types of furniture such as tables, chairs, and beds and then sells them at the furniture fair called “Mercamueble”. Yolanda works from 8am to 6pm. She wants to improve her business, so she is requesting a loan to buy wood in bulk.

Edidt is grateful to those who have helped fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase wood in bulk

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MERCAMUEBLE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Reyna; ella tiene 22 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de muebles, ella hace diferentes tipos de muebles y luego los vende en las ferias de muebles llamado Mercamueble,ella trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de muebles. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar madera y pegamentos para su negocio.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Reyna is a member of the Communal Bank “Mercamueble”, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 22 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Reyna divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling furniture. She makes different types of furniture and then sells them at the furniture fair called “Mercamueble”. Reyna works from 9am to 7pm. She wants to expand her business, so she is requesting a loan to buy wood and adhesives for her business.

Reyna is grateful to those who have helped fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase wood & adhesives

loans.name: Luis Ramon

texts.es:
Don Luis, es agricultor, le gusta trabajar con la tierra sembrando maíz y hortalizas, tiene 56 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos que le ayudan a trabajar, residen en el Departamento de Usulután, este trabajo lo aprendió de su padre que era agricultor también, pero para mantener a su familia lo realiza desde hace aproximadamente  unos 36 años.
Don Luis se encuentra preparando los terrenos para realizar la siembra de esta temporada, pero no cuenta con los materiales para comenzar la siembra, por eso solicita un préstamo y con este poder comprar el abono, las semillas, y el tratamiento para plagas; con esta ayuda llevara a cabo la siembra y dará los cuidados necesarios durante el proceso de la siembra. 
Su propósito es tener los materiales necesarios para la siembra y que al final pueda recoger buena cosecha, también cancelar este préstamo de la mejor manera para crear un buen historial de crédito.
texts.en:
Don Luis is a farmer who enjoys working with the land by planting corn and vegetables. He is 56 years old and lives with his wife and two children who help with the work. They reside in the Department of Usulután. Luis learned his trade from his father, who was also a farmer. His family has been farming for approximately 36 years to support themselves.

Don Luis is preparing the land so that he can begin planting for this season, but he does not have the supplies to get started. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can buy compost, seeds, and treatments for pests. With this assistance, he will be able to proceed and provide the necessary care throughout the planting process.

His goal is to have the necessary supplies for planting so that he can achieve a good harvest. He plans to repay this loan properly so that he can establish a good credit history.

loans.use: Purchase compost, seeds, and treatments for pests

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MERCAMUEBLE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Srta. Honorata; ella tiene 31 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, ella atiende desde las 7:00 a.m hasta 10:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio ella está ahorrando y así mas adelante poder estudiar, la socia quiere implementar el restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, carne y verduras para cocinar.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Honorata is a member of the Communal Bank “Mercamueble”, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 31 years old and single. Honorata divides her time between her daily activities and managing her restaurant business. She prepares breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Honorata works from 7am until 10pm. Through her business, she is able to save and move forward with her studies. Honorata wants to keep her restaurant in operation, so she is requesting a loan to buy products such as rice, meat, and vegetables for cooking.

She is grateful to those who have helped fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase rice, meat, and vegetables

loans.name: Shameness Group

texts.en:
Kumba S. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kumba was born in Musaia village, in northern Sierra Leone about 53 years ago. She is married to a soldier and the couple has three children – two in primary school and one in secondary school.

Kumba has been a businesswoman for over two years now. She sells market food. With her share of this loan, she will buy gallons of palm oil (the most popular cooking oil) to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy palm oil to add to her business

loans.name: Santana

texts.es:
Doña Santana, reside en el Departamento de Usulután, tiene 41 años de edad, es comerciante de frutas, ella vive en compañía de sus hijos y es madre soltera.
Ella tiene su propio local donde vende las frutas desde hace 10 años, es una persona con experiencia en el comercio y sus hijos le ayudan a atender el negocio, actualmente ella quiere invertir en el negocio y comprar fruta de temporada pero no tiene las facilidades económicas para realizarlo es por tal razón que solicita un  préstamo y que este le dé la oportunidad de crecer con su negocio y dar una mejor atención a los clientes ofreciéndoles un amplio número y clases de frutas para todos los gustos.
Su objetivo es tener un negocio amplio y ofrecer a los clientes variedad de frutas para retenerlos y contar con su preferencia y de esta manera le estará dando mayor estabilidad a su actividad y a su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Santana resides in the Department of Usulután. She is 41 years old and works as a fruit vendor. Santana is a single mother and lives with her children.

She has managed her own fruit stand for the past ten years. Santana is experienced in this line of work and her children help with managing the business. She currently wants to invest in her business by purchasing seasonal fruit, but she does not have the financial resources to make this happen. For this reason, she is requesting a loan that will give her the opportunity to grow her business and provide better service to her customers. She will be able to offer them a greater number of fruits to cater to all tastes.

Her goal is to have a larger business and offer her customers a variety of fruits so that she can retain them and hold on to their business. This will provide more stability for her business and her family.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal fruit

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MERCAMUEBLE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Srta. Yolanda; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de muebles, ella vende muebles como sillas, camas y roperos en las feria de la ciudad de Cusco en un lugar llamado San Sebastian, ella trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar muebles al por mayor.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Yolanda is a member of the Communal Bank “Mercamueble”, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 29 years old and single. Yolanda divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling furniture. She sells furniture such as chairs, beds, and wardrobes at the city fair of Cusco in a place called San Sebastian. Yolanda works from 9am to 7pm. She wants to expand her business, so she is requesting a loan to buy furniture in bulk.

Yolanda is grateful to those who have helped fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the established deadline.

loans.use: Purchase furniture in bulk

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es:
Carlos reside en Jiquilisco, Departamento de Usulután, es empleado, tiene 22 años de edad, vive con su madre, sus primos y su hijo, el está soltero,  su madre es comerciante vende ropa desde hace 3 años, el trabaja pero también le colabora con las ventas y atendiendo a los clientes.
Carlos quiere ayudar a su madre es por eso que solicita un préstamo para comprarle ropa y que ella pueda tener más oportunidades de acrecentar sus ventas, él comprara ropa de colores y estilos de moda ya que son los más buscados por los clientes, con esta ayuda este negocio irá en aumento con mayor estabilidad y recibiendo ingresos mejores para solventar las necesidades diarias.
Él es de espíritu emprendedor por eso se preocupa por que el negocio de la familia crezca y les genere las ganancias para lograr una estabilidad económica que le permita tener mejores condiciones de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in Jiquilisco, Department of Usulután. He is 22 years old, single, and employed. Carlos lives with his mother, his cousins, and his son. His mother has been a clothing merchant for the past three years. In addition to his job, he also helps with making sales and attending to customers.

Carlos wants to help his mother, so he is requesting a loan to buy clothes so that she can have more opportunities to increase her sales. He will buy clothes in the colors and styles that are most requested by her customers. This assistance being provided to her business will improve its stability and result in more income to cover their daily needs.

Carlos is a spirited entrepreneur, but is still concerned about growing the family business and generating income to achieve financial stability. Meeting these goals will improve his family’s way of life.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his mother's clothing business

loans.name: Will Alfredo

texts.es:
Will de 28 años de edad, reside con su esposa y sus tres hijos  en San Francisco Gotera departamento de Morazán, sus hijos tienen las edades de 6, 5 y el último de meses de edad, se dedica las estructuras metálicas y posee un taller donde realiza todos sus trabajos. Will comenzó como empleado en un taller pero le surgió la idea de tener uno propio y dio inicio desde hace 3 años trabajando todo el día con la ayuda de algunos amigos a los que contrata para salir con todo el trabajo; su dificultad es que no cuenta con la solvencia económica para comprar hierro y almacenar en su inventario para estar preparado al momento que los clientes le soliciten trabajo.
Esta situación ha llevado a Will a solicitar un préstamo que le ayude a comprar los materiales para desempeñar su trabajo como hierro, lijas, pintura y discos para la pulidora, de esta manera el tendrá su inventario en buenas condiciones, listo para realizar cualquier trabajo en un momento determinado.
Su sueño es que sus hijos crezcan en buenas condiciones, que todos se preparen para seguir adelante con nuevas oportunidades, con el negocio su esperanza es seguir creciendo con entusiasmo.
texts.en:
Will is 28 years old and lives with his wife and three children in San Francisco Gotera, Department of Morazán. His two older children are six and five years of age, while the youngest is only a few months old. Will builds metal structures and has a workshop where he performs all of his work. He started out as an employee at another workshop until he came up with the idea to start his own business. Will established his business three years ago and hired some friends so that he could succeed in his work. His difficulty is that he lacks the financial resources to buy iron to maintain his inventory so that he can be ready whenever his customers need work performed.

This situation has forced Will to request a loan to help him buy the materials needed for his work such as iron, sandpaper, paint, and sanding disks so that his inventory will be well-stocked. These supplies will allow him to be ready to begin work at any given moment. His dream is for his children to grow up in a good environment and prepare them for new opportunities. With his business, Will hopes to continue growing with enthusiasm.

loans.use: Purchase iron, sandpaper, paint, and sanding disks

loans.name: Anselmo

texts.es:
Anselmo es un hombre, dedicado al trabajo, de edad ya avanzada, pero con mucho deseo de seguir creciendo en su joyería que logro poner hace varios años.
En donde vende en un mercado prendas de plata. Ha venido evolucionando gracias a los financiamientos que Afodenic ha dado e invertido más en plata y oro,  logrando pagar sus cuentas.
Ha tenido tiempos difíciles en enfermedad y gastado en sus medicamentos, lo que tiene poco inventario para realizar su trabajo, ya que él hace prenda y compra hecha también.
Con este préstamo invertirá prenda de platas, y prendas de oro, para seguir aumentando las ventas, y lograr mejores beneficios.
texts.en:
Anselmo is a man who is dedicated to his work.  Although he is older, he has a strong desire to continue to grow his jewelry business, a business that he started a number of years ago.

He sells silver accessories in a market.  The business has been developing thanks to financings provided by Afodenic, which he has invested in purchases of more silver and gold, so that he could manage to pay his bills.

He has had health problems and expenses for medications which have left him with little inventory for his business, since he both makes and buys the jewelry that he sells.  With this loan, he will invest in gold and silver jewelry so that he can increase his sales and achieve better earnings.

loans.use: he will invest in the purchase of silver and gold so that he can continue to increase his sales and achieve better earnings

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María M. F., tiene la edad de 29 años, está en unión libre  y tiene 4 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ella quiere comprar los abonos y los plaguicidas para el buen mantenimiento de su almacigo y la siembra del chile  para así mejorar sus próximas cosechas y obtener mayores ganancias de ellas. Además, su finca tiene sembrado chile y va sembrar una parte de café. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer como una productora de estos productos en la zona. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no ha tenido problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de sea una finca productiva y obtener ganancias. También, ella no ha realizados otros préstamos en bancos estatales pero  FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. Ella también tiene el deseo de brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida para su futuro y a su vez ir generando ganancias para seguir adelante con el proyecto y que llegue a ser una buena productora de estos productos.
texts.en: María is 29 years old, lives with her partner and has four children, who are her biggest priority. She wants to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to tend to her crops and to plant peppers to improve her upcoming harvests and earn more profits. She has planted peppers on her farm and is going to plant coffee in another portion. She has dedicated herself to her farm for a number of years and wants to grow as a producer in her area. This is the first loan she has received from Kiva partner FUDECOSUR. She has not had any problems with her property, but she desires to have productive lands and earn profits. She also has not taken out any loans from other banks, but FUDECOSUR provides the loan with more simplicity and much lower interest rates. She also wants to provide a better quality of life for her children in the future and keep generating profits to make headway with her farm and become a good producer of peppers and other products.

loans.use: Tend to her crops of peppers and other items

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia tiene 39 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 13 años se  dedica a la elaboración de ladrillos, siendo el suelo arcillosos su materia prima y por el cual lo consigue pagando un derecho de explotación de esta materia prima en terrenos ajenos. Ya en su fábrica y con la ayuda de sus hermanos se encargan de la elaboración y distribución de su producción a varios de sus clientes. Pero cuando requiere de mayor producción tiene que contratar mano de obra, ya que lo pedidos superan el millar. Durante este tiempo ha visto el progreso de su negocio, permitiéndole cubrir la educación de su hijos y por tal, desea continuar con este trabajo. Es su crédito numero 19 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que conocen de su persona que es responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en el pago del arrendamiento de una nueva área de terreno que posee una buena capa de suelo arcilloso y también en la compra de aserrín. Ya que estos son materiales indispensables para la fabricación de ladrillos.
texts.en: Lucia is 39 years old and lives with her three children in her own home. For the past 13 years she has made a living making bricks, using clay soil as her raw material. She pays for the right to extract it from lands far away. Her brothers help her in her factory and are in charge of making and distributing the products to various customers. When she needs to increase her production she has to hire workers, since the orders can be in the thousands. During this time she has seen her business progress, allowing her to cover her children's education, so she wants to continue with this work. This is her 19th loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she is very content in knowing that she has financial support since they know she is responsible with her payments. Furthermore she is pleased to be part of her community bank because of all the members she has met who are responsible and stick together. She thanks all those who are managing her loan request, which will be very useful for her business' progress. With the loan she is requesting, she plans to invest in paying to lease a new plot of land that has a good layer of clay soil, as well as purchase sawdust, since these materials are indefensible in producing bricks.

loans.use: Lease land to extract clay and purchase sawdust, the main materials in making bricks

loans.name: One Love Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “One Love” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and, consequently, improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Sinnah T.. Sinnah is 28. She was born in Makeni where she currently resides together with her husband and two children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary school. For five years now, Sinnah has been selling locally dyed cloths called gara lappers. With the help of this loan, Sinnah will buy gara lapper making materials – white cotton cloth, inks, caustic soda, powder, etc. at wholesale to produce dozens of gara cloths to sell.

loans.use: To buy gara lapper making materials – white cotton cloth, inks, caustic soda, powder, etc. at wholesale to produce dozens of gara cloths to sell

loans.name: Mujeres De Fe 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.es:
Dominga es una de los miembro del Grupo Mujeres de Fe 1, 2 & 3; localizado en La ciudad de Puerto Plata, cuya economia depende de la industria del ron, del sector turístico e inmobiliaria, fue el primer destino turistico del Republica Dominicana y unas de las ciudades mas productora de azucar, en donde como muchas hay escasez de agua potable y de energía electrica y con una población de dominicanos y emigrantes haitianos. Sus actividades principales son las ventas de cosméticos para la mujer y una sala de tareas, en la cual ayuda a niños a realizar su tareas y a aprender mas con ellas. Dominga es casada y su familia esta compuesta por ellos y sus 3 hijos, nos dice que su reto o desafío más difícil ha sido criar a sus hijos. Disfruta mucho cocinar, por lo que es su actividad favorita en todo el dia.

Dominga está muy emocionada de recibir su segundo préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente su préstamo anterior y asi haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 13 años, el cual inició vendiendo productos por catalogo de una de las marcas mas reconocida en el pais y la sala de tarea después de graduarse de la universidad en educación. Está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de 10 sillas escolares y una pizarra grande, asi como también diferentes productos como cosméticos, perfumes, entre otros. Planea utilizar sus ganancias para terminar de construir su vivienda, la cual le falta realizar el empañete. Su sueño es tener una escuela, donde puedan estudiar todos los cursos o grados y ser de bendicion para su comunidad.
texts.en: Dominga is a member of Grupo Mujeres de Fe 1, 2 & 3 (Women of Faith Groups 1, 2 & 3) in the city of Puerto Plata, where the economy depends on the rum industry, as well as the tourist and real estate sectors. It was the first tourist destination in the Dominican Republic and one of the largest sugar-producing cities. However, there is also a shortage of drinking water and electricity available to the the Dominicans and Haitian immigrants there. Dominga makes a living selling women's cosmetics and running a study hall, where kids do their homework and learn to get more out of it. Dominga is married and has three children, and she tells us that her biggest challenge has been raising her kids. She really likes to cook, which is her favorite activity of her day. She is very excited to receive her second loan from Kiva partner Esperanza Internacional after having paid her previous loan satisfactorily and taking steps to grow her business. She has had her business for about 13 years, and she started out selling the island's best known brand-name products via catalog and opened the study hall after graduating with an education degree from the university. She is planning to invest the new loan in the purchase of 10 school chairs and a big blackboard as well as different cosmetic products, perfume and other items. She plans to use her profits to finish construction on her home, which still needs to be plastered. Her dream is to have a school, where people can study any course or grade, and be a blessing to her community.

loans.use: Purchase chairs and a big blackboard, as well as cosmetic products

loans.name: Thelma Olimpia

texts.es:
Thelma es una madre de familia, muy trabajadora, inicio su negocio hace varios años lo que hoy en día atreves del financiamiento logro comprar más equipo. Lo que tiene es un video juego en su casa de habitación. Anteriormente su negocio era la venta de ropa usada.
Es casada, y su hijo la apoya en el negocio atendiendo a sus clientes, ya que en estos meses está trabajando de ayudante en una librería lo que significa ingresos para lograr equilibrar los gastos. El negocio es rentable pero hay días que se recolecta poco dinero. 
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara: un televisor a color pantalla plata y play station para seguir creciendo en inventario lo que le generara más ingresos logrando pagar sus compromisos como sus gastos personales.
texts.en: Thelma is a hard-working mother. She started her business a number of years ago and through a loan was able to purchase more equipment. She has a video-game system in her home. Previously her business was selling used clothing. She is married, and her son helps her with the business by bringing in customers, since he is working as an assistant at a bookshop to help with expenses. The business is profitable but there are days where it brings in little money. With this new loan she plans to purchase a color TV and a PlayStation to keep growing her inventory so it will generate more income so she can keep paying her personal expenses.

loans.use: Purchase a big TV and a PlayStation

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 47 años,  es viuda, vive con sus 2 hijos y su mama en su casa propia. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de cuyes, cuya granja posee en su casa. De esta manera, su actividad diaria consiste en cuidar estos animales y asegurar su alimentación para luego venderlos a un buen precio, asimismo acompañada de sus vecinas siembra papa y maíz, de la misma forma espera la cosecha de estos alimentos para poder distribuirlos equitativamente entre ella y sus amigas, para luego ser vendido en el mercado local o también puede usarlo para su consumo propio. Considera que ambos trabajos le generan ingresos, sin embargo también trabaja de manera dependiente en la municipalidad de su zona, así tiene más ingresos, por ahora su deseo es mejorar su actividad agrícola e intensificar la crianza de cuyes. Es su crédito numero 13 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que conocen de su persona que es responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono, así mismo desea invertirlo en la educación de sus hijos que estudian en la universidad.
texts.en: Rosa is 47 years old, a widow and lives with her two children and her mother in her own home. For the past 15 years she has made a living in agriculture and raising guinea pigs on her home's land. In this way, her daily activities consists in caring for her animals and making sure they are well fed so she can then sell them at a good price. She also grows potatoes and corn with her neighbors, and they equally distribute the harvest between themselves to then sell at the local market or use for their own consumption. Both jobs generate income, and she also works for her local council to earn more income. For now, she wants to improve her farming and expand her guinea pig breeding. This is her 13th loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she is very content in knowing that she has financial support since they know she is responsible with her payments. Furthermore, she is pleased to be part of her community bank because all of the members are responsible and stick together. She thanks all the people who will be managing the loan she is requesting since it will be very useful to her business' progress. With the loan she is requesting, she plans to invest in sacks of fertilizer and at the same time to provide for her children's education at the university.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and at the same time invest in her children's education

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married with one grown son. She sells women's clothing. Her business is located at a department store where she rents some space. Olga is able to make her business a success by offering a large assortment and excellent client service. 

Olga is requesting 10,000 Grivnas to purchase seasonal inventories. She hopes to increase her sales and make additional profits to take better care of her family.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventories.

loans.name: Daniel's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you the teachers of the Maranthan Primary School in Waterloo small town, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. This school was founded in 1961 by Theophilus Jumu. The school is staffed with eight teachers and 280 pupils. 

These hard working and dedicated teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to seek a loan of SLL 5,400,000. With the help of this loan, these teachers can embark on some meaningful project that their mere salaries alone cannot do. Some of them will use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to buy house building materials, some to buy a piece of land, or pay school fees for their children, while some of them will invest the loan in business. 

Daniel S. is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in the northern city of Makeni, Daniel is today residing in Waterloo together with his wife and three children who are attending primary school.  Daniel has been in the teaching profession for eight years now. However, to better equip himself in the profession, Daniel is pursuing further studies. With his share of the loan, Daniel will pay college fees for himself, thereby expanding his educational career.

loans.use: To pay college fees for himself

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana de 24 años, tiene una pequeña tienda, vive con su esposo y tres hijos en el suburbio de Guayaquil zona caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes. 

Debido a que se caso muy joven y su situación económica no era tan buena ella y su esposo invirtieron  sus ahorros con la idea de tener su propio negocio. Comenzaron la tienda con algunos víveres y a pasar más tiempo con sus tres hijos. En la actualidad tiene en su tienda con lácteos, frutas, granos, bebidas etc. Trabaja desde las 07h30am primero comprando los víveres en el mercado. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, enlatados, bebidas para su tienda. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y tener una tienda más grande para asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana, 24, has a small store.  She lives with her husband and 3 children in a suburb of Guayaquil in an area where many of the residents are merchants.  

Since she married at a very young age and her economic situation was not very good, she and her husband invested their savings so that they could have their own business.   They started up a store with some groceries so that she could have more time with her 3 children.  Now she has dairy, fruit, grains, drinks and other items in her store.  She starts work at 7:30am, and her first task is to buy the groceries in the market.

With the loan she wants to buy rice, canned goods and drinks for her store.  In the future she wants to finish building her house, and to have a bigger store to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, canned goods and drinks for her store

loans.name: Ginna Zunilda

texts.es: Ginna B.  es una mujer de 49 años  que tiene tres hijos en las edades de 23 a 29,  a los que sueña ver prosperos y exitosos; es precisamente por eso  que diariamente se esfuerza en su proposito de apoyarlos en todos los aspectos. Ella es propietaria de un negocio donde vende calzado y ropa que distribuye entre sus clientes , de acuerdo con el pedido que estos han realizado previamente; sus ventas las realiza a crèdito y sus compras  al pormayor y una parte acredito y otra parte de contado;  como  gran parte de su capital de trabajo està representado en las cuentas por cobra, esta buscando financiamiento para lograr responderle a cada nuevo cliente que le refieren sus mas rentables compradores , y tambien para ganarse un descuento en las promociones   por compras de contado y mayor volumen, porque asì aumentarà sus utilidades, teniendo en cuenta que en la actualidad  su rentabilidad es del 15,5 % y comprando de contado se ahorrarà dinero para lograr oportunidades representadas en mejores ofertas, mas clientes y mayor utilidad. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo y con  este su credikiva,  comprarà  calzado para responder a la temporada de fin de año, que sabe muy bien el gran movimiento comercial de este producto,  por lo que sus ventas repuntan.  Ella en esta època obtiene mas clientes referidos,  que se quedan sin efectivo para comprar de contado, por ocasiòn de los gastos familiares de fin de año y con ello empieza a desarrollar su sueño de tener un gran almacen, aprovechando la ubicaciòn de su vivienda en el barrio Ciudadela 20 de Julio, que conjuga los escenarios comerciales mas importantes de la zona sur, los epicentros recreativos como el estadio Metropolitano de Barranquilla, cuna del futbol colombiano y el importante numero de viviendas  y conjuntos residenciales y casas multifamiliares, lo cual indica una abundante  y permanete clientela potencial para el negocio de Ginna.
texts.en: Ginna B. is a 49 year old woman that has three children between 23 and 29 years old. She hopes to see them be prosperous and successful. That is precisely why she makes an effort every day to support them in every way. She is the owner of a business that sells footwear and clothing that she distributes to her customers in accordance with the order that they previously made. Her sales are made on credit and her purchases are made partially on credit and partially in cash. Since a big part of her working capital is represented in the cover charges, she is looking for financing so that she can respond to each new customer that her most profitable customers refer to her. And also to earn a discount on promotions for large volume and cash purchases. In this way, she will improve her usefulness, keeping in mind that currently her profitability is 15.5%, and buying with cash will save her money to attain opportunities on better offers, more customers, and better usefulness. This is her first loan with "la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo", and with this Kiva loan she will buy seasonal footwear for the end of the year. She knows the great commercial movement of this product very well, which will increase her sales. These days, she gets more referred customers that don't have cash to make a purchase, because of the family costs of the end of the year. With the loan, she is beginning to develop her dream of having a big department store, making the most of the location of her home in the neighborhood Ciudadela 20 de Julio. It combines the most important commercial scenes of the southern zone, the recreational epicenters like the stadium "Metropolitano de Barranquilla", the birthplace of Columbian soccer, and the important number of residential homes and multifamily houses, which indicates a potential abundance of permanent clientele for Ginna's business.

loans.use: To buy seasonal footwear for the end of the year.

loans.name: Madenis Judith

texts.es:
Madenis González a sus  25 años es una mujer casada que vive en el municipio de Sabanagrande; ella es muy organizada en su vida personal y en su negocio de miscelánea,  donde vende artículos de papelería, ropa, cosméticos, adornos femeninos, empaques de regalos mediante el sistema de contado y mercancía variada como calzado y ropa a crédito. Desde muy joven vio el emprendimiento como una oportunidad de generar ingresos personales, porque siempre ha sido muy independiente, por eso inició con una vitrina donde exhibía pocos artículos y gradualmente ha ido agregándole más infraestructura y otros productos  ya mencionados; su sistema de identificación de que productos vender,  funciona de la siguiente manera : Madenis tiene un cuaderno donde anota todo lo que le compran diariamente y también registra lo que ella no tiene,  pero que sus clientes requieren; así ha logrado que sus ventas se incrementen y aumentar el número de compradores de sus productos y obtener mejores utilidades.  Madenis  vende a crédito y tiene alrededor de 25 clientes muy bien seleccionados,  con los cuales logra rotar sus cuentas por cobrar cada 30 días, aunque también vende de contado; ella reporta una   utilidad   de un 35%  y un capital de trabajo es de $2.280.000, con una capacidad de pago de 94%. Su sueño es ver crecer su negocio, organizar un gran local comercial, pero su gran desafío es tener una vivienda propia y por eso ella y su esposo están empeñados en organizarse diariamente,  para el logro de este propósito.
Madenis está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante financiamiento y su credikiva es el tercer crédito, con los otros dos ha logrado crecer,  adicionándole su disciplina de pago y su compromiso constante por invertir bien, lo mismo que mucha autonomía; con su credikiva comprará artículos de perfumería, calzado y ropa,  pues desde ya,  tiene encargos de sus clientes para responder a las fiestas de fin de año, porque planea aumentar su volumen de  ventas en un 25%.
texts.en: Madenis González is 25 years old, married and lives in the municipality of Sabanagrande. She is very organized in her personal and professional life, where she sells stationery supplies, clothing, cosmetics, jewelry, gift packs, as well as other items such as footwear and clothing on credit. Ever since she was young she saw entrepreneurship as a way to earn personal income because she has always been very independent, and for this reason she started with small store where she showed off a few items. Gradually the business kept adding more infrastructure and products like the ones mentioned above. Her system of identifying which products to sell is as follows: Madenis has a notebook where she notes everything her customers purchase every day and also records what she does not have but her customers request. In this way she has been able to increase her sales as well as the number of customers and obtain better profits. Madenis sells on credit and has about 25 hand-picked customers whose accounts rotate every 30 days, although she also takes cash. She reports a profit of 35 percent and capital of $2,280, with credit capacity at 94 percent. Her dream is to see her business grow and organize a big local business, but her biggest goal is to have her own home. It's for this reason she and her husband work hard every day to achieve this objective. Madenis belongs to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and this is her third loan through Kiva. With the others she has been able to grow her business and increase its cash flow, and she promises to continue her good investments. With this loan she plans to purchase perfume, footwear and clothing to fulfill customers' order for the upcoming holidays because she wants to increase her sales volume by 25 percent.

loans.use: Purchase perfume, footwear and clothing to fulfill customers' orders for the upcoming holidays.

loans.name: Maria Coralia

texts.es:
DOÑA MARIA CORALIA S. C. 
De 46 años de edad, casada  tiene 3 hijos y es propietaria de una tienda que está ubicada en su casa, tiene ya más de 29 años su tienda, Gracias al apoyo que le ha brindado Fape, ella ha podido aumentar la cantidad de productos y poder vender un poco más, ahora que se ha cerca fin de año ella quiere vender otro poco mas en productos de la canasta  basica o sea comestibles y asi satisfacer a su clientela, y así incrementa sus ingresos y obtener más ganancias, ella es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora ha apoyado a su esposo y es satisfactorio para ella ser una fuente de ingresos para su familia, además les ha dado educación a sus hijos y espera que algún día ellos puedan lograr sus sueños, ella es muy buena socia y confía en que Fape le dará esta nueva oportunidad y así poder salir adelante con su familia. Y cumplir sus sueños que es ver a sus hijos graduados y así tengan  un mejor futuro
texts.en: Mrs. Maria Coralia S. C. is 46 years old, married and has 3 children. She owns a store located in her home that has been operating for over 29 years. Thanks to the support from FAPE, she has been able to increase the quantity of products and sales a bit more. Now that the end of the year is near, she wants to sell more staple goods and groceries to satisfy her customers, so she can increase her income and gain more profits. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman; she has helped her husband and it is satisfying for her to be a source of income for her family. Additionally, she has provided an education for her children and hopes that one day they can fulfill their dreams. She is a member in good-standing and trusts that FAPE will give her another opportunity to get ahead with her family and fulfill her dreams of seeing her children graduated so they can have a better future.

loans.use: Groceries and staple goods

loans.name: Johana Maria

texts.es:
Johana es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia, es por eso comienza  a buscar ingresos para apoyar a sus cuatro hijos, siendo su esposo conductor quien apoyo  con dinero para comenzar su negocio de ropa nueva. El cual lo hizo con poco dinero luego nace la iniciativa de un financiamiento para aumentar sus ingresos.
Siendo Afodenic de gran beneficio para su inversión que hasta hoy sigue con sus ventas, en su casa de habitación. Con este nuevo préstamo comprara variedad de ropa para adulto, niño, en diferentes estilos, a si como ropa de interior de dama.
texts.en: Johana is a woman very dedicate to her family. It's for this reason she started looking for ways to earn income to support her four children. Her husband is a driver, and he gave her the money to start a business selling new clothing. She started out with little money but then was able to grow her income thanks to a loan. She has benefited greatly from her investments from the loans from Kiva partner Afodenic, increasing her clothing sales out of her home. With this new loan she plans to purchase a variety of clothing for adults and children in different styles, as well as undergarments for women.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of clothing to keep growing her business.

loans.name: Armando Jose

texts.es:
Armando es un hombre con mucho anhelo de sobresalir adelante con su propio negocio que puso hace dos años un taller de costura. 
Es casado, con dos hijos, por el cual trabaja con tenacidad para lograr un fututo mejor para ello.
Al inicio compro maquinas con ahorros de su trabajo anterior, en donde hacía falta capital para invertir en tela, lo que hace un préstamo para cubrir la demanda de tela, hilos, bordados y comienza ah trabajar mucho para trabajar su dinero.
Hoy es su segundo financiamiento con  una visión más avanzada, en donde ha logrado captar clientes fijos que le compran su producción de ropa. Invertirá en más cantidad de tela de colores para hacer camisetas de varios estilos y poder vender a buen precio.
texts.en: Armando is a man with a strong desire to make headway with his own business, a sewing shop he started two years ago. He is married with two children, and he works tenaciously to secure a better future for them. He started out buying sewing machines with money he saved from a previous job, but he lacked the funds to invest in fabrics, so he took out a loan to cover the expenses for fabric, thread and embroidery, and started working a lot to make money. This is his second loan, and his vision is more advanced since he has been able to obtain fixed customers who will pay for his products. He plans to invest in more fabrics of different colors to make different styles of T-shirts that he can sell at a good price.

loans.use: Purchase varied fabrics to increase production of T-shirts.

loans.name: Yenis  Enilce

texts.es:
Yenis C. de 48 años vive en el municipio de Soledad, muy cerca de Barranquilla, con su familia conformada por su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 23 a 27 años.  Allí en este municipio tiene una miscelánea que ha aprovechado para ofrecer servicios telefónicos a sus clientes y que esta actividad  a su vez,  le ayuda para obtener nuevos compradores. 
Yenis es madre comunitaria al mismo tiempo que tiene su negocio:  es decir el estado nacional le  suministra alimentación a 13 niños que están bajo su cuidado, en su propio hogar,    logrando que estos estén en mejores condiciones nutricionales, mientras  sus madres trabajan, o no pueden sostenerlos,  agregándole   así a estos infantes  bienestar, para lo cual Yenis ha sido capacitada durante muchas sesiones y obtiene un subsidio que es un ingreso adicional , que contribuye  al sostenimiento de su hogar.
 Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, pero tiene 3 años de ser comerciante y de tener negocio; primero se dedicó a la preparación de pasteles,  ( alimentos a base de arroz, cerdo, pollo, carne y verduras, envueltos en hojas de bijao) ,  y también vendía lo que le encargaban, como ropa y cosméticos;  cuando gradualmente crecieron sus ventas y con ello sus utilidades Yenis compró una vitrina para tener más orden y exhibir mejor sus productos y en la actualidad tiene tres, muy bien surtidas de ganchos y adornos para el cabello, ropa sandalias accesorios femeninos,  y también vende hasta dulces. Ella  como aprovecha muy bien su principal mercado potencial,  que es el de las madres y familiares de los niños que atiende, últimamente puso un negocio de servicios de telefonía celular, que le representa un ingreso más y además un estímulo para que la gente se detenga y observe lo que ella tiene en sus vitrinas. Su sueño es lograr un nivel más alto de superación y desempeño personal, que sus hijos se conviertan en personas exitosas y sobre todo ampliar su negocio preparándolo  para que este se convierta en una gran empresa familiar.
 Su Credikiva lo invertirá en la compra de ropa infantil, para damas, preparándose para responder a su clientela este fin de año, y también para la compra de artículos de papelería, aprovechando que no es la temporada escolar y que consigue precios más económicos,   para en el mes de Enero,  época en la que repuntan sus ventas de papelería y es temporada escolar, lograr  alcanzar por lo menos un 30% más en el aumento de sus ventas y así empezar fortaleciendo su sueño.
texts.en:
Yenis C. is 48 and lives in the Soledad municipality, very close to Barranquilla, with her family consisting of her spouse and their 3 children aged 23 to 27.  There in this municipality she has a general store which has made the most of offering telephone services to her customers and this business in turn, helps her to get more customers. 
Yenis is a foster mother as well as having her business:  this means the national state provides her food for 13 children who are under her care, in her own home, keeping them in better nutritional condition, while their mothers work, or cannot support them,  adding to the wellbeing of these children, for which Yenis has qualified for over many sessions and gets a subsidy which is an additional income , which contributes to supporting her home.
 This is her first financing with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, but she has been a storekeeper and had her business for 3 years; first she made pies,  ( food with a base of rice, pork, chicken, meat and vegetables, wrapped in bijao leaves) ,  and also selling on commission, items such as clothes and cosmetics;  when her sales gradually increased and with it her profits Yenis bought a display cabinet to have more order and show her products better and currently she has three, very well supplied with hangers and decorated for hair, clothes, sandals, and female accessories,  and she also sells sweets. She makes the most of her potential market,  who are mothers and families of children who she looks after, recently she has had a mobile phone business, which gives her more income and is also a stimulus so that people stop and see what she has in her displays. Her dream is to achieve a better level of living and personal performance, that her children are successful and above all grow her business so that it becomes a great family company.
 Her Credikiva will be used to buy clothes for children, women, preparing her to get ready for her customers for year end, and also to buy stationery, making the most of it not being the school season and that her prices are more economical. In the month of January,  a time where she improves her stationery sales and it is the school season, she achieves at least 30% more in the increase of her sales and then she will begin to realise her dream.

loans.use: Purchase clothes for children, for women, preparing her to get ready for her customers for year end, and also to buy stationery, making the most of it not being the school season and that her prices are more economical

loans.name: Pastorcitas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Pastorcitas y se ubica en la comunidad de puente de Ixtla en el estado de Morelos en México, esta comunidad se distingue por los  balnearios que existen en la región y el lago de Tequesquitengo lo que hace a la región un atractivo turístico, el grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes. 
Delfina Jiménez García es integrante del grupo , ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas hechas a mano, negocio que inicio hace 4 años, solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz para la elaboración de las tortillas, tiene 59 años estudio hasta el 5º año de primaria, es casada,  tiene en total 5 hijos de 42,36,34,32 y 24 años respectivamente. Al momento  de solicitar el préstamo se siente contenta porque en el mismo local donde vende las tortillas planea poner una  negocio  de tacos al pastor, quiere este crédito para comprar los utensilios para la elaboración de los tacos, con la ganancia que obtenga, piensa comprar mesas y sillas para su taquería.
texts.en:
This group is called Pastorcitas and is located in the community of Puente de Ixtla in Morelos State, Mexico.  The community is distinguished by the spas that exist in the region and Lake Tequesquitengo, which makes the region an attractive tourist spot.  The group is composed of 10 members.

Delfina Jiménez García is a member of the group.  She sells handmade tortillas, a business that started 4 years ago.  She is seeking a loan to buy corn for making tortillas.  She is 59 years old, has a 5th grade education, is married and has a total of 5 children, ages 42, 36, 34, 32, and 24 respectively.  As she is requesting the loan, she is happy because in the same place where she sells tortillas, she plans to start a business of selling tacos al pastor (pork tacos).  She wants this loan to buy utensils for taco preparation.  With the earnings she generates, she is thinking of buying tables and chairs for her taco stand.

loans.use: To invest in her taco business.

loans.name: María

texts.en:
Maria T. C. Loaiza is a 38-year-old mother of five from Sarapiqui, Heredia, located near the Caribbean region of Costa Rica. Her highest level of formal education attained is the completion of primary school. Maria is a member of a group of women with the name Banco Mujer La Esperanza, which translates as “The Women’s Bank of Hope”. 

Maria’s entrepreneurial idea is the rearing and selling of pigs. She will use this loan to start her business by investing in animal feed and piglets and to make general investments conducive to maintaining the good health of her animals.

The land Maria and her family live on was allocated to them by the Costa Rican government’s Instituto de Desarollo Agrario, which translates as “The Institute of Agrarian Development (IDA)”. Through the IDA, the poorest citizens of the country were given land to live on and use for subsistence purposes such as farming and animal rearing. Many IDA land recipients have faced challenges in being able to effectively use their land due to a lack of agricultural knowledge and a lack of startup capital. Fundación Mujer acts as an extension of the IDA program by providing much needed loans as startup capital for investment in various productive activities.

As a result of the amount of time it will take in order for the pigs to grow to a profitable value, Maria will not be required to make immediate repayments, as outlined in the repayment schedule.

loans.use: To purchase livestock and animal feed.

loans.name: Juan Vicente

texts.es:
Juan de 57 años, elabora muñecos de porcelana y los vende a las tienda, vive en una zona periurbana con todos los servicios básicos el lugar está ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Juan elabora muñecos de porcelana con cerámica en polvo el proceso es sencillo primero mescla con algunos adictivos y hace una masa y la coloca en moldes especiales con formas de muñecos, después los mete al horno con una temperatura de 60º cent, los deja enfriar y les comienza hacer la imagen con pintura. Comienza hacer los muñecos desde las 08h00am y en la tarde los vende en el centro de la ciudad. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales como adictivos, cerámica en polvo para hacer mas muñecos y tener mayores ingresos. En el futuro quiere tener el negocio en su casa y tener una consultoría dental para su hija mayor.
texts.en:
57-year-old Juan makes porcelain figurines and sells them to stores. He lives in a peri-urban area with all the basic services that is located in the Perimetral de Guayaquil area, surrounded by a marsh.

Juan makes porcelain figurines with ceramic powder. The process is simple. First, he mixes in some additives and makes a mass. Then he puts it in special molds in the form of figurines. Afterwards, he puts them in a kiln heated to 60 degrees centigrade. He lets them cool and then begins painting their faces. He starts making the figurines at 8am and in the afternoon sells them in the center of the city. 

With the loan, he wants to buy materials such as additives and ceramic powder to make more figurines and have greater income. In the future he wants to operate the business out of his home and have a dental clinic for his oldest daughter.

loans.use: To buy additives and ceramic powder

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
María Auxiliadora es una mujer de edad avanzada, con su propio negocio que inicio hace varios años con dinero que su familia mediante remesas  ah apoyado como los financiamientos Y que gracias a su tenacidad y empeño ha logrado el aumentar su inventario.
Lo que ha logrado invertir no solo en productos de granos básicos, sino que también en cosméticos, perfumes, como otros productos de uso personal.
Con su nuevo préstamo quiere comprar ropa ya que viene la temporada buena, productos Avon, en cosméticos, como frutas, golosinas, carne, pollo, productos lácteos.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora is an elderly woman with her own business which she set up several years ago with money that her family, through remittances, has supported her with, as well as loans.  Thanks to her tenacity and determination she has succeeded in increasing her inventory.

She has managed to invest not only in basic foodstuffs but also in cosmetics, perfumes and other personal use products.

With her new loan she would like to buy clothes since a good season is arriving.  She would also like to buy Avon products, cosmetics, fruit, candies, meat, chicken and dairy products.

loans.use: To invest in clothes, cosmetics, fruit, candies, chicken and meat.  To increase her sales

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
