Jacqueline M. es una mujer casada y con 4 hijos en las edades de 6 a 20 años que se dedica al comercio de viveres y cosmèticos; su esposo viaja semanalmente a maicao donde cosigue productos a buen precio  como enlatados, arroz, aceite y  asì mismo distribuye productos como cosmèticos y perfumes  mediante guias especializadas,  respondiendo a pedidos que le hacen  en la ciudad de Barranquilla donde tiene su clientela. Su clientela està compuesta por vecinos, famliares y mujeres quienes toman la decision de lo que necesitan para su canasta familiar, tambien tiene como clientes principales a profesores en diversos colegios de la comunidad donde vive y de los alrededores,  a quienes les suministra especialmente cosmèticos y perfumes. Jaqueline gradualmente ha ido incrementando sus ventas, por eso sueña con tener un local independiente , que le de mayor organizaciòn y esten mejjor exhibidos la mercancia y productos que ella vende a credito, para ampliar asi su venta de contado y rotar mas rapidamente su capital de trabajo. Este es su segundo financiamiento con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo y con el planea provisionarse de mercancia coherente con las fiestas de fin de año, como cosmèticos perfumes y hasta ropa, y tambien comprarà viveres bàsicos con los que incrementarà sus ventas porque en las fiestas de Diciembre las familias preparan deliciosas comidas y esta vez lo harà seguramente con los productos economicos que consiga comprar Jacqueline.
Con sus financiamientos con la Fundaciòn,  Jacqueline ha logrado aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar cada dia las condiciones de su familia, porque su sueño es ver a sus cuatro hijos convertidos en profesionales exitosos y  lograr la independencia de los espacios domèsticos y productivos, ademàs de  encontrar articulos que forman parte de su oferta en la misma ciudad donde vive, para no sobrecargar con estos gastos de viaje,  los  productos que vende.
texts.en:
Jacqueline M. is a married woman with 4 children aged 6 to 20. She sells groceries and cosmetics. Her husband travels weekly to  Maicao where he gets products at a good price such as canned goods and rice. She also distributes products such as cosmetics and perfume through specialized catalogues, filling orders made in the city of  Barranquilla where she has her clientele.  Her clientele is made up of neighbors, relatives, and women who have made the decision about what they need for their family shopping basket. She also has teachers from different high schools in the community where she lives and its surroundings among her main clients.  In particular, she supplies them with cosmetics and perfume.  Jaqueline has gradually increased her sales and because of this she dreams of having an independent locale. This will give her better organization and her merchandise and products she sells on credit will be better exhibited. Thus she will increase her cash sales and have a quicker turnover of her working capital. This is her second loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and she plans on supplying her merchandise in sync with the end of year festivities, such as cosmetics, perfume, and even clothing. She will also buy basic groceries that will increase her sales because during the December holidays families prepare delicious meals and this time they will do it with the economic products that Jacqueline is able to buy.

With the financing from the Foundation,  Jacqueline has been able to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions every day. Her dream is to see her four children become successful and obtain work and domestic independence. She would also like to find articles that she offers in the same city where she lives, so that she doesn't have to charge for the travel expenses with the products she sells.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, perfume and even clothing. She will also buy basic groceries which will increase her sales during the December holidays.

loans.name: Macaria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA D. LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba  y departamento D. Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Macaria; ella tiene 70 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividad  diarias con el negocio D.  venta D. chicha (bebida hecha a base D. maíz), ella tiene un pequeño lugar donD. venD. la chicha, ella atienD. desD. las 4:00 p.m hasta las 11:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio D. venta D. chicha. La socia  solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz y así poder sacar su negocio adelante.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Macaria belongs to the “Reyna D. los Angeles” community bank.  The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, in the province of Urubamba, in the department of Cusco.

Macaria is 70 years old.  She is married and has 6 children.  She divides her time between her daily tasks and her business selling 'chicha' (a corn-based drink).  She has a small place where she sells 'chicha'.  She serves in her business from 4.00pm to 11.00pm.  She would like to expand her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy corn and thereby move her business forward.

She is grateful to those who are taking part in her dream by providing her with this loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy corn and thereby move her business forward

loans.name: Estrellas De Tilapa Group

texts.es: Esta  foto fue tomada En la Panadería  de la Sra. Belen F A  es integrante del grupo  “Estrellas de tilapa” que esta ubicado en la localidad de San José  tilapa,  Puebla  en México. En la foto se ve el pan de muerto típico de la temporada que ella elabora  con mucho empeño y  dedicación. La panadería es el   negocio que inicio hace 20 años .Solicita  el préstamo para la compra de materias primas.  Sus clientes  prefieren comprarle por que su pan es elaborado artesanalmente (hecho a mano) no como el resto de las otras panaderías, él pan de Doña “BELEN” es considerado de los  mejores  de la región. En este momento se siente contenta por este nuevo préstamo. Tiene 43 años de edad, estudio hasta la secundaria, es casada y tuvo dos hijos  que ya son casados y que ya no viven con ella. Espera vender su pan en más localidades así como abrir otro expendio en un futuro no muy lejano.El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes.
texts.en: This photo was taken in Belen's bakery.  She is a member of the “Estrellas de Tilapa” (Stars of Tilapa) group which is located in the town of San José Tilapa, Puebla, Mexico.  In this photo you can see the 'pan de muerto' (bread of the dead) which is traditional for this season and which Belen makes with a lot of effort and dedication.  She started her bakery business 20 years ago.  She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients.  Her customers prefer to buy their bread from her because it is hand made unlike that sold in other bakeries.  Doña Belen's bread is considered some of the best in the region.  She is currently feeling happy with this new loan.  She is 43 years old, studied at secondary level, is married and has two children who are already married and no longer live with her.  She hopes to sell her bread in more places and hopes to open another store in the not-so-distant future.  The group has 9 members altogether.

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer as well as covering part of the payment for a plot of land

loans.name: Simplicia

texts.es:
La Sra. Simplicia B. tiene 54 años de edad, esta felizmente casada con el Sr. Benedicto Gonzalez Mendez de 64 años de edad. 
El matrimonio tiene varios hijos, el mayor de ellos se encuentra trabajando en España, desde ahi él envia un poco de dinero para ayudar asi a su familia. 
Y fué con ese dinero que Simplicia se inicio con la venta de mercaderias varios como lencerias, bijouterie, ropas, toallas, sabadas.
De esa forma invirtio el dinero y sacando mayor utilidad del mismo. 
La clienta solicita el crédito para la compra de mas mercaderias, ropas de verano ya que se aproxima el calor. 
Como sueño personal manifiesta que quiere a su familia completa, reunidos. Sin necesidad de tener que viajar al exterior para salir adelante. 
Un pais donde haya trabajo.
texts.en:
Mrs Simplicia B. is 54 years old.  She is happily married to Mr Benedicto Gonzalez Mendez who is 64 years old. They have several children.  The eldest is working in Spain and sends home a little money to help the family.

It was with this money that Simplicia started her business selling various goods such as lingerie, jewelry, clothes, towels and sheets.  She invested the money in her business and is making bigger profits from it.  Simplicia is requesting this loan to buy more goods such as summer clothes as the hot weather is approaching.

Simplicia's personal dream is to have her family complete and together without having to travel abroad to get ahead.  A country where there is work.

loans.use: To buy goods: blouses, shorts, t-shirts and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase livestock and animal feed.

loans.name: Llena De Amor Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama LLENA DE AMOR, porque ellas se sienten así. Está ubicado en la colonia Lazaro Cardenas, en el Estado de México.  El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes y es la 1era vez que solicita un crédito a CrediComún. Isabel C. García es integrante del grupo. Tiene 38 años, estudió una carrera técnica, es Estilista y tiene en total 3 hijos varones.  Ella es estilista que inició hace 7 años. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en artículos para la estética, tinte etc... Sus clientes son variables ya que se encuentra en una calle transitada. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente feliz ya que está iniciando un crédito nuevo con nosotros.   Quiere este crédito para poder invertir en moviliario y mercancía ya que es un poco caro todo su material que requiere. También espera poder crecer como persona.
texts.en: This group is called “Llena de Amor” (Full of Love) because that is how its members feel.  It is located in Lazaro Cadenas district in the State of Mexico.  The group has 10 members and this is the 1st time that they have requested a loan from CrediComún.  Isabel C. García is one of the group's members.  She is 38 years old and studied a technical course.  She is a stylist.  She has 3 sons.  She started working as a stylist 7 years ago.  She is requesting this loan to invest in beauty products, dyes, etc.  Her customers vary since her business is located in a very busy street.  At this moment, requesting her loan, she is feeling happy to be beginning a new loan with us.  She would like this loan so that she can invest in fittings and supplies since the materials which she requires are quite expensive.  She also hopes to be able to grow as a person.

loans.use: To invest in beauty products

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Eulogia;  tiene 45 años de edad, casada y tiene 5 hijos; en esta oportunidad la socia se dedica a la venta de verduras,ella vende zanahorias,tomates y lechugas,la socia vende en el mercado de la provincia de Urubamba,ella quiere tener un lugar mas grande donde pueda vender las verduras. La socia solicita solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de primera necesidad para su casa.

La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Eulogia belongs to the “Reyna de los Angeles” community bank which is located in the district of Urubamba, in the province of Urubamba, in the department of Cusco.

Eulogia is 45 years old.  She is married and has 5 children.  She works selling vegetables.  She sells carrots, tomatoes and lettuces.  She sells in the market in Urubamba province.  She would like to have a larger place where she can sell her vegetables.  She is requesting this loan to buy basic items for her home.

She is grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy basic items for her home

loans.name: Lucia Esmeralda

texts.es:
Lucia es una joven muy trabajadora, tiene un trabajo fijo en zona franca y venta de ropa para lograr ayudarse económicamente y lograr un equilibrio en sus gastos.
Su anhelo es la terminación de su casa que ha venido construyendo junto con su esposo que se esfuerzan por tener un techo mejor donde vivir.
Ha venido logrando la terminación con financiamiento que Afodenic está dando para avanzar en la mejor brevedad.
Lo que hará con este nuevo préstamo es seguir levantando paredes de concreto y poner techo. Lo que está contenta porque cada vez se ha posible su sueño. Lo que comprara: bloques, arena, cemento, hierro, zinc, cuartones entre otros y seguir la obra.
texts.en:
Lucia is a very hard-working young woman.  She has a regular job in a free-trade zone and sells clothes to help herself financially and to achieve balance in her expenses.

Her dream is to finish her house which she has been building together with her husband.  They are working hard to have a better place to live.

She has been finishing her house with loans which Afodenic have been providing so that she can advance as quickly as possible.

She will use this new loan to continue putting up concrete walls and put a roof on her house.  She is happy to be fulfilling her dream.  She will buy blocks, sand, cement, iron, corrugated metal roofing, joists, etc. and continue her work.

loans.use: To buy blocks, sand, cement, iron, corrugated metal roofing and joists to continue building walls and succeed in finishing her house

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.


El socio es el Sr. Rosalio; el tiene 46 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 1 hijo; el socio se dedica a atender su pequeña tienda de abarrotes, el vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite yfideos,el socio atiende desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 11:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a su hijo, el socio quiere ampliar la tienda de abarrotes. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como sacos de arroz y azúcar.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rosalio belongs to the “Reyna de los Angeles” community bank which is located in the district of Urubamba, in the province of Urubamba, in the department of Cusco.

Rosalio is 46 years old.  He is single and has one child.  He works serving in his small grocery store.  He sells basic foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, oil and noodles.  He serves in his store from 5.00am until 11.00pm and through this business he is managing to support his son.  He would like to expand his grocery store.  He is requesting this loan to buy goods such as sacks of rice and sugar.

He is grateful to those who are taking part in his dream by funding this loan and he pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as sacks of rice and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 54 Años, es separada y vive sola en su casa propia. Desde hace 15 años decidió generar sus propias fuentes de ingreso, mediante la agricultura y la crianza de animales, asimismo posee una tienda, en donde vende variedad de productos de primera necesidad, y en la que su hija es la encargada de dicho negocio. De esta manera su actividad diaria es que cada mañana sale al campo a cuidar sus cultivos, mientras su vaca y ovejas se alimentan de pastizales, en tanto lo que cosecha lo lleva a vender a otras ciudades y una parte lo comercializa en la tienda. Durante todo ese tiempo de trabajo ha visto frutos  beneficiosos en las rentas que ha recibido por lo que esta  viendo mas adelante incrementar su producción e intensificar mas la venta de animales. Es su crédito numero 9 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que conocen de su persona que es responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo utilizará en la compra de sacos de abono, para la siguiente siembra de maíz.
texts.en:
Rosa is 54 years old.  She is separated and lives alone in her own home.  15 years ago she decided to generate her own source of income by farming and raising animals.  She also has a store in which she sells a variety of basic goods.  Her daughter is in charge of that business.  Each morning she goes out into the fields to tend to her crops while her cow and her sheep graze on pasture.  She takes some of the crops she harvests to sell in other towns and sells some in her store.  During all the time she has been working, she has seen the fruit of her labor in the profits that she has made.  For this reason she is looking ahead to increase her production and intensify the sale of her animals.

This is the 9th loan which she has had from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support from MFP because they know she is a person who is responsible in making her repayments.  She likes being a member of her community bank because all the members are people who she knows.  They are all responsible and very supportive of each other.  She thanks all those who will help fund her loan since it will be very useful for her in making progress with her business.  She will use the loan to buy sacks of fertilizer for sowing her next lot of corn.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Roberto A. de 30 años, está soltero,  tienen la dicha de tener 1 hija, que está viviendo con su  madre actualmente.
   Roberto se dedica a este trabajo hace más de  8 años, aproximadamente desde el año 2.002; el comenzó desde muy chico a trabajar en relojería y joyería, con su padre en su negocio, con quien aprendió el oficio, que después de un tiempo considerado su papá le dio para su capital, y habilitó un local, que con el tiempo fue encontrando espacio y confiabilidad en la sociedad, en la actualidad el tiene mucha gente que concurre a su local.
   El utilizaría este crédito en comprar mercaderías como: relojes, cadenas, pulseras,tobilleras, otras.
texts.en:
Roberto A. is 30 years old.  He is single and has the good fortune to have 1 daughter, who is currently living with her mother.

Roberto has been in this business for more than 8 years, since approximately 2002.  He started working in the watch and jewelry business from an early age, alongside his father in his business.  It is his father who taught him the trade.  After a while his father gave him some capital and he fitted out his premises.  He currently has a lot of people who come to his premises.

He will use this loan to buy merchandise such as: watches, chains, bracelets, anklets, etc.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise (watches, chains, bracelets, anklets, etc.)

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 46 años, es separada y vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 15 años decidió dedicarse a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, negocio que está instalado en el interior de su casa, es así que cada mañana brinda servicio a sus clientes. Por otro lado, se dedica también en la crianza de cuyes, en donde sus hijos la apoyan en esta actividad. Cada semana, tiene pedidos de venta de estos animales, por ello es que se intensifica en la crianza, además tiene cultivar alfalfa, que sirve de forraje para los cuyes, de esa manera aminora los gastos. Sus planes futuros es ampliar su tienda así como ampliar su granja de cuyes. Es su crédito numero 16 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece asimismo a todas las personas que serán gestoras de este aporte que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en: Victoria is 46-years-old. She's separated and lives with her two children in her own home. Fifteen years ago she decided to start selling essential products from her home. Each day she offers this service to her customers. She also raises guinea pigs; her children help her with this activity. Each week she has orders for these animals so she's stepping up her business. She also has to grow alfalfa to feed the guinea pigs in order to reduce her expenses. Her plans for the future are to expand her store so that she can expand her guinea pig farm. This is her 16th loan with MFP and she's very happy to konw that she has financial support and she's proud to be a part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. She would like to thank all the lenders because this loan will be very useful in the progress of her business. With this loan she will invest in the purchase of merchandise for her general store.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for general store

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
El Señor Ricardo O. de 58 años de edad esta casado hace 36 años con la Señora Guillerma Lopez de 55 años de edad; el matrimonio tiene seis hijos de los cuales dos ya estan casados, uno de ellos se encuentra viviendo en el exterior y los restantes tres de 33, 20 y 16 años viven con ellos.
Hace 36 años, Don Ricardo, era empleado de una empresa privada, al mismo tiempo seguía un curso para carpinteros que duró 6 meses, al final de este curso decidió emprender su propio negocio con un poco de ahorro que había juntado de su anterior trabajo.
Solicita este préstamo para la compra de maderas,  terciadas  clavos. Ya que tiene varios pedidos de muebles para las fiestas de fín de año. La gente solicita sus servicios por el trabajo fino que realiza.-
texts.en: Ricardo O. is 58-years-old. He's been married for 36 years to Guillerma Lopez, who is 55-years-old. They have six children, two of whom are married, one of whom lives abroad, and three or whom (33, 20, and 16-years-old) still live at home. Thirty-six years ago Ricardo was employed at a private company while he took a 6-month carpentry course. When he finished the course he decided to start his own business with a small savings from his previous job. He's requesting this loan to buy wood and nails because he has several orders for furniture for end-of-the-year parties. People request his services for the high quality of his work.

loans.use: Purchase of wood, slings, and nails

loans.name: Jenny Alexandra

texts.es:
Jenny de 24 años, vende productos Onnilife (empresa naturista y de venta de vitaminas). Vive en una zona periurbana el lugar está ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Hace años atrás ella necesitaba dinero para la universidad y no tenía trabajo hasta que una prima la inscribió como vendedora de productos Onnilife por catalogo, continuo vendiendo los productos ya que a su tercer mes gano un bono. En la actualidad vende los productos recorriendo las calles y a sus vecinos o amigos. Su trabajo lo realiza por pedidos y por teléfono trabaja en distintos horarios ya que está estudiando en la universidad.     

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos naturales como powermaket, biocros, aloebeta y así incrementar su mercadería. En el futuro quiere incrementar su distribución y terminar los estudios en la universidad.
texts.en: Jenny is 24-years-old. She sells Omnilife (nutrition and vitamin company) products. She lives in the outlying are of Guayaquil near the Perimetral highway, which is surrounded by an estuary. Several years ago she needed money to pay for the university, but didn't have work until her cousin signed her up as an Omnilife salesperson. She continued to sell products and after her third month she won a voucher. Currently she travels around selling products to friends and neighbors. She takes orders by telephone and works various hours because she's studying at a university. With this loan she wants to buy natural products, such as powermaket, biocros, and aloebeta to supplement her merchandise. In the future she wants to increase her distribution and finish her studies at the university.

loans.use: Purchase of natural products

loans.name: Consuelo De Dios Group

texts.es:
CONSUELO DE DIOS


AURA MARINA M. L.. tiene  48 años de edad, tiene 7 hijos cuatro casados y tres solteros, ella se dedica a la confeccion de tejidos o guipiles a mano, en su actividad la ayudan sus dos hijas para elaborar los guipiles tambien elaboran fajas a mano, desde hace diez años que ella elabora ese producto los vende fuera del pueblo, por la epoca de fin de año tiene mucha demanda su producto y es esa la razon por la cual ella solicita su credito.

VILMA VICTORIA G. Q.. tiene 33 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos ya grandes los tiene estudiando, ella se dedica a la venta de guipiles y tambien a la venta de delantales bordados, ella sale a vender su producto a otros municipios, cuando ya tiene varios guipiles sale a entregarlos, tiene 6 años de dedicarse a esa actividad, y ahora por el fin de año que viene la gente le compra mas su producto, es la epoca en que ella tiene mejor venta.

DILIA VIOLETA T. C. tiene 32 años de edad, tiene 7 hijos pequeños estudian la primaria, ella se dedica a la elaboración de delantales bordados a maquina, tiene 8 años de dedicarse a la actividad, su producto lo vende solo en el pueblo, porque no puede salir a vender por sus hijos pequeños, sus costuras lo realiza en su casa para poder atender a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 48 years old and has 7 children, 4 of them married and 3 single. She works hand-weaving cloth for blouses and her two daughters help her make the blouses and they also make sashes. She has been making these products for 10 years and she sells them away from her town. Her goods are in great demand towards New Year and this is the reason that she is requesting a loan.
Vilma is 33 years old and has 2 older children who are studying. She works selling blouses and also selling embroidered aprons. She sells her goods in other towns - once she has a supply of blouses she goes to sell them. She has been doing this for 6 years. Lots of people will buy her goods for the approaching New Year, and this is the time of year when she makes the most sales.
Dilia is 32 years old and has 7 young children who are in elementary school. She makes machine-embroidered aprons. She has been doing this for 8 years. She only sells her goods in her town as she needs to stay close to home because of her small children. She makes her garments at home so she can look after her children.

loans.use: Weaving cloth

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de 3 enfants , Adjo a 38 ans. Pour contribuer au menage , elle fait le commerce de produit de mercerie et des ustensiles de cuisine.  Elle exerce cette activité 10 ans déjà. Elle couturière de profession et associe ce commerce. Elle achète au grand marché de Lomé et revend au marché local d’agodeke. Le credit demandé sera destiné à l’achat de nouveaux produits.
texts.en:
Married with three children, Adjo is 38 years old. To help with household responsibilities, she sells haberdashery items and cooking utensils. She has been engaged in this activity for ten years. She also works as a dressmaker, the trade in which she was trained. 

She gets her stocks at the big market of Lomé for resale at the local market of Agodeke. 

The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase new merchandise.

loans.use: To buy haberdashery items and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi a 40 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants.  Il fait cette activité 10 ans déjà. Pour s’occuper de sa famille il fait le commerce de boisson local. Il s’approvisionne à Kouvé  et revend  près de la maison Dra à Lomé. Il sollicite ce prêt pour satisfaire mieux ses clients.
texts.en: Koffi is 40 years old, married and the father of two. He has been in this business for 10 years already. In order to provide for his family, he sells traditional local liquor. He stocks up in Kouvé and sells by the Dra house in Lomé. He is seeking this loan in order to better meet customer demand.

loans.use: Purchasing traditional beverages

loans.name: Yomaira Elena

texts.es:
Yomaira D. vive en el barrio San José, al sur D. Barranquilla desD. hace 34 años; ella es una mujer  casada y con 6 hijos en las edades D. 20 a 30 años, para los cuales siempre está en la búsqueda permanente  un mejor estar. Yomaira es muy conocida en su barrio,  porque tiene un negocio D. venta D. mercancía variada, se mueve entre muchos productos, mas exactamente entre los que sus clientes necesitan, en  las líneas para damas, caballeros y  niños y entre ropa, calzad, cosmético, en fin,  todo cuanto le signifique un pedido D. sus clientes. Su sueño emprendedor comenzó en el año 2005, cuando inició  una  cafetería en el barrio El prado al  interior D. una universidad,  en esa actividad  y por razones D. sus buenas relaciones, sostuvo muy buenos clientes que hoy,  en su negocio D. vender mercancía, conforman su mas exclusiva clientela, a los que como conoce muy bien,  les  venD. a crédito y con ellos planea los pagos D. cada uno, D. acuerdo a las condiciones  que con ellos conocerte. La mercancía  variada que Yomaira venD. en mayor cantidad es la ropa y los cosméticos; el credikiva es su tercer  financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el comprará vestidos femeninos, ropa y productos D. belleza, que tiene encargados por sus  clientes,  para la temporada D. fin D. año que se avecina y que es D. gran movimiento comercial. Con sus anteriores créditos ha logrado tener un capital D. trabajo, para incrementar su compra D. artículos y responder oportunamente a sus compradores. Como su  sueño es tener un almacén muy bien acreditado donD. venda todo tipo D. artículos, Yomaira trabaja persistentemente, es muy cumplida para tener una buena referencia comercial y para abrirse a nuevas posibilidades D. crecimiento empresarial y familiar. 
Su mayor desafío es incrementar el número D. clientes con una mayor cobertura D. barrios en los que trabaja vendiendo su mercancía.   Yomaira  planea renovar su inventario D. mercancías, para vestir alegremente a sus clientes en las fiestas naviD.ñas.
texts.en:
Yomaira D. lives in San José neighborhood, south of Barranquilla.  She has lived there for 34 years.  She is a married woman and she has 6 children aged between 20 and 30 for whom she is always in search of a better life.  Yomaira is very well known in her neighborhood because she has a business selling different merchandise.  She sells many products, more exactly what her customers need, in lines for women, men and children, clothes, footwear, cosmetics, basically anything her customers order.

Her entrepreneurial dream began in 2005 when she set up a café in the El Prado neighborhood, insiD. a university.  In this business activity and owing to her good relations, she attracted and maintained good customers who today, in her business selling merchandise, are her most special customers.  As she knows them very well, she sells to them on credit and together with each one she plans their payments in accordance with the conditions that she arranges with them.  The goods that Yomaira sells most of are clothes and cosmetics.

This Kiva loan is Yomaira's third loan with Fundación Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy women's dresses, clothes and beauty products as she has orders for them from her customers for the end-of-year season which is approaching and sees a lot of sales.  With her previous loans she managed to acquire working capital to increase her purchase of articles and respond appropriately to her buyers.  As her dream is to have a reputable store where she sells all sorts of products, Yomaira is working persistently.  She would like to open up to new possibilities for business and family growth.

Her main challenge is increasing her number of customers with a better coverage of neighborhoods in which she sells her merchandise.  Yomaira is planning to renew her inventory of goods in order to cheerfully dress her customers the the Christmas holidays.

loans.use: To buy women's dresses, clothes and beauty products which her customers have ordered

loans.name: La Tinajita Group

texts.es:
LA TINAJITA

CELESTINA P. C.. tiene 40 años de edad, se dedica a la confeccion de tejidos o  guipiles a mano y tambien tiene dos terlares de pedal y alli elabora servilletas, tiene a una muchacha que la ayuda
Desde hace 20 años se dedica a esa su actividad, su producto no lo vende en comalapa ella viaja a otro lugar para poder vender su producto, pero en esta epoca que ya viene fin de año tiene pedidos y es por esa razon que ella solicita su credito a la fundacion  para poder obtener materia prima para elaborar su producto.

ESTELA S. C.. tiene 25 años deedad ella es soltera, se dedica a la venta de guipiles  tiene ya su herramienta, pero tambien elabora tejidos a mano, y es por esa razon necesita su credito para comprar materia prima para elaborar guipiles a mano, y poder obtener otras ganancias.


MARIA BERTILA S. C.. Tiene dos hijas las cuales las tiene en la escuela estudiando son pequeñas todavía pero ya la apoyan en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, ella necesita su prestamo para poder surtir su tienda con mas productos, porque su tienda es pequeña y le piden otros productos, tambien realiza tejidos a mano., para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de su familia, y obtener mejor vida .
texts.en:
THE SMALL EARTHENWARE JAR

CELESTINA P. C., 40, makes hand woven guipiles (regional, indigenous blouse).  She also has two pedal looms that she uses to make napkins.  She has a young woman who helps her.   She has been in this line of work for 20 years.  She doesn’t sell her items in Comalapa; she goes to another place in order to sell.  However, in this end of year season that is approaching she has many pending orders and this is why she’s asking the Fundación for a loan to get raw materials for her items.

ESTELA S. C., 25, is single.  She sells guipiles, too.  She has her tools but she also hand weaves them and needs funds to buy raw materials for hand woven guipiles in order to earn other profits.

MARIA BERTILA S. C. has two daughters in school.  They are still little but they help her with the business.  She sells daily use items and needs the loan to stock her store with more products because the store is small and customers ask for more items.  She also makes hand woven items to help her husband with family expenses and to obtain a better life.

loans.use: To make woven items.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El Señor Miguel G. de 62 años de edad esta casado hace 40 años con la Señora Casimira Caceres de 55 años de edad; el matrimonio tiene dos hijos todo mayor de edad y cada uno tiene formada su familia y viven en forma independiente.
Don Miguel se dedica a la carpinteria desde hace 16 años y su señora tiene un pequeño almacen y juntos se ayudan para llevar adelante los gastos familiares y por ende mejorar el nivel de vida que llevan.
Solicita este préstamo para la compra de maderas,  terciadas  clavos, gaseosas, bebidas, golosinas, arroz, fideos, harina, azucar, yerba y otros articulos que comercializa en su negocio, ya que está llegando fin de año y tiene que prepararse para cumplir con todos los que tiene ya  sea en su carpinteria y almacén.
texts.en:
Miguel G. is 62 years old and has been married to his 55-year-old wife, Casimira Caceres, for 40 years. They have two children who are both adults and have their own families and live independently.

Miguel has worked in carpentry for 16 years and his wife has a small grocery store. They help each other with the household expenses and to therefore, improve their quality of life.

He is requesting this loan for the purchase of wood, plywood, hammers, sodas, drinks, snacks, rice, pasta, flour, sugar, maté, and other items sold in their store. The end of the year is approaching and he needs to prepare himself to meet all of the demands, both in his carpenter’s shop or grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase wood, plywood, hammers, drinks, sodas, pasta, rice

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: ablavi est une femme qui a appris la couture, pour augmenter ses revenus elle s'est lancée dans le commerce des articles de mercerie. elle s'approvisionne au ghana voisin, sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes.  elle voudrait se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de divers articles de mercerie. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Ce crédit va lui permettre de satisfaire les besoins de fin d'année de sa clientèle
texts.en: Ablavi G. is a woman who learned how to sew. She began selling sewing notions to increase her revenue. She gets her supplies in neighboring Ghana and her clientele consists of all types of people. She wants to stock up and is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase a variety of sewing notions. She is married and the mother of two children. This loan will enable her to meet the year-end needs of her clientele.

loans.use: Purchase sewing notions

loans.name: Dankoelode

texts.fr: Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Pour contribuer au menage, elle fait le commerce  de céréales.  Elle a 41 ans  et compte dans cette activité 10 ans déjà. Elle a  demandé de credits qui ont été remboursés.  Elle achète à Lomé et revend  au marché local de noudokope. Elle sollicite au près de WAGES un prêt pour acheter 10 sacs de maïs, 20 bols de mil, 15 bols de fonio et 15 sacs d’haricôt.
texts.en:
This woman is married with two children. She sells grain to help with the household expenses. 

She is 41 years old and has already been in this business for ten years. Previous loans were all fully repaid. 

She gets her stocks in Lomé for resale at the local market of Noudokope. 

She is now seeking a loan from WAGES to buy 10 bags of maize, 20 bowls of millet, 15 bowls of fonio, and 15 bags of beans.

loans.use: To buy grain

loans.name: Dédé Imelda

texts.fr: dédé est une femme très dynamique, elle est célibataire. pour subvenir à ses propres besoins, elle s'est lancée dans le commerce des produits cosmétiques. elle a une ancienneté de 7 ans dans ce commerce, sa clientèle est composée en majorité de femmes. voulant mettre les chances de son côté pour accroître son revenu, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour gonfler son stock avec 3 cartons de crème, 2 cartons de mèches, des tissages et divers
texts.en: Dédé is an energetic single woman. To meet her needs, she started selling cosmetic products. She has worked in that business for 7 years and her customers are mostly women. To increase her chances of making more income, she is asking WAGES for a loan to be able to add 3 boxes of cream, 2 boxes of hair extensions, hair weavings and miscellaneous products to her stock.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Enyonam Akuvi

texts.fr: Elle a 48 ans et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est mariée. Pour participer au menage, elle fait le commerce de pagne, vestes et chaussures. Elle exerce cette activité 10 ans déjà. Elle achète au grand marché de Lomé et revend à avepozo. Elle demande ce prêt pour acheter 30 pièces de pagnes.
texts.en: She is 48 years old and the mother of four. She is married. In order to contribute to the family budget, she sells traditional “pagnes” fabric, jackets and shoes. She has been in this business for 10 years already. She stocks up at the big market of Lomé and resells in Avepozo. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase 30 sets of “pagnes.”

loans.use: Purchasing traditional "pagnes" fabrics

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: cette femme est célibataire avec 3 personnes à charges, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de céréales, elle a commencé cette activité en 2000 et s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans la ville d'anié. elle réalise de bonnes recettes car le céréales est une denrée très utilisée dans la cuisine togolaise. faisant face à une demande élevée de sa clientèle, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 5 sacs de maïs, 2 sacs de sorgho, 6 bols de mil et divers
texts.en: This woman is single with three dependents. She makes a living by selling cereals. She started this activity in 2000 and stocks up in the interior of the country, in the town of Anié. Her sales are good since cereals are a staple  widely used in the Togolese cuisine. Facing an increased customer demand, she is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to purchase five bags of corn, two bags of sorghum, six bowls of millet, etc.

loans.use: Purchasing cereals

loans.name: Yudel Ondina

texts.es:
Yudel  es una mujer de muy poco recursos económicos, tiene 37años de edad, madre de dos hijos,  vive junto a su esposo el cual se desempeña de albañil, por cuenta propia.
Yudel trabaja en servicios domestico, desde hace varios años el cual inicio por ayudar a su familia, su casa es de zinc, pero propia el cual no ha podido hacer mejora por qué no se ajusta.
Hoy en día está haciendo un financiamiento para lograr comenzar  a construir su casa de concreto, lo que está contenta con este comienzo que Afodenic está dando por medio de préstamos a plazos. Como planes es terminar de hacer  su casa que es su anhelo para una mejor seguridad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yudel, 37, is a woman of very limited economic resources.  She is the mother of two children.  She lives with her husband who works independently as a bricklayer.

Yudel has worked as a domestic employee for several years, work she started in order to help her family.  Her house is made of zinc metal sheeting and, although it’s her own, she hasn’t been able to make improvements to it because her income isn’t enough.

She is negotiating a loan to start to build her house out of concrete.  She is happy with this beginning that Afodenic has made possible through loans payable in installments.  Her plan for the future is to finish building her house to provide better security for her children.

loans.use: She will buy building materials and supplies to start to build her dwelling out of concrete which she will do gradually with these loans due to her economic situation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: kodjo est un homme marié, il vit avec sa femme dans le quartier de hedzranawoé, pour subvenir aux charges, il s'est lancé dans la vente de pièces détachées. il a une ancienneté de 3 ans dans ce commerce. il s'approvisionne au marché local du port autonome de Lomé. il a constaté une baisse de son stock de marchandises raison pour laquelle il sollicite son premier crédit de WAGES pour s'approvisionner avec diverses pièces détachées
texts.en: Kodjo is a married man. He lives with his wife in the neighborhood of Hedzranawoé. To provide for their needs, he started selling spare parts. He has been in this trade for three years. He gets his supplies at the local market of the autonomous port of Lomé. He noticed that his inventory of spare parts was declining, so he came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for his first loan to buy various kinds of spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
María de 32, vende legumbres y muñecos de papel para fin de año. Vive en una zona periurbana el lugar está ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Hace 10 años atrás vendía plátanos para ayudarle a su mama después que en el mercado llamado “PPG” fue reubicado y a todos los comerciantes los ubicaron en otro puestos ella empezó a vender legumbres. Para este año ha iniciado con otro negocio que es la venta de muñecos de papel gigantes para el 31 de diciembre tener un buen capital y comenzar el año bien (En Ecuador el 31 de diciembre se lo celebra quemando muñecos de papel de dos metros en adelante como tradición de quemar las malas energías, los comerciantes comienzan hacer estos muñecos desde agosto para tener buenas ventas). Trabaja en las mañana en el mercado y en las tarde elabora los muñecos con ayuda de un amigo.    

Con el préstamo quiere comprar pegamento para los muñecos y comprar zinc para el techo de su casa y así mejorarla. En el futuro quiere tener bien adecuada su casa.
texts.en:
María is 32 years old.  She sells vegetables and paper dolls for end-of-year celebrations.  She lives in a peri-urban area in Perimetral de Guayaquil, an area surrounded by a salt marsh.

Ten years ago she used to sell bananas to help her mom out.  Then the “PPG” market was relocated and all the sellers were moved to other places.  She began to sell vegetables.  This year she has also started another business which is selling giant paper dolls for 31st of December celebrations, to have good capital and make a good start to the new year.  In Ecuador, the 31st of December is celebrated by burning 2 meter-high paper dolls.  The tradition is to burn bad energies.  Craftsmen begin making these dolls in August to make good sales.  María works in the market in the morning and in the afternoon she makes the dolls with the help of a friend.

She will use the loan to buy glue for her dolls and corrugated metal roofing for her house, thereby improving it.  In the future she wants to have her house decent.

loans.use: To buy glue and corrugated metal roofing

loans.name: Elías Eliseo

texts.es: Elías Eliseo D. de 29 años de edad, es padre de familia de dos hijas menores de edad, así mismo vive junto a su esposa en Mejicanos, en el departamento de San Salvador. Elías se dedica a la venta de ropa para hombres y mujeres, la cual comercializa a las afueras de la Universidad de El Salvador, en la capital del país en donde no solo vende con los estudiantes del lugar sino con personas que transitan esa calle y con personas que viven en los alrededores, su esposa le ayuda con la venta y de esta forma ambos trabajan muy duro para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. Elías solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar más ropa para vender en la temporada navideña en donde su demanda se incrementa, por lo cual desea estar preparado y aprovechar al máximo dicha temporada.
texts.en: Elías Eliseo D. is 29 years old and has two young daughters.  He lives with his wife in Mejicanos, located in the department of San Salvador.  Elías works selling men's and women’s clothing outside of the University of El Salvador, located in the country’s capital.  He doesn’t only sell among the university students, but also to people that pass by the street and others that live nearby.  His wife helps him to sell and this way, they both work very hard to bring a daily means of support to their home.  Elías is requesting a loan so that he can purchase clothing to sell during the Christmas season when the demand increases.  He wants to be prepared and take advantage of the season as much as possible.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Alvelica

texts.es: Alvelica M. D. E. D. 30 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo y un hijo D. 7 años D. edad, junto a los cuales vive en el departamento D. La Libertad. Ella posee una tienda D. productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad, la cual esta ubicada en su misma casa D. habitación, lo cual trae mucho beneficios, ya que pueD. dedicarse a su negocio al mismo tiempo que se dedica a sus hijos y a los quehaceres del hogar. Su negocio es uno D. los más surtidos del lugar y que cuenta con mayor cantidad D. clientes, tanto por su excelente servicio como por sus precios accesibles. Alvelica solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el dinero necesario para invertir más en su negocio, aumentando la cantidad D. cada producto, y D. esta manera poder atender a mayor cantidad D. clientes. Ella es una mujer muy responsable quien se siente muy agradecida por el hecho D. poder contar con un negocio propio el cual le permita brindarle todo lo necesario a su hijo.
texts.en: Alvelica M. D. E. is 30 years old and lives with her husband and 7-year-old son in the department of La Libertad. She owns a store for perishable goods and necessities, which is located in her house.  This is beneficial because she can focus on her business while also devoting time to her children and household chores.  Her business is one of the best stocked in her area and has many customers, both because of her excellent service and her affordable prices. Alvelica is applying for a loan to get the money needed to invest more in her business, increasing the amount of products, and in this way serving more customers. She is a very responsible person who feels grateful for being able to have a business which allows her to give her child everything he needs.

loans.use: To purchase perishable goods.

loans.name: Téné

texts.fr: téné  exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de céréales, pour avoir une plus grande marge bénéficiaire sur ces ventes, elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans la ville de bassar. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. elle  fait face à une rupture de stock et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 10 sacs de maïs et assurer le transport de la marchandise.
texts.en: Téné earns her living by selling cereals. To get a higher profit margin, she buys her supplies within the country, namely in the city of Bassar. She has a diversified clientele. Right now her inventory is depleted and she came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for a loan to buy 10 sacks of corn and pay for their transportation.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Rina Yanira

texts.es: Rina Yanira H. D. R. D. 38 años D. edad, posee una sala D. belleza, en la cual realiza cortes D. cabello, tintes, pedicure, manicure, faciales y todo lo relacionado con el cuidado D. la imagen. Ella vive junto a su esposo y junto a dos hijos menores D. edad. Rina colocó su propio negocio en su casa D. habitación con el enorme deseo D. mejorar la estabilidad económica D. su casa, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y visionaria la cual no solo realiza diferentes tipos D. servicios, sino también comercializa perfumes, tratamiento para el cuidado del cabello, peines, cremas para el cuerpo, shampoo y otros productos más, a pesar que cuenta con un año y medio D. poseer su negocio, en la actualidad cuenta con varios clientes, quienes se sienten a gusto con el trabajo hecho por Rina y por sus precios tan accesibles. Ella solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder comprar mayor cantidad D. productos, así mismo introducir a su salón nuevas marcas las cuales son D. mucho prestigio, con lo que desea atraer más clientes a quienes les pueda elaborar un mejor trabajo.
texts.en: Rina Yanira R. H. is 38 years old and has a beauty salon where she provides hair cuts, dyes, pedicures, manicures, facials and everything related to image care. She lives with her husband and with her two young children. Rina placed her own business in her home with the enormous desire to improve the economic stability of her home. She is a very hardworking and visionary woman who not only performs different types of services but also sells perfumes, hair treatments, body lotions, shampoos and other products. Despite only having owned her business for one and a half years, she currently has several clients who are comfortable with Rina's work and with her affordable prices. She is requesting this loan to buy more products in order to introduce new brands in her salon which are more prestigious so that she can attract more customers.

loans.use: Purchase products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: The Women´s Bank To Build A Better Future Group

texts.en:
This group's name translates as “The Women's Bank to Build the Future.” The group members live in Sarapiqui, Heredia, a rural region close to the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica. The group members will use this loan for general investments in productive activities such as the purchase and sale of catalogue items. The revenues earned by both sisters contribute significantly to their respective household incomes. 

Alis is a 24-year-old mother of two. When she is not carrying out domestic responsibilities such as household maintenance, food preparation and childcare, she is dedicated to the activity of making sales of various products in her community. Two days a week, Alis travels door to door, offering potential clients the opportunity to peruse a catalogue filled with a variety of products from car parts to underwear. After collecting orders, she goes to a distributor meeting for her specific catalogue company and purchases the items. Upon delivery, Alis is paid for her services. This loan will be used to finance the purchase of catalogue items for resale. Alis says her kitchen products are the most popular. She would like to expand her business and find more clients. Alis has been involved in this business for about a year.

Maricel is a 22-year-old mother. She is involved in the same activity as her sister, Alis, only with a different catalogue company. Maricel will use this loan for the purchase of products to sell in her community and to finance travel expenses. The difference between Maricel's business and that of her sister's is that Maricel must travel to San Jose, the capital of Costa Rica, in order to purchase her products, about a 2-hour journey each way by bus.

loans.use: To purchase various catalogue items.

loans.name: Ana Joaquina

texts.es: Ana Joaquina R. M. reside en el municipio de Soyapango en donde reside junto a su compañero de  vida quien se dedica a trabajar, y junto a dos hijos de 12 y 10 años de edad. Ana trabaja muy duro de lunes a domingo elaborando pupusas, las cuales son un alimento muy típico de este país, el cual esta hecho a base de masa de maíz o de arroz y se rellena de queso, chicharrón y frijoles, por lo que es un negocio bastante estable, en el cual se cuenta con muchos clientes a pesar de poseer diferente competencia. Ana y su familia depende en gran manera de las ganancias de este negocio por lo que es de mucha importancia poder mejorar sus ventas, es por ello que solicita un préstamo a Integral con el deseo de comprar maíz por mayor, así mismo comprar tambos de gas propano, repollo, queso, tomates, frijoles y otros ingredientes más. Esto lo hace con el deseo de contar con la materia prima de su negocio y así obtener mayores ganancias, las cuales sean de mucho beneficio para su familia.
texts.en: Ana Joaquina R. M. lives in the town of Soyapango together with her life partner, who works, and their two children who are 12 and 10 years old.  Ana works very hard from Monday to Sunday making pupusas (stuffed tortillas) which are a very traditional food in El Salvador..  They are made from corn or rice dough and are filled with cheese, ground pork meat paste and beans.  It is quite a stable business and she has many customers in spite of having competition.  Ana and her family depend to a large extent on the earnings from this business so it is very important for her to be able to improve her sales.  This is why she is requesting a loan from Integral, as she would like to buy corn wholesale as well as cans of propane gas, cabbage, cheese, tomatoes, beans and other ingredients.  She would like to be able to have ingredients for her business and thereby make more profits which would be very beneficial for her family.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, cheese and vegetables

loans.name: Comlanvi

texts.fr: comlanvi est un homme marié et père de 3 enfants, pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, il a ouvert sa propre boutique de vente de produits d'alimentation générale qu'il a appelé "MAWULOLO". il s'approvisionne dans les marchés locaux de Lomé. il a une façon très attirante d'accueillir sa clientèle. les périodes de fête de fin d'année approche et il souhaiterai augmenter son stock pour bien vendre, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 3 sacs de riz, 5 sacs de spaghetti, 3 bidons d'huile, 1 carton de tomate en conserve et divers autres produits d'alimentation générale
texts.en: Comlanvi is married and the father of three children. To provide for his family, he opened his own grocery store which he calls "Mawulolo" ("God is great" in Ewe). He gets his supplies at the local markets in Lomé. He has a pleasant character and easily attracts and welcomes customers. Since the end-of-year celebrations approach, he wants to increase his inventory and get a better turnover. He came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for a loan to buy 3 sacks of rice, 5 sacks of spaghetti, 3 cans of oil, 1 box of canned tomatoes and various other grocery products.

loans.use: To buy grocery products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies for making food

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: abla est une femme de 40 ans très dynamique, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des articles de mercerie. elle a une expérience de 3 ans dans ce commerce. elle a remarqué une hausse de la demande de sa clientèle liée probablement aux activités de fin d'année, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour s'approvisionner avec 5 cartons de fils à coudre, 10 boîtes de bouton, 4 cartons de fermeture et divers.
texts.en: Abla, aged 40, is a very dynamic lady. She is married and the mother of four children. She earns a living by selling haberdashery. She has a 3-year experience in this trade. She noticed that the demand from her clientele was rising, probably due to the end-of-year celebrations. She came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for a loan to buy 5 boxes of sewing thread, 10 boxes of buttons, 4 boxes of zippers and various articles.

loans.use: To buy haberdashery articles

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: Elva tienen 52 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace 2 años posee una tienda D. venta D. productos D. primera necesidad, negocio que se encuentra instalada en el interior D. su casa. Es así que cada mañana atienD. a sus clientes, en ocasiones son muchos por lo que sola no se da abasto, pero es cuando sus hijos la apoyan en este trabajo. Su negocio es uno D. los pocos que existen dentro D. su localidad por lo que sus ventas son estables y con el paso del tiempo ha sabido captar la necesidad D. su clientela, por ello procura abastecerla D. diversos productos y D. mayor demanda. Por ahora su anhelo es incrementar D. mercadería su tienda. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. mercadería y tener mayor variedad D. productos en su tienda.
texts.en:
Elva is 52 years old.  She lives with her 2 children in her own home.  She has owned a small convenience store for 2 years.  Her business is insiD. her home.  Every morning she serves her customers.  Sometimes she has a lot of customers and can't serve them all herself but her children support her in her work at these times.  Her business is one of the few that exist in her town which means that her sales are stable and over time she has known how to understand her customers' needs and she tries to keep her business stocked with different products and products which are in most demand.  For now her wish is to increase the amount of merchandise in her store.

This is the first loan which she has had from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She likes being part of her community bank because all its members are responsible people and very supportive of one another.  She thanks the people who will help to fund her loan since it will be very useful for her in making progress in her business.  With her loan she will invest in the purchase of merchandise and have a wider variety of goods in her store.

loans.use: To stock up with products to satisfy her customers' demands

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es: Jacinta  tiene 55 años, es viuda, vive con sus 2  hijos en su casa propia. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a L. agricultura y a L. crianza D. animales como vacas cerdos y ovejas que tiene en su establo, por lo que sus hijos L. ayudan en esta actividad que diariamente desarrolL.. L. venta D. animales lo hace periódicamente ya que le trae mejores ganancias que L. agricultura, es por ello que mientras espera el tiempo D. cosecha, que demora 6 meses, L. venta D. animales cubre sus necesidades económicas. Sin embargo los cambios climáticos, han perjudicado L. mayoría D. veces su cosecha, es por tal razón que desea incrementar L. cantidad D. animales que posee. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que será muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en L. compra D. sacos D. abono para L. siguiente siembra D. papa, maíz y alfalfa.
texts.en:
Jacinta is 55 years old and a widow.  She lives in her own house with her 2 children.  She has worked in agriculture and has raised animals like cows, pigs and sheep her whole life.  Her children help her daily with her work.  Periodically, she sells her animals since she earns more doing this than in agriculture. While she waits for harvest time, about a 6 month period, her animal sales cover her necessary expenses.  However, climate changes have hurt the majority of harvest times and for this reason that she wants to increase the number of animals that she has.  

This is her first loan with MFP and it gives her peace of mind to know that she has financial support.  In addition, she is grateful to be a part of her communal bank because she knows that all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.  She is also grateful to all the people who will help to make this loan possible as it will be invaluable for the advancement of her business.  With the loan that she is requesting she will buy sacks of fertilizer for her next planting of potatoes, corn and alfalfa.

loans.use: To purchase bags of fertilizer to ensure a good potato, corn and alfalfa crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy potato and corn seed and sacks of manure.

loans.name: Flores De Las Lomas Group

texts.es: El grupo las flores de Loma Alta está integrado por 3 personas,  mujeres casadas,  con hijos originarias de la localidad, ellas se dedican a la venta y cultivo de variedad de flores que se da en este país, como rosas, crisantemos, chastas, gerberas, gladiolas,  ellas tienen deseo de  seguir invirtiendo en la compra y cosecha de de flores ya que en estas fechas, por la celebración del día de los santos  es cuando tienen más demanda y requieren de mucho capital, y sobre todo poder aprovechar la temporada y así mismo prepararse para la temporada navideña, entre sus sueños es seguir manteniéndose en el negocio en la cual ya llevan varios años, por heredad de negocio, con la cual apoyan a sus esposos económicamente y se sienten con entusiasmo para seguir  perseverando y alcanzar sus sueños, como familia.
texts.en:
The Las Flores de Loma Alta (Flowers of Loma Alta) has three members.  They are married women with children from the location.  

They grow a variety of flowers common to this country, like roses, chrysanthemums, daisies, gerberas and gladioli, to sell.  They want to continue investing in the purchase and harvesting of flowers which in this season, because of the celebration of All Saints Day, is when they are most in demand.  They also need capital to take advantage of the season and to prepare for the Christmas season.  

Among their dreams is to stay in business; they have already been in it for several years, having inherited it.  The business allows them to help their husbands economically and they are enthusiastic about persevering and reaching their family goals.

loans.use: For flower sales.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos tiene 24 años, vive en una casa alquilada. Desde hace 6 años se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte, para ello cuenta con un vehículo el cual arrienda por periodos. Este trabajo la tiene siempre ocupada durante la semana, siendo los domingos el día que descansa, afirma que este trabajo es muy agotador, ya que debe tener cuidado cuando conduce, para poder evitar futuros accidente. Por otro lado, se dedica también a la siembra de papa y maíz que le sirven para su propio sustento. Por ahora su mayor anhelo y prioridad es mejorar el trabajo de transporte, por ello desea mas adelante adquirir su propia movilidad. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en el pago y recategorización de su licencia de conducir.
texts.en:
Carlos, 24, lives in a rented house.  For the last six years he has been in public transportation services.  He leases a vehicle for periods of time.  This work keeps his occupied during the week and he rests on Sundays.  He states that the work is exhausting because he must be very careful while driving to avoid accidents.

On the other hand he also farms potatoes and corn for his own nourishment.  For now, though, his greatest wish and priority is to improve his transportation business; he wants to acquire his own car.

This is his first loan with MFP and he is very happy to know that he can count on financial support.  Besides, he enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are people he knows and they are responsible and very mutually supportive.  He thanks all those who will fund the loan he’s requesting that will be very useful for his business.

He will use the requested funds to pay for reclassification of his driver’s license.

loans.use: To pay to reclassify his driver’s licence.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Señoras De Fe Group

texts.es:
SEÑORAS DE FE
Este grupo está conformado por doña María Santos P. B. de 45 años, tiene 2 hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años hace comales,  compra y vende,  ella los fabrica en su casa y está muy contenta porque con eso sostiene a su familia. También esta doña Miriam Verónica Q. de 20 años solicita el cradito para agrandar su venta de productos de la canasta basica doña Aura Marina C. C. ella es la líder de este grupo y ella se dedica a la venta de ropa típica, desde hace 7 años pero ella nos cuenta que para poder agrandar su negocio necesita mucho capital ya que la ropa típica es muy cara, pero con lo poquito que tiene la gente le pide más y por eso ella quiere surtir mas su negocio, tiene 4 hijos y con su pequeño negocio ha ido superándose, ella confía en que fape le pueda dar la oportunidad de agrandar su negocio y así poder crecer porque necesita el dinero para comprar más ropa y venderla, y a la vez quedar bien con su clientela.
texts.en:
WOMEN OF FAITH

Mrs. María Santos P. B., 45, is a member of this group.  She has two children and for the last 10 years has made griddles to sell.  She makes them in her house and is very happy because she supports her family through this work. 

Another member is Mrs. Miriam Verónica Q., 20.  She is requesting funds to enlarge her grocery sales business.

Mrs. Aura Marina C. C. is the group leader and she has sold typical clothing for the last 7 years.  However, she tells us that in order to expand her business she needs a lot of capital because typical costumes are very expensive.  Even though she has little available still people ask her for more and that’s why she wants to enlarge her stock.  She has four children and her small business has made it possible for her to get ahead gradually.  She trusts that Fape will be able to give her the opportunity to enlarge her business so that she can grow because she needs the money to buy more clothes to sell and meet customer demand.

loans.use: To make woven articles, sale of griddles and basic grocery items.

loans.name: Rosio Micaela

texts.es: La Sra. Rosio, vive en  la zona de  Molle Molle  vive en alquiler  hace varios años en la misma zona,  tiene  dos hijos  su esposo es profesor, la Sra. tiene una tienda de barrio a una cuadra de la escuela en plena esquina, es una pareja joven trabajadora están trabajando ambos  con la ilusión  de poder  ahorrar para comprar un terreno y así poder tener su propia casa . El préstamo lo destinara  para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Rosio has lived in the Molle Molle area in a rented unit for several years.  She has two children and her husband is a teacher.

She has a neighborhood grocery store right on the corner one block from the school.

They are a young, hard working couple both working with the dream of saving up to buy a piece of property in order to own a house of their own.

The loan will be used to stock the store.

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia tiene 19 años, vive con su padre y su hermano en casa de sus progenitores. Desde hace 5 años tiene una tienda, el cual administra, ya que anteriormente lo hacía su madre antes de fallecer. Ahora administra este negocio, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo, puede cubrir sus gastos educativos. Mientras su padre se encarga del trabajo cuando ella estudia. Por otro lado y durante las noches vende sándwich, así aumenta sus ganancias. Considera que ambos negocios son rentables por lo que ha decidido intensificar en la venta e incrementar su mercadería con mayor variedad de productos. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en:
Cecilia, 19, lives with her father and a brother in her parents’ house.  For the last five years she has had a store that she runs.  Her mother used to run it before she died.  Now she does and the profits earned from her work cover her educational expenses.  Her father sees to the store when she’s in school.  In addition, in the evening she sells sandwiches to increase profits.  She feels that both businesses are profitable so she has decided to intensify sales and increase merchandise stocking a wider variety of goods.

This is her first loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she can count on financial support.  Besides, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because she knows all the members and they are responsible and very mutually supportive.  She thanks all who will fund the loan that will be very useful for her business’ progress.

She will use the requested loan to buy more merchandise to stock her store.

loans.use: To buy more stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es: El Sr. José, vive la zona de molle molle, es casa propia  don de vive con toda su familia, su esposa tiene una tienda de barrio, tienen 4 hijos que están en el colegio, el sr. José es muy conocido en su trabajo el es transportista de la línea de trufis de sacaba trabaja de lunes a sábado los domingos se dedica a su familia, es una familia muy trabajadora, el préstamo lo destinara para la refacción de su  domicilio y para su tienda de barrio, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
José lives in Molle Molle in his own house with all of his family.  His wife has a neighborhood grocery store and they have four children who are in school.

José is very well known in his work; he’s a Sacaba communal taxi driver.  He works from Monday through Saturday and dedicates Sundays to his family.  They are a very hard working family.  The loan will be used for home and store improvements.

He is very grateful to the institution for the help provided.

loans.use: To refurbish his home and neighborhood grocery store.

loans.name: Felix Amada

texts.es:
Félix Amada es una señora muy trabajadora, se dedica al comercio de productos de venta de cerdos, compra y vende cerdos ese es su negocio desde hace años. Procreo cuatro hijos de los cuales uno trabaja con ella, en el destace, otro ingreso que tiene es la costura pues repara ropa, y hace nueva. 
Felix ha venido trabajando con la institución durante ocho ciclos en donde ha logrado comprar más cantidad  cerdo ya que muchas veces no se alcanza por el costo del cerdo. Pues el financiamiento ha sido de gran beneficio en su negocio.
Con esta nueva inversión comprara dos cerdos, y hacer sus nacatamales que día a día vende, como la carne, fritos entre otros ricos platillo de esta especie.
texts.en:
Felix is a very hard-working woman who is dedicated to selling pork products.  She has bought and sold pigs for years.

Felix has 4 children, 1 of whom works with her in the butcher shop.  Another is a seamstress who makes and repairs clothes.

Felix has worked with this institution during 8 loan cycles, making it possible for her to buy more pigs, since often, she lacks the funds to cover the cost of the pigs.  So, the financing has been of great benefit to her business.

With this new investment she will buy 2 pigs, and continue making the “nacatamales” (a local favorite) which day by day she sells, along with fried meat, among other rich dishes of this sort.

loans.use: TO BUY TWO PIGS AND INCREASE MEAT SALES

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Honorata; tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de hortalizas,ella tiene un pequeño terreno donde cultiva zanahorias,lechugas,tomates y papas y luego los vende en diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Urubamba o de la ciudad de Cusco,la socia quiere mejorar las tierras de cultivo.  La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para su chacra.


La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Honorata belongs to the “Reyna De Los Angeles” (Queen of Angels) Communal Bank.  It is in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Honorata, age 35, is married and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling vegetables.  She has a small piece of land where she grows carrots, lettuce, tomatoes, and potatoes.  She later sells them in different markets in the city of Urubamba or the city of Cusco.  

She wants to improve her farm land.  She is requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farm.

She is grateful for the requested loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: El señor Nelson dedicado al la producción de sillones de madera ya hace mas de cinco años actividad donde le va muy bien por los numerosos pedidos que tiene cuenta con una familia de 2 hijos y su querida esposa las cual le  colabora en  la producción de los sillones, siendo este su ingreso para mantener al hogar y para costear los estudios de  sus dos pequeños. Este crédito le ayudara al señor en compra una herramienta como una cepilladora de Madera para mejorar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Nelson has been making wooden chairs for over five years.  It is going very well for him because of the numerous orders that he has.

His family is comprised of two children and his dear wife.  They work together to make the chairs.  This is his income to support the household and to pay for the two little ones’ education.

The loan will help him buy tools like a wood planer to improve his work.

loans.use: To buy a planer

loans.name: Lucero De La Mañana Group

texts.es: Doña Federica P., tiene cuarenta y cuatro años de edad, ella es analfabeta, tiene 7 hijos, dos mayores de edad casadas y 5 menores de edad y que tienen bajo su responsabilidad, su esposo se dedica a la confección de pantalones y ella se dedica a la venta de ropas típicas en el mercado de la aldea y cuenta con 8 años de experiencia y de esta forma obtiene ganancias para poder colaborar con los gastos de su familia. Contando con entusiasmo, deseos de superación y la ayuda de unas vecinas  y compañeras de un programa de agricultura organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Banco Comunal se denomina Lucero de la Mañana, el nombré fue elegido por todas las integrantes. El grupo cuenta con 10 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar; la crianza de animales, Confección de Delantales y Pantalones, Venta de Consumo Diario y ropas típicas.  El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra de ropas típicas, para incrementar su negocio. Ya que el sueño de ella es que su negocio crezca, pero por falta de capital, no ha podido, y considera que este crédito le ayudará aumentar su negocio y generara más ingresos para su desarrollo personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Federica P. is 44 years old, and she is illiterate.  She has seven children.  Two of them are grown and married, and five of them are minors for whom she is responsible.  Her husband makes pants, and she sells typical clothing in the village market.  She has eight years of experience.  This is how she gets income to be able to help with the family expenses.

With enthusiasm, the desire to succeed, and the help of neighbors and colleagues in the agricultural program, they organized a group to be able to request a loan.  The name of their communal bank is “Lucero de la Mañana”.  The name was selected by all of the members.  The group is comprised of ten women who have different business activities.  Among those business activities is making aprons and pants and selling daily consumer goods and typical clothing. 

She will use the loan to buy typical clothing in order to increase her business.  Her dream is to make her business grow.  However, due to a lack of capital, she has not been able to do so. She believes that this loan will help increase her business and generate more income for personal and family growth.

loans.use: Working capital to buy and sell typical clothing
