loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia H.  es una mujer de 35 años que tiene un hijo de 9 por el cual està dispuesta a trabajar duramente con tal de ofrecerle una buena educaciòn y las posibilidades de ser exitoso en su vida personal y empresarial . En su salon de belleza ubicado en el barrio Las trinitarias del municipio de Soledad,  Cecilia tiene una muy buena clientela,  que aprovecha para poder distribuìr  productos de belleza, que ella promociona en su salon, asi como tambien la ropa, los bolsos  y el calzado de cuero que trae de Bucaramanga, una ciudad del departamento de Santander del sur. 
Cecilia es una mujer que se proyecta dia a dia, por eso està planeando en el mes de Diciembre tener un muy buen surtido de ropa, bolsos, calzado y cosmèticos,  aprovechando que la temporada de fin de año es de fiestas y comprar insumos como tintes, champoos, enjuagues, porque sabe que hay un despliegue comercial muy importante en esta temporada, porque lo ha vivido; este es justamente el objetivo de tener muy pronto su credikiva, que es su primer credito con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo. Su negocio naciò en el año 1989, cuando trabajaba en una peluquerìa y como producto de sus ahorros, iniciò su empresa cuyo negocio es crear y fortalecer una imagen, mediante el arreglo personal; asì Cecilia vende sus cortes de cabello, aliser, manicure pedicure, blower etc como sus productos principales, pero como es na mujer conciente de la oportunidad,  desde hace dos años està viajando a Bucaramanga donde trae articulos de cuero como bolsos, billeteras y calzado,  que en esta ciudad los fabrican con una muy alta calidad, y que vende en Barranquilla y Soledad donde tiene sus principales clientes; A Cecilia desde que adicionó este ultimo negocio, le ha ido muy bien y ha logrado  construìr   nueva clientela que se entrelaza con la de sus oferta de belleza personal y oxigena muy bien su negocio inicial, aumentado sus utilidades.
Su sueño es adquirir su local propio y muy bien ubicado, especificamente con una buena  afluencia de publico, para capturar la atenciòn de nuevos clientes, los cuales sostendrà con el mejor servicio que ella pueda ofrecer, por eso trata de tener su sala de belleza bien acondicionada y su amabilidad luce ante sus clientes..
texts.en:
Cecilia H., 35, has a 9-year-old son for whom she is willing to work hard in order to provide him with a good education and the possibility of being successful in his personal and business life.

She has a beauty salon in Soledad’s Las Trinitarias neighborhood; she has a good customer base to which she sells beauty products that she features in her beauty salon.  She also sells clothes, purses and leather footwear that she brings from Bucaramanga, a city in the department of Santander del Sur.

Cecilia is a woman who plans day to day.  This is why she’s planning in December to have a good stock of clothes, purses, footwear and cosmetics, taking advantage of the end of year party season.  She will also buy supplies like hair dyes, shampoos and rinses because she knows, because she’s experienced it, that this season brings with it a surge in spending that is very important.  This is precisely the objective of getting a Kiva loan soon. This will be her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  

Her business was born in 1989 when she was employed in a barber shop.  With her savings she started her own business the purpose of which is to create and strengthen personal image through personal care.  Thus, Cecilia sells haircuts, hair straightening, manicures, pedicures, etc. as her main stock in trade.   However, being a woman who is aware of opportunities, for the last two years she has been going to Bucaramanga to bring items like purses, wallets and footwear that are made in that city and are of very high quality to sell in Barranquilla and Soledad where her main customers are.

Since adding this latter business, Cecilia has done very well and has obtained new customers that she now ties into her personal beauty business thus putting new life into her original business and increasing profits.

Her dream is to acquire a well situated location of her own, specifically one with lots of foot traffic to capture the attention of potential new customers who she will retain thanks to the best possible service she can provide.  Because of this she strives to have a well-apportioned beauty salon and that her kindness stands out to her customers.

loans.use: To buy supplies like dyes, shampoos and rinses at wholesale and clothing, purses, footwear and cosmetics.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Judith; tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cuyes y gallinas, ella cria en su casa los hace crecer y luego los vende en forma ambulatoria en la ciudad de Urubamba y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere tener un lugar más grande donde pueda criar a los animales.  La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes y gallinas.


La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Judith is a member of the “Reyna de los Angeles” community bank.  The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, in the province of Urubamba, in the department of Cusco.

Judith is 30 years old.  She lives with her partner and her 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling guinea pigs and chickens.  She raises the animals at home.  She raises them and then sells them in the streets of the city of Urubamba.  Through this business she has managed to support her children.  She would like to have a bigger place in which to raise her animals.  She is requesting this loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

She is grateful for her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and chickens

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina tiene 59 años, vive con su pareja y sus 4 hijos y nietos en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos y cuyes que cría en su granja. Cada 15 días los vende en la feria ganadera de su zona, asimismo los vende  a los restaurante y algunos clientes que acuden a su misma casas para comprar dichos animales. Le agrada criar animales y dedicarse a este trabajo, ya que le permite ser independiente y mejorar sus ingresos. Adicionalmente a esto también arrienda cuartos  que es una entrada mas que favorece su economía por lo que  desea mejorar la infraestructura de su casa. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar y ampliar la infraestructura de su casa  en donde  tendrá más espacio para su granja de animales.
texts.en:
Cristina is 59 years old.  She lives with her partner and their 4 children and grandchildren in her own home.  She has been raising and selling small animals such as chickens and guinea pigs for 10 years.  She raises the animals on her farm.  Every couple of weeks she sells them in her area's livestock market.  She also sells them to restaurants and some customers who come to her house to buy them.  She likes to raise animals and do this work since it allows her to be independent and improve her income.  In addition to this, she rents out rooms which also helps her financial situation.  For this reason, she would like to improve her house's infrastructure.

This is the first loan which she has had from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She likes being a part of her community bank because all of its members are people who she knows.  They are all responsible and very supportive of each other.  She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of building materials to improve and expand the infrastructure of her house in which she will have more space for her farm of animals.

loans.use: To buy building materials to improve her house's infrastructure and expand her farm

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: El señor Rubén se dedica a la venta de comida ya hace bastante tiempo el inicio su venta con un capital mínimo e ingresos relativos ya con el tiempo, con mucho sacrificio logro comprar el kiosco en el que actualmente tiene su venta y tiene ingresos para poder mantener a los hijos que tiene los cuales estudian en el colegio y en su tiempo libre ayudan a la elaboración de la comida.  Además el señor también trabaja con el servicio de taxi durante la tarde y en algunas ocasiones por la noche. El señor tiene muchas metas proyectadas una de ellas es la de comprar un kiosco mas amplio, ahora necesita el crédito para aumentar sus insumos y compra de llantas para su vehículo.
texts.en: Rubén's business is selling food.  He has been in the business for quite a while.  He set it up with a minimum amount of capital and a small amount of money.  With a lot of sacrifice he managed to buy the kiosk where he currently sells his products.  He now has income with which he can support his children who are in school and who help make food in their spare time.  Rubén also works in the taxi business in the afternoon and sometimes at night.  He has many goals.  One of them is to buy a bigger kiosk.  Right now he needs this loan to buy more ingredients and to buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for his food business and tires for his vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Sonia Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora Sonia Guadalupe Márquez  E.  es casada  tiene 3 hijos aun menores de edad que estudian ,inicio con su negocio hace 11 años vendiendo productos por catalogo por medio de una amiga  que la recomendó  sus primeras ventas fueron aproximadamente  de Q.300.00 , su lugar de venta  es donde vive  luego  fue a vender en las aldeas  cercanas, sus ventas fueron creciendo  y ahora tiene personas que le ayudan a vender su producto, ahora cuenta con una venta de Zapatos que lo tiene ubicada en su casa  desde hace un año   con la  ayuda de su esposo han podido salir adelante, siempre sigue vendiendo  productos por catalogo en su casa y tiene personas que le siguen vendiendo, su mayor deseo es poder tener variedad en productos de Zapatos, solicita el credito para comprar calzado o zapatos ahora en el tiempo de Navidad y sacar a delante a sus hijos   y  poder aportar un poco más en  los gastos de la casa.
texts.en: Mrs Sonia Guadalupe Márquez E. is married and has 3 young children who are in school.  She began her business 11 years ago selling products from catalogs.  A friend recommended her and her first sales were for approximately 300 quetzals.  She sold her products from home.  She then went on to sell in nearby towns.  Her sales started to increase and now she has people who help her to sell her products.  For the past year she has had a shoe sales business which is also located in her house.  With the help of her husband they have been able to make progress.  She still sells products from catalogs in her home and has people who keep selling them.  Her main wish is to be able to have a variety of shoes to sell.  She is requesting this loan to buy footwear and shoes now, in time for Christmas.  She would like to help her children get ahead and be able to help a bit more with household expenses.

loans.use: Shoe sales

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La señora Martha vive en casa alquilada con su esposo y su pequeño hijo ella se gana la vida vendiendo edredones, ropa interior y otras cositas ambulando no tiene un puestito fijo pero dice que le va bien que saca para la comida y el alquiler pero a veces no lo suficiente, solicito el  crédito ya  quiere comprar ropa interior  para navidad ya que esta época se vende mucho. La señora esta contenta ya que le dimos el crédito con kiva, uno de sus deseos de la Sra. Martha es la de poder comprarse un puesto fijo para así poder ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Martha lives in a rented house with her husband and small son.  She earns her livelihood selling comforters, underwear and other little things in an itinerant manner because she does not have a fixed sales stand.  However, she states that she does well and earns enough for food and rent but sometimes it isn’t enough.

She asked for the loan and wants to use it to buy underwear for Christmas because during this season sales are high.

She is very happy that we gave her a Kiva loan.  One of her dreams is to be able to buy a fixed stand to sell her wares.

loans.use: To buy underwear and bed sheets.

loans.name: Glendy Siomara

texts.es: La señora Glendy Elías Mejía  se dedica a la venta de productos de comestibles y venta de refacciones como licuados panes con pollo jamón frijol, choco frutas, también vende papas fritas, choco frutas,  ella necesita este crédito para poder  invertirlo en su negocio productos de comestible  y así poder crecer ya que es una señora emprendedora que le gusta negociar y junto a su esposo,  luchan para  poder darle un mejor futuro a sus 4 hijos ; tienen deseos de superarse por lo que en su tiempo libre ayudan  en el negocio tanto a atender a las personas que los visitan como a ordenar el producto  doña Glendy adicional de eso vende productos de catalogo que le sirve como una entrada extra y así lograr sus metas, ella empezó con un pequeño negocio  en el año 1998 que poco a poco fue creciendo y con la ayuda de su familia  ha logrado sostener su negocio que se ubica a las cercanías de la escuela local de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Glendy Elías Mejía sells groceries and snacks like blended fruit drinks, bread with ham, chicken and beans, chocolate covered fruit; she also sells fried potatoes.

She needs funding to buy food items for the store so that the business can grow.  She is an enterprising woman who likes business and, together with her husband, fights to provide a better future for their four children who want to do better so they help out in their free time both tending to customers who come by the store and by placing orders for products.In addition to this, Glendy sells catalogue based products that is an extra source of income to help her reach her goals.  She started out with a small store in 1998 which gradually grew and with her family’s help she has managed to keep the business, which is located near a local school, afloat.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Isac

texts.es: Isac tiene 19 años, es soltero, vive con su padre y su hermana en casa de sus padres. Desde hace 1 año se dedica al transporte, ya que cuando era adolescente se capacitó para chofer, ahora trabaja diariamente, brindando el servicio de transporte, cuyo vehículo que conduce le pertenece a su padre y que le cedió en calidad de alquiler. Por otro lado también trabaja en la crianza de animales menores que vende ocasionalmente a los que le solicitan. Siempre trabajó con un buen empeño, permitiéndole obtener más ganancias y mayor  tiempo de trabajo útil del auto que maneja, es por esa razón que desea tener su propio carro. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de llantas nuevas para el carro, asimismo pagar el mantenimiento mecánico del mismo.
texts.en: Isac is 19 years old, single and lives at his parents' home with his father and sister. He has been working in transportation for one year. As a teenager he trained to be a driver. He now works daily providing transportation services. The vehicle he drives belongs to his father but he rents it from him. In addition, he also works on raising small livestock and sells occasionally to those who inquire. He has always worked with great effort which has allowed him to make more profits and to have a more useful working time from his car. This is why he wants to have his own car. This is the first loan he has obtained from field partner MFP. He is very happy to know that he has financial support and thanks all the people who will be funding the loan he is requesting as it will be very useful in advancing his business. He will invest the loan he is requesting in purchasing new tires for his car and to pay for mechanical maintenance.

loans.use: Purchase tires and pay for mechanical maintenance for his car.

loans.name: Dely Delcy

texts.es:
La  Sra.  Deli tiene 28 años de edad nacida en la provincia de Candelaria. Estado Civil Casada, tiene una hija de  un año y ocho meses, vive en casa familiar hace  cinco años  vive  en el barrio cañada. La Sra. deli se dedica a la venta de ropa, (sabanas, colchas edredones, pantalones y poleras) llevando así mismo toda su mercadería a su pueblo, como también lleva a pedido. 
El crédito que se le otorgo a la clienta es para la compra de mercadería (sabanas pantalones ropa interior toallas u otros): Doña deli agradeció a la institución por haberle brindado la oportunidad de confiar en ella.
texts.en:
Deli, 28, was born in Candelaria province.  She is married and has a year-and-eight-month-old daughter.  She has lived in the family home for five years in the Cañada neighborhood.

Deli sells clothing (sheets, comforters, pants and t-shirts) every day.  She takes the items into town and also sells based on prior orders.

The loan she was granted is to buy merchandise (sheets, pants, underwear, towels and others).  Deli thanked the Institution for providing the opportunity to trust her.

loans.use: To buy pants at wholesale.

loans.name: Las Rosas De Chojunacruz Group

texts.es: Doña María Heberilda T. H. D. I., tiene 50 años D. edad, es casada, ama D. casa, tiene 7 hijos, 4 hijas mujeres y 3 varones, apoya económicamente a su familia y prepararle un buen futuro a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta D. verduras, actividad que ha venido realizando desD. hace más D. 10 años, doña Juana necesita aumentar la cantidad D. vegetales para la venta y así obtener un poco mas D. ganancias, por esta razón deciden organizar un grupo, algunas amigas y vecinas que conocía desD. hace mas D. 10 años, ya que ella trata D. apoyar no solo a su familia, si no que también a las personas D. su aldea. Las integrantes D. este grupo se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como: venta D. frutas y verduras, crianza D. animales, venta D. alimentos, elaboración D. canastas y entre otros, el prestamo lo utilizara, para invertir en el negocio que realiza en este caso la Venta D. Verduras.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Heberilda T. H. D. I., 50, is married and has 7 children; four girls and three boys.  She tries to help support her family economically and prepare a better future for her children.  She sells vegetables and raises small farm animals.  She has been in this line of work for over 10 years.  

Juana needs to better stock her business in order to improve sales and earn a bit more profit.  They decided, then, to form a communal bank.  She supports her children and pays for their schooling so she gathered a few friends and neighbors she knew for over 10 years to form a group because she tries to help out not just her own family but also people in her village.Each of the women is engaged in a different activity such as: fruit sales, animal raising, food sales, and basket weaving, among others.

The loan will be used by Mrs. María T. who will invest it in her business which in this case is Vegetable Sales.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase groceries.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
The story of Gabriela’s business is intertwined with a heartbreaking personal experience. One night in 1988, while living in Mexico City, her 6-month-old son stopped breathing.  Years later in the U.S., Gabriela was working as a childcare provider and enrolled in a CPR course. While helping the instructor to translate the class into Spanish, she realized that with CPR knowledge she might have been able to save her son. 
 
Over the next few years, Gabriela worked hard to become certified as a CPR instructor and an EMT and began volunteering with the Red Cross to teach in her community.  Most importantly, she taught bilingual classes to make sure her students really understood the information. 
 
One year ago, Gabriela officially founded ACC Safety Education. The business is based out of an office and classroom in Redwood City, California, but she and her children, who are both EMTs, also travel to neighboring cities to teach classes. 
 
Gabriela is proud of what she has accomplished and credits her success to the role models in her community. “In this country, we are blessed to have the example of other women who are successful and strong. We don’t have to listen to traditions that tell us ‘we can’t do this.’ I don’t care about those traditions anymore. The most people can tell me is ‘no.’ And then I’ll go and knock on the next door.”  
 
Gabriela received business coaching from a community partner, who then referred her to Opportunity Fund. A $2,600 loan will help her buy supplies, fix her computer and go to an American Medical Association conference. This small loan will also build her credit and allow her to take out a larger loan in the future to make more extensive business improvements.    
 
Looking forward, Gabriela says, “I am concentrating on my business – it’s my passion. I’d like to have more classes, more clients, and hire more teachers.” 
 
To find out more about ACC Safety Education, visit: http://accse.info

loans.use: To fix her computer, purchase supplies, attend a conference and build her business credit

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: Marco Antonio F. de 42 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Él vive junto a su esposa y cuatro hijos, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Marcos posee una venta de llantas usadas, y así mismo las repara, su negocio esta ubicado sobre la carretera Panamericana, la cual es una de las arterias principales de este país por lo que es muy transitada. Marco trabaja junto a uno de sus hijos el cual le ayuda  reparara los neumáticos, Marco posee 14 años de dedicarse a este negocio, por lo que es muy conocido en el lugar y cuenta con toda la confianza de sus clientes. Él solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de llantas usadas para comercializarlas y de esta forma mejorar su negocio.
texts.en: Marco Antonio F. is 42 years old.  He lives in the town of Ilopango which is in the department of San Salvador.  He lives together with his wife and four children who are studying.  Marco has a business selling used tires.  He also repairs them.  His business is on Carretera Panamericana which is one of the main highways of this country and, as such, is very busy.  Marco works together with one of his sons who helps him repair the tires.  Marco has been in this business for 14 years which means that he is very well known in his town and has the trust of his customers.  He is requesting this loan so that he can buy more used tires to sell and thereby improve his business.

loans.use: To buy used tires to sell

loans.name: Jakeline

texts.es: Jakeline tiene 21 años, vive con su pareja en casa de sus padres, en compañía de ellos y de  sus hermanos. Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza desde hace 3 años, de una reconocida marca a nivel mundial, lo hace con la modalidad de catálogos, donde sus clientes ven y eligen el producto que desean comprar, asimismo tiene productos en stock, por lo que obtiene muy buenas ganancias. Le gusta mucho este  trabajo porque es tranquilo y confía mucho en su capacidad de persuasión para recomendar a sus  compradoras los colores de maquillaje que mas les asientan. Paralelamente a esta actividad se dedica también a preparar Queques, que vende una vez por semana, sobretodo los viernes, elabora media docena y los vende por pedidos, además cuenta con una granja de pollos en su casa, de las cuales esta empezando a vender. Como es una joven muy emprendedora para el futuro quiere mejorar  su granja y tener mayor capital de trabajo. Es su segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarias, asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá una parte para adquirir más mercadería, además desea pagar un terreno que va a comprar para ampliar su granja de animales menores.
texts.en:
Jakeline is 21 years old.  She lives with her partner in her parents' home along with her parents and her siblings.  She has been selling beauty products from a world-known brand for 3 years.  She sells her products through catalogs.  Her customers select the products which they want to buy.  She also has products in stock and she makes good profits.  She likes this work very much because it is calm and she has a lot of faith in her powers of persuasion, recommending to her customers the make-up colors which suit them best.  In parallel with this activity, she also makes sponge cakes which she sells once a week, mainly on Fridays.  She makes half a dozen and sells them to order.  She also has a chicken farm at her house and she is beginning to sell the chickens.  As she is a very entrepreneurial young woman, in the future she would like to improve her farm and have better working capital.

This is the second loan which she has had from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She likes being part of her community bank because all its members are responsible people who are all very supportive of each other.  She is grateful to all the people who will help fund her loan as it will be very useful for her to make progress in her business.  She will invest part of the loan in acquiring more merchandise and also use part to pay for a plot of land which she is going to buy to extend her farm for small animals.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise as well as paying for a plot of land to extend her farm for small animals

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: MARIA TERESA Y. I.  TIENE 52 AÑOS CASADA VIVE CON SUS CUATRO HIJOS TODAVIA SOLTEROS Y ESTUDIANTES. VIVE EN CASA PROPIA.ELLA TIENE UNA AMPLIA EXPERIENCIA DE SU NEGOCIO COMO COMERCIANTE, SU TIENDA ESTA UBICADA EN UN LOCAL EN SU CASA DESDE HACE 15 AÑOS. TERESA  ATIENDE SU NEGOCIO Y CON SU  CALIDO TRATO A SUS CLIENTES LOGRA QUE LOS MISMOS LA VISITEN DE NUEVO TAMBIEN POR SU AMPLIO SURTIDO DE PRODUCTOS DE COMESTIBLES  COMO AGUAS GASEOSAS, AZUCAR, MAIZ, FRIJOL ES POR ESO QUE HA TENIDO ÉXITO Y HA LOGRADO AGRANDAR SU PUESTO. GRACIAS AL CREDITO ANTERIOR LOGRO MONTAR OTRO NEGOCIO Y DESEA OTRO CREDITO PARA SURTIR SU NEGOCIO CON OTROS PRODUCTOS DE COMESTIBLES  QUE SUS CLIENTES LE PIDEN, ELLA HA TRABAJADO MUCHO POR SALIR ADELANTE  Y TIENE VARIAS METAS COMO POR EJEMPLO  SEGUIR AYUDANDO A SUS HIJOS CON SUS  ESTUDIOS.
texts.en: Maria Teresa Y. I. is 52 years old.  She is married and lives with her four children who are still single and students.  She lives in her own home.  She has a lot of experience in her business as a saleswoman.  She has run a store in her own home for the past 15 years.  Teresa serves in her store and through her warm dealings with her customers she has managed to get them to visit her over and over.  These repeat visits are also due to the wide selection of food products she provides such as water, soda, sugar, corn and beans.  This is why she has been successful and has managed to expand her business.  Thanks to her previous loan she managed to set up another business and she would like this other loan to be able to stock her business with more food products which her customers are asking for.  She has worked hard to get ahead and has several goals such as, for example, to continue helping her children with their studies.

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Reynaldo Bismarck

texts.es:
Reynaldo es un hombre muy trabajador que gracias  a su tenacidad y empeño por crecer ha dado un giro de crecimiento en su negocio, una ferretería que comenzó hace dos años con ahorros de su trabajo anterior. Siendo de profesión electricista. Y ahora con financiamiento de Afodenic está logrando más productos.
Su meta es tener variedad de productos que pueda ofrecer a sus clientes, y que espera aumentar con este otro préstamo que será utilizado en la compra de: focos de manos grande, cargador de baterías, láminas triangulares, cadena para bicicletas, pinturas espray, alicate entre otros que son de gran demanda.
Lo único que su ferretería ha ocupado un espacio de su casa para todo lo que vende, lo que mejorara con el tiempo un lugar grande para su negocio y que espera lograr junto Afodenic.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is a very hardworking man.  Thanks to his tenacity and determination his business has taken a turn for the better in terms of growth.  He has a hardware store that he started 2 years ago with savings from a previous job as a professional electrician.  Now, with financing from Afodenic, he is getting more products to sell.

His goal is to have a variety of products that he can offer his customers.  He will use this new loan to buy large hand-held spotlights, battery chargers, drafting triangles, bicycle chains, spray paints, pliers, and other items that are in demand.  

The only space that he has to sell all of his hardware products from is a space in his house.  He would like to improve this over time by getting a bigger place for his business; he hopes to achieve this working with Afodenic.

loans.use: to buy hardware products that are in demand so that he can invest in his business and achieve better sales

loans.name: Sandra Maritza

texts.es: Sandra Maritza C. D. F. D. 41 años D. edad, resiD. en Santo Tomás, en el departamento D. San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja vendiendo verduras, y así mismo junto a 2 hijos menores D. edad. Sandra posee una venta D. ganchos, diademas, peines, cremas para cuerpo y el cabello, esmaltes, y otros productos más, su venta es bastante estable, la cual le ha permitido contar con todo lo necesario para vivir. Este negocio es D. mucha importancia para ella, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. productos D. belleza como maquillajes y otros más y D. esta forma pueda aumentar sus ventas, lo cual es su principal objetivo.
texts.en: Sandra Maritza C. D. F. is 41 years old and lives in Santo Tomas in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband who works selling vegetables and with her two small children. Sandra sells hooks, hair bands, combs, body and hair lotion, nail polish and other products. Her sales are very stable which has allowed her to have everything she needs to live. This business is very important to her which is why she is requesting a loan with which she can buy a greater quantity of beauty products such as make up and other products. This will allow her to increase her sales which is her primary objective.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics and other beauty products.

location.town: Santo Tomás, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Quingeo (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Quingeo está formado por 8 mujeres y un hombre quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad es la tercera  ciudad más importante del país, se caracteriza por sus bellos paisajes, la belleza de su naturaleza, su cultura y tradiciones, su gente es amable y hospitalaria, tiene una  gastronomía muy variada. Nuestras socias son mujeres quienes luchan día a día en sus diferentes actividades para ayudar a la economía de sus hogares y así brindar un mejor futuro a sus familias pero siempre con optimismo y una sonrisa en los labios.

La Señora. Raquel Álvarez vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, este es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal, fue invitada por una amiga a formar parte de este  grupo de mujeres luchadoras. Nuestra socia tiene 25 años, vive en unión libre y tiene una niña  de 5 años de edad, su esposo labora como guardia de seguridad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
Doña Raquel es oriunda de la provincia de Machala, vino a vivir en la ciudad de Cuenca hace 3 años invitada por su cuñado, ahora para mejorar su economía se dedica hace un año a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo de la marca Esika, también vende ropa, su producto lo vende recorriendo la ciudad a sus amigas  y conocidas.
Con su crédito va a incrementar su mercadería y va a comprar más ropa y cosméticos. Su  meta es  terminar sus estudios ya que le faltaba el último año de colegio  y luego seguir alguna carrera universitaria.

La Señora Jovita Rodríguez vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, es oriunda de la ciudad de Guayaquil y está viviendo en nuestra ciudad hace 17 años.
Nuestra socia tiene 41 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 25, 23, 11 y 9 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive independiente, su segundo hijo se dedica a trabajar y ayuda en la economía del hogar y sus dos ultimas hijas  estudian en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo labora como guardia de seguridad y no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar. 
Doña Jovita labora como empleada domestica, actividad que realiza hace 9 años,  labora desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde  de lunes a viernes, los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de ropa, vende a sus amigas y de casa en casa, esta en este negocio hace 2 años.
 En este banco comunal es su primer crédito ya que se encuentra reingresando al banco comunal. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para las fiestas de navidad que se encuentran próximas. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Quingeo communal bank is formed by 8 women and one man who live in different parts of the city of Cuenca, the third most import city in the country. It is characterized by its beautiful landscapes and nature, the culture and traditions, its kind and hospitable people and its diverse cuisine. Our members are women who struggle each day in their different activities to improve the economic well-being of their households and to provide a better future for their families, always with optimism and a smile on their faces.  

Mrs. Raquel A. lives in the city of Cuenca and this is the first loan she has received from the communal bank. She was invited by a friend to be a part of this group of strong women. She is 25 years old and lives in common law marriage. She has a 5 year old daughter and her husband works as a  security guard. They don't have their own home so they rent. Mrs. A. is a native of Machala province and came to live in Cuenca 3 years ago at the suggestion of her brother-in-law. For the past year she has been selling cosmetics through a catalog company called Esika. She also sells clothes to her friends and acquaintances. With her loan she will purchase more clothes and cosmetics to increase the merchandise for her business. Her goal is to finish her last year of high school and then start studying at the university. 

Mrs. Jovita R. has been living in the city of Cuenca for the past 17 years and is a native of Guayaquil. She is 41 years old, married with 4 children ages 25, 23, 11 and 9. Her eldest son is married and lives on his own. Her second oldest son works to support the household and her two daughters go to public school. Her husband works as a security guard. They live in a relative's house since they don't own their own home. Mrs. R. has worked as a domestic employee for 9 years and works from 7am til 3pm, Monday through Friday. On the weekends for the past 2 years, she has been selling clothes to her friends and also door-to-door. She is reentering the communal bank system, but this will be her first loan with this particular bank. She will use her loan to invest in clothes for the coming holiday season. She dreams of owning her own home someday.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Nuris Alicia

texts.es:
Nuris se dedica a trabajar en una pulpería que desde hace dos años logro poner fijamente gracias ah ahorros de su trabajo en el exterior, tiene dos hermosos hijos y su esposo trabaja como conductor.
Su meta es lograr hacer crecer más su pulpería, logrando más estabilidad en su negocio, todo  aumentado y la demanda es mucha, ahora con los financiamientos logro más productos lo que ha mejorado sus ventas.
Hoy en día desea invertir en productos de alimento para dar sazón a la comida, granos básicos, golosinas, productos de limpiezas, lácteos, pollo, carne, dando al cliente un mejor servicio en sus productos. Ya que para ella de gran importancia apoyar a su familia, ya que los costos han aumentado en todo lo que con los ingresos que tiene a sume compromisos del hogar.
texts.en:
Nuris works in a small grocery store which she has had for two years.  She managed to set up her store with savings from her outside work.  She has two beautiful children and her husband works as a driver.  Her goal is to expand her grocery store, achieving more stability in her business.  Everything has grown and demand is high.  Now with her loans she has acquired more products which have improved her sales.

These days she would like to invest in food seasonings, basic grains, candies, cleaning products, dairy products, chicken and meat, giving her customers a better service with her products.  Her business is of great importance as it helps support her family at a time when prices for everything have risen.  She uses her income to meet her household commitments.

loans.use: To buy a range of merchandise to sell such as basic grains, cleaning products, food seasonings, candies, meat, chicken etc. to improve her sales

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús tiene 21 años, vive en casa de sus padres al lado de sus padres y su hermana. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte con el carro que alquila diariamente  y luego por las noches devuelve el carro a la cochera del propietario. Él dispone todo el día para trabajar, incluido los fines de semana, es muy prudente con el trabajo que realiza, siempre respeta los límites de velocidad, además ofrece un buen trato a su clientela que le permite tener mas ganancias y mayor  tiempo de trabajo útil del auto que maneja. Su deseo es tener su propio carro y con el tiempo tener una flota de autos donde pueda administrar y ganar más. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, asimismo agradece  a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos para el mantenimiento del carro en el que trabaja.
texts.en: Jesus is 21 years old and lives in his parents' home with his parents and his sister. He has been providing transportation services for 3 years with a car that he rents daily. In the evenings he returns the car to the owner's garage. He works all day including weekends and is very careful in the work that he does. He always respects the speed limits. In addition, he treats his customers well which allows him to obtain greater profits and to spend more useful time in the car that he drives. He wants to have his own car and to eventually have his own fleet of cars that he can manage and thus earn more. This is the first loan he has obtained through field partner MFP. He is happy to know that he can count on their financial support and it makes him glad to be part of his community bank because all of its members are responsible and supportive. He thanks all the people that will fund this loan as it will be very useful in his business' progress. He will invest the loan he is requesting in purchasing spare parts for his car's maintenance.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for the maintenance of his car.

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Y Mi Guía Group

texts.es: Un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras con una sola finalidad, tener éxito en sus negocios y salir siempre adelante, así son las integrantes de la alcancía comunal Dios es Amor y mi Guía conformado por 8 integrantes hace ya más de 2 años y medio. Lo integran personas con iniciativa al cambio y al progreso como la señora Roció H. de 38 años de edad y madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales dos aun son menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de  productos de belleza hace más de dos años con el cual ha podido implementar su hogar y darle a sus hijos la educación y los cuidados requeridos, en el futuro le gustaría tener una bodega, así poder estar cerca a su casa todo el tiempo. Con el reciente préstamo comprara más productos de belleza para la temporada navideña la cual esta pronta ha llegar. Como la señora Rocío  H. todas las integrantes de la alcancía Dios es Amor y mi Guía son mujeres  emprendedoras y luchadoras con el único objetivo de triunfar por el bienestar de ellas y sus familias.
texts.en: A group of enterprising women with one aim, to be successful in their businesses and always make progress.  This is the case of the members of the communal bank “Dios es Amor y mi Guía” (God is Love and my Guide).  The bank has 8 members and has existed for more than two and a half years.  The bank's members all have initiative for change and progress like Mrs Roció H. who is 38 years old and mother to four children, two of whom are still young.  She has been selling beauty products for more than two years which has enabled her to look after her home and give her children the education and care that they need.  In the future, she would like to have a small grocery store so that she can be close to home all the time.  With this loan she will buy more beauty products for the Christmas period which will soon arrive.  Like Mrs Rocío H., all the members of the “Dios es Amor y mi Guia” communal bank are enterprising women and fighters whose sole objective is to succeed for the well-being of themselves and their families.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products for the Christmas season

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: Doña Maruca P. V., tiene 38 D. edad, es una señora casada  con dos hijos, 1 niña D. 9 años y 1 nena especial D. cuatro años Doña Maruca, trata D. apoyar económicamente a su familia y darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta D. telas para elaborar güipiles y blusas, actividad que ha venido realizando desD. hace más D. 10 años, doña Maruca se dio cuenta que necesitaba comprar y surtir su venta y así poder obtener dinero  por esa razón ella quiere, mejorar las ventas y así obtener un poco mas D. ganancias, ella cada día sale a vender en diferentes lugares como también ella venD. en los días D. plaza del pueblo, ella es madre soltera, no tiene el apoyo D. su esposo y con su niña trabaja para darle lo mejor, por lo cual ella reunió a algunas señoras que conocía desD. hace mas D. 10 años para poder conformar un grupo, es el segundo crédito que solicitan a esta institución, no solo apoya a su familia si no que también a las personas D. su aldea. Cada una D. las señoras  se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como: venta D. frutas, crianza D. animales, venta D. ropa, venta D. utensilios,  entre otros. El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar hilo y tela para elaborar los güipiles y las blusas, con lo que espera obtener mejores ingresos y mejorar su condición D. vida.
texts.en: Maruca P. V., 38, is a married woman with 2 children: a daughter 9 years of age and a special little girl who is 4 years old.  Maruca tries to support her family economically and proviD. a better future for her children.  She sells fabric that is used to make shirts and traditional Guatemalan blouses.  She has been doing this kind of work for more than 10 years.  Maruca realized that she needed to make purchases to stock her business so that she could make money; accordingly, she wants to increase her sales and in this way have a little bit more income.  She sells every day in different places and she also sells in her village on market days.  She is a single mother who does not have the support of a husband, and she works so that she can proviD. the best for her daughter.  To do this, she met with some women that she had known for over 10 years so that they could form a group.  This is the second loan that they have requested from this institution, which not only supports their families but also other people in their town.  Each of these women is devoted to a different activity such as: selling fruit, raising livestock, selling clothing, selling utensils, and others.  This loan will be used to purchase the thread and fabric that are used to make traditional Guatemalan blouses and shirts.  With the loan, she hopes to improve her income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: working capital: to buy fabric and thread to make garments

loans.name: Las Margaritas De Santa Catarina Group

texts.es: Doña Eva Nohemí, tiene 18 años de edad, es una señora casada, tiene 2 hijos pequeños, doña Eva trata de apoyar económicamente a su familia y prepararle un mejor futuro a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa que ella  ha podido  mantener, actividad que ha venido realizando desde hace más de 4 años, ella vende en varios municipios, y en los días de plaza del pueblo, para mejorar sus ventas y tener más clientes, doña Eva se decide reunir a algunas amigas y vecinas que conocía desde hace mas de cinco 5 para poder conformar un grupo ya que ella trata de apoyar no solo a su familia si no que también a las personas de su comunidad, el cual cada una de las señoras  se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como: venta de frutas, crianza de animales, elaboración de mochilas,  venta de mercería, entre otros. Necesita surtir mas su negocio para poder mejorar las ventas, de esa manera ella puede obtener un poco mas de ganancias.
texts.en: Doña Eva Nohemí is 18 years old.  She is married and has 2 young children.  Eva tries to support her family financially and provide a better future for her children.  She works selling clothes, an activity which she has been doing for more than 4 years.  She sells in several towns and on town market days to improve her sales and have more customers.  Eva decided to get together some friends and neighbors who she has known for more than five years to form a group since she tries to support not only her family but also people from her community.  Each one of the women works in a different business activity such as: fruit sales, raising animals, making backpacks, notions sales, etc.  Eva needs to better stock her business to improve her sales.  In this way she can earn a little more income.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Las Mariposas De La Posta Group

texts.es:
El siguiente  grupo se llama  “Las mariposas de la posta”, se le dio este nombre porque todas viven en el barrio llamado la posta, y mariposas porque al igual que las mariposas soportan todas las adversidades, ellas han pasado por diferentes vivencias difíciles en el transcurso de sus vidas, ellas dicen “las mariposas son libres y nosotras también, emprenden su vuelo y tienen que soportar adversidades y nosotras también”, de alguna manera ellas se identifican con las mariposas, que también sobreabundan en esta región de Pinotepa. El número de personas que integran el grupo es de 12, que en su mayoría son mujeres y  su representante se llama Marisela López Hernández. 
En esta ocasión  hablaremos de la señora, Verónica L. Hernández, que tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y su esposo se llama Antonio de 38 años de edad quien es de oficio carpintero de toda su vida y tiene un pequeño taller de carpintería donde elabora mesas, sillas, camas, etc., doña Verónica  es madre de 3 hijos que son: Viviana de 10 años de edad que estudia la educación primaria y quien cursa el quinto año escolar, Leonardo de 5 años y que cursa la educación preescolar (kinder) y Jaqueline de apenas un año y seis meses.
Verónica tiene una tiendita de abarrotes que inicio desde hace dos años, en esa tienda ella vende productos de primera necesidad como son frijol, aceite, arroz, pasta para preparar sopa, jabón para lavar ropa, papel higiénico, galletas, así como también refrescos jugos y dulces, en honor a ella decidió ponerle el nombre de miscelánea “vero”, actualmente no tiene casa propia y el lugar donde vive lo esta rentando y allí mismo se encuentra su tienda. 
 Vero como la conocen todos sus vecinos,  solicitó su crédito en fundación realidad, para invertirlo en su negocio, e hizo la compra de productos como son; frijol, aceite, pasta para preparar sopa, arroz, chiles enlatados, papel higiénico. Detergente para lavar ropa y también pudo completar para adquirir un enfriador para refrescos. Nos comparte que su gran motor para seguir con su negocio son sus hijos, ya que por ellos se vio en la necesidad de iniciar este negocio, aunque en algunas ocasiones es tan difícil  continuar pero esto no es motivo para dejar de vender sino que todo lo contrario esto le anima a impulsar mas y mas su proyecto ya que es la única fuente de  mayor ingreso para su familia y dejarlo seria crucial en esta época de necesidad y falta de empleo.
El gran anhelo de Vero es  tener algún día su casa propia en la cual puedan sus hijos  tener un patrimonio que los respalde y al igual manera tener su local propio donde ella pueda continuar con su trabajo, incrementar el mayor numero posible de productos, para hacer crecer sus ventas y ofrecerle un servicio mas completo a sus clientes, también aspira a que su esposo junto con ella puedan implementar un taller de carpintería para darles trabajo a las personas que lo necesitan, de esta manera los que viven a su alrededor mejoren su calidad de vida. Ella quiere que sus hijos terminen una carrera escolar y tengan un buen empleo una vida cómoda y que nunca les falte el alimento diario.
La mayoría de de las personas que integran este grupo son mujeres emprendedoras que día con día luchan para salir adelante y tener una mejor vida, se enfrentan a los retos de una sociedad con desigualdad, en donde la pobreza devora los sueños de muchos, son muy comprometidas con su oficio, es gente muy responsable y que cumplen sus compromisos, lo demuestran siempre, entre ellas existe la confianza necesaria y ese espíritu de ayuda mutua, son solidarias en todo y tienen muy buenas costumbres.
A nombre de todas las que conforman este grupo les agradece a fundacion y a los que colaboran en todo este proyecto que mejora vidas y que encuba los sueños de los que menos tienen. 
Los nombres de las integrantes del grupo “las mariposas de la posta” y sus actividades productivas son: 

Divina G. Romualda. – Antojitos
Ana María Hernández G..- Antojitos
Ernestina L. Sánchez.- Venta de refrescos
Verónica L. Hernández.- Abarrotes
Lidia M. Jiménez.-  Venta de refrescos
Marisela López  Hernández.- Materias primas
Juana O. Hernández.- Abarrotes
Humberta R. Vázquez.- Venta de refrescos
Merced Lucina Gutiérrez Baños.- Venta de perfumes por catalogo
María Elena  L. López.- Antojitos
Malloli T. N..- Antojitos
Soledad T. N..- Venta de pollos
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Mariposas de la Posta” (The Butterflies of la Posta).  They gave themselves this name because they all live in the 'la Posta' neighborhood and, like butterflies, they endure all adversities.    They have lived through a number of different difficult experiences in the course of their lives.  They say “Butterflies are free and so are we.  They take flight and have to face adversity and so do we”.  To some degree they identify with butterflies which there are a lot of in this region of Pinotepa.  There are 12 members in this group who are mostly women.  Their representative is called Marisela López Hernández.

On this occasion we will talk about Mrs Verónica L. Hernández.  She is 27 years old, married and her husband, Antonio, is 38 years old.  He has been a carpenter his whole life and has a small carpentry workshop where he makes tables, chairs, beds, etc.  Verónica is the mother of 3 children; Viviana who is 10 and an elementary school student (she is in her 5th year of school), Leonardo who is 5 years old and in kindergarten and Jaqueline who is just 18 months old.

Verónica has a small grocery store which she set up two years ago.  In this store she sells basic household products such as beans, oil, rice, soup pasta, soap for washing clothes, toilet paper and cookies, as well as soft drinks, juice and sweets.  In honor of herself she decided to give the store the name “Vero”.  Currently she does not have her own home and the place where she is living is rented.  This is where she has her store.

Vero, which is how all her neighbors know her, requested this loan from Fundación Realidad to invest in her business.  She bought products such as beans, oil, soup pasta, rice, canned chilis, toilet paper and laundry detergent.  She also acquired a chiller cabinet for her soft drinks.  She tells us that her main reason for continuing with her business is her children.  She started this business for them.  Sometimes it is difficult to continue but this is not a reason to stop selling.  On the contrary, this encourages her to push her project further and further forward since it is the only real source of income for her family and stopping her work would be very bad in this period of need and lack of work.  Vero's great wish is to some day have a house of her own which would provide her children with assets which would support them.  She would also like to have her own business premises where she could continue with her work, increase the number of products she sells as much as possible in order to grow her sales, and offer her customers a more complete service.  She also aspires to set up a carpentry workshop together with her husband so that they can give work to people who need it so that those around them can improve their quality of life too.  She wants her children to finish their schooling and get good jobs, have a comfortable life and for them never to experience a lack of daily food.

The majority of this group's members are enterprising women who fight day by day to get ahead and have a better life.  They face the challenges of an unequal society in which poverty devours the dreams of many.  They are very committed to their trades.  They are all responsible people who fulfil their obligations.  They always show that between them there exists the necessary trust and a spirit of mutual help.  They are supportive of each other in everything and they have very good habits.

In the name of all the women who make up this group, Fundación Realidad would like to thank you.  They would also like to thank everybody who collaborates in projects which improve lives and help nurture the dreams of those who have the least.

The names of the members of the “Las Mariposas de la Posta” group and their business activities are as follows:

Divina G. Romualda – snacks
Ana María Hernández G..- snacks
Ernestina L. Sánchez.- soft drinks sales
Verónica L. Hernández.- groceries
Lidia M. Jiménez.- soft drinks sales
Marisela López Hernández.- raw materials
Juana O. Hernández.- groceries
Humberta R. Vázquez.- soft drinks sales
Merced Lucina Gutiérrez Baños.- perfume sales (by catalog)
María Elena L. López.- snacks
Malloli T. N..- snacks
Soledad T. N..- chicken sales

loans.use: To buy basic products such as beans, oil, rice, soup pasta, canned chilis, toilet paper, laundry detergent and canned products such as sardines, tuna and beans

loans.name: Kati

texts.es: Kati tiene 18 años, esta embarazada vive con su pareja en una casa arrendada. Desde hace 1 año que se dedica de manera independiente a la agricultura y ganadería, de esta manera se genera ingresos económicos. Ahora que esta embrazada, su esposo es el que se encarga de dichas actividades, vendiendo animales, así como también en la siembra de maíz y papa. Por lo pronto espera la temporada de cosecha para poder obtener ganancias ya que pronto lo necesitará para el momento del alumbramiento. Su mayor anhelo es incrementar su capital de trabajo con la adquisición de más animales. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece además a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más animales.
texts.en:
Kati is 18 years old, and she is pregnant.  She lives with her life partner in a rented house.  She has been working independently in agriculture and livestock for one year.  That is how she generates income.  Now that she is pregnant, her husband is the one who takes charge of those activities.  He sells animals and also grows corn and potatoes.  

Meanwhile, she is expecting the harvest season to be able to get income.  She will need it soon when she gives birth.

Her greatest wish is to increase her working capital with the acquisition of more animals.  This is her first loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  Also, she is pleased to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.  She is also grateful to the people who will be the lenders of the loan she is requesting.  It will be very useful to the progress of her business.  She will use the requested loan to buy more animals.

loans.use: To get more animals

loans.name: Simón Bolivar (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como El Limón de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Banco Comunal Simón Bolívar. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como el comercio de comida, venta de productos de belleza y prendas de vestir. Además  de prestar servicios como cabinas telefónicas y salones de belleza. Unieron sus esfuerzos para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la Fundación Espoir, este es su primer crédito y esperan seguir por mucho tiempo en el Banco Comunal.

Aquí conversamos con la señora Carmen Chávez, ella tiene 33 años, está casada y tiene 5 hijos todos menores de edad y que estudian en escuela y colegio. Su esposo trabaja en un  taller de mecánica automotriz. Aprendió belleza hace varios años en un instituto, aprendió lo que es el arreglo personal y peluquería, trabajó en un gabinete de belleza en el centro.

Después de trabajar tantos años en este lugar decidió instalar  un salón de belleza y ya tiene cerca de 8 años en los cuales ha pasado momentos difíciles pero que ha sabido llevar. Trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8am hasta las 21h00. Una de sus hijas le ayuda sobretodo en el arreglo y limpieza del local, también vende productos dedicados al arreglo  y cuidado personal.

Este crédito que realizó lo va invertir en comprar tintes de cabello, y otros materiales útiles en el arreglo personal. Además de unas herramientas para su esposo, Es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le ha gustado por la facilidad para conseguir el crédito. Sus metas son tener un gran SPA y  casa propia ya que donde vive y tiene el negocio es alquilado.
texts.en:
In an area of the city of Portoviejo known as El Limón, the partners of the Simón Bolívar Communal Bank meet every 15 days.  They engage in diverse activities such as the food business, the sale of beauty products and apparel. In addition, they provide services such as telephone booths and beauty salons. They joined forces in order to access the benefits that the Fundación Espoir provides.  This is their first loan and they hope to continue with the Communal Bank for a long time.  

Here we speak with Mrs. Carmen C.: she is 33 years old, married and has 5 children under the age of 18 that are attending school.  Her husband works in an auto mechanic's workshop.  She attended beauty school some years ago, and learned about personal grooming and hairstyling.  She worked in a beauty parlor downtown.  

After working there for many years, she decided to open up a beauty salon and now has been operating for close to 8 years, during which she has experienced some difficult times but has been able to carry on.  She works Monday through Saturday from 8am to 9pm.  One of her daughters helps her mostly with cleaning and straightening up the salon, and she also sells personal care and grooming products.  

This loan will be used to buy hair dyes and other needed personal grooming materials.  In addition, she will purchase some tools for her husband.  This is her first cycle at the Communal Bank and she really likes it because it is easy to get credit.  Her goals are to have a large SPA and her own house where she can live and have her business, which is rented.

loans.use: Buy hair dyes, beauty products and tools

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemí tiene 32  años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa D. sus familiares. DesD. hace 3 años tiene su botica, su profesión es química farmacéutica y decidió tener su propia fuente D. ingresos ejerciendo D. manera independiente. D. esta manera esta atenta y servicial al requerimiento D. sus clientes, sobre cierto producto medicinal que necesite, además siempre procura abastecerse D. variedad y calidad D. productos, siempre pensando en la economía D. sus asiduos clientes. Su mayor deseo es tener una sucursal más y con el tiempo seguir creciendo en su negocio. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. medicamentos permitidos en su establecimiento D. ventas.
texts.en:
Noemí, age 32, lives with her husband and their two children in their relatives’ house.  She has had a drug store for three years.  She is a pharmacist, and she decided to have her own source of income by practicing her profession independently.  That way she is attentive to her customers’ needs, and she can help them with the medicinal products that they need.  Also, she is always stocking up on a variety of quality products.  She is always thinking of her regular customers’ savings.

Her greatest wish is to have one more branch, and, in time, to keep growing in her business.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  Also, she is pleased to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.  At the same time, she is grateful to all of the people who will be the lenders of the loan she is requesting.  It will be very helpful to the progress of her business.  She will use the requested loan to buy medicine that is allowed to be sold in her establishment.

loans.use: To buy medicine to stock her establishment

loans.name: Luna Group

texts.es:
El siguiente  grupo se llama  “Luna”, se eligió este nombre porque fue en la noche cuando se organizaron para formar el grupo y algo en común fue que en esa noche era de luna llena, además  un significado simbólico para ellas es que hay veces que en situaciones difíciles de la vida todo parece ser obscuridad pero dentro de todo hay una luz en medio de la nada y esa es la luz de luna, y en tiempos actuales todo parece ser penumbra pero esa luz de esperanza la brindan la generosidad de personas buenas que alumbran los senderos de los demás, otra de las cualidades de identidad es que en el grupo la mayoría son mujeres y su feminidad la atribuye a la luna, su representante se llama Adriana Kukene A. Baños . 
Por  esta ocasión hagamos un énfasis para hablar de una miembro de este grupo ella es la señora Blanca Imelda G. Martínez, tiene 40 años de edad, hasta hace poco mas de 8 años decidió unir su vida con don pedro de 44 años de edad y con quien actualmente tiene un niño de 4 años y que esta iniciando su educación preescolar (kinder),su hijo es un motivo muy importante de luchar y de salir adelante con sus proyectos ya que es hijo único  y su principal fuente de felicidad dentro de su matrimonio,. Blanca termino de estudiar la preparatoria, pero gran parte de su vida la dedico en ayudar a sus padres y su familia, hasta que conoció a pedro a los 32 años.
Blanca y su esposo tienen un puesto ambulante de ropa, en el cual venden playeras, pantalones, ropa para bebe, ropa interior de dama y caballero, faldas, blusas, calcetines, short, y camisas, hace  8 años decidió iniciar este negocio, ella y esposo se encargan del puesto de ropa y trabajan con mucho entusiasmo, ya que aman su trabajo y es su principal fuente de ingreso. Para llegar a su lugar de trabajo, Blanca tiene que levantarse muy temprano ya que su punto de trabajo esta fuera de su domicilio y todo los días tiene que llevar a su hijo a la escuela, mientras que su esposo se encarga del negocio, ella actualmente no tiene casa propia, y tampoco un lugar fijo donde pueda comercializar sus productos, y es por eso que se trasladan de u lugar a otro. 
 Blanca se integro a su grupo por la necesidad de un crédito, mismo que utilizo para la adquisición de mas mercancía para su negocio, con este crédito ella hará la compra de; pantalones de mezclilla, de vestir, variedad de camisas, diferentes modelos de playeras, así como diferentes tallas y modelos de blusas para dama, también para la compra de calcetines, ropa interior. Nos hace menciona  que en ocasiones le es difícil y cansado el trasladarse a otros lugares fuera de su domicilio para vender sus productos, ya que esto implica llevar o tener que dejar en ocasiones a su niño, pero la necesidad la obliga, pero como ya lo mencionamos el amor hacia su hijo la anima y la esperanza de verlo bien le dan aliento para seguir adelante, algunas veces se ve obligada a regalar ropa a gente muy pobre y que no puede acceder a la compra de lo mas necesario, ella vende al precio justo y no lucra con la necesidad de la gente y principalmente con los niños. 
El mas grande sueño de Blanca  es  tener algún día su casa propia en la cual pueda su hijos  tener un patrimonio que lo respalde y de igual forma tener su local propio donde ella pueda continuar con su trabajo para ya no mas tener que ambular de un lugar a otro, quiere incrementar el mayor numero posible de productos, para hacer crecer sus ventas y ofrecerle un servicio mas completo a sus clientes, también aspira a que su esposo junto con ella puedan ofrecerle trabajo a las personas que lo necesitan, tener otra sucursal y que su hijo algún día pueda terminar una carrera profesional, para que no tenga que pasar lo que actualmente  están viviendo.
La mayoría de de las personas que integran este grupo son mujeres emprendedoras que día con día luchan para salir adelante y tener una mejor vida, se enfrentan a los estragos de una realidad difícil, en donde actualmente muchas veces los sueños no se llegan a realizar, sobre todo cuando nadie extiende la mano para ayudar al prójimo, son gente muy responsable y que cumplen sus compromisos, lo demuestran siempre, entre ellas existe la confianza necesaria y ese espíritu de ayuda mutua, son solidarias en todo y tienen el optimismo necesario para salir adelante.
A nombre  de todos los que conforman este grupo les agradece a todos los que conforman el equipo fundación realidad y a los que con su ayuda económica hacen posible la esperanza para los que menos tienen. 
Los nombres de los que integran el grupo “Luna” y sus actividades productivas son: 
Elvira Ofelia R. Pérez. – elaboración de prendas de vestir
Leobardo C. López.- taller de instalaciones eléctricas
Alejandrina C. Sánchez.- Venta de prendas de joyería
Adriana Kukene A. Baños.- taxista
María Elizabeth M. C..-Venta de zapatos 
Leonila D. Ramírez.- venta de perfume
Rosa Erica Barragán Baños.- Abarrotes
Fadia Oliva Baños D..- Venta de perfume
Blanca Imelda G. Martínez.- Venta de ropa
Gricela E. B..- Venta de ropa
Sinforosa Emerenciana Marroquín.- abarrotes
Ana S. B..- Venta de carne
texts.en:
This group is called “Luna” (Moon).  The members chose this name because it was night time when they came together to form their group.  What is more, that particular night was a full moon.  A further symbolic meaning for them is that there are times when in difficult situations in life, everything seems dark but inside everything there is a light and this is the light of the moon.  At present everything seems to be dark but the light of hope is given to them by the generosity of good people who light the paths of other.  Another of the qualities of identification with the moon is that the majority of the group's members are women and their femininity is attributed to the moon.  Their representative is called Adriana Kukene A. Baños.

On this occasion we focus on talking to a member of the group called Mrs Blanca Imelda G. M..  She is 40 years old.  A little more than 8 years ago she decided to unite her life with that of Don Pedro who is 44 years old and with whom she has a 4 year old child who is starting his preschool education (kindergarten).  Her son is a very important reason to fight and get ahead with her projects since he is an only child and her main source of happiness within her marriage.  Blanca completed her senior high school studies but a large part of her life has been dedicated to helping her parents and her family, until she met Pedro at the age of 32.

Blanca and her husband have a mobile clothes stall where they sell t-shirts, pants, baby clothes, women's and men's underwear, skirts, blouses, socks, shorts and shirts.  They started their business 8 years ago.  Blanca and her husband are are in charge of the clothes stall and work with a lot of enthusiasm since they love their work and it is their main source of income.  To arrive at their place of work, Blanca has to get up very early since her place of work is outside the home.  Every day she has to take her son to school, while her husband is in charge of the business.  She currently doesn't have her own home, nor a fixed place where she can sell her products.  This is why they move from one place to another.

Blanca joined her group as she needed a loan which she used to acquire more goods for her business.  She will use this loan to buy jeans, dress pants, a range of shirts, different types of t-shirt, as well as different sizes and styles of ladies' blouses.  She will also buy socks and underwear.  She mentions to us that occasionally it is difficult work and tiring to travel to other places to sell her products since this means taking her child with her or having to leave him with somebody but she has to do it.  However, as we already mentioned, her love for her son encourages her and her hopes to see him do well give her the strength to carry on.  Sometimes she feels obliged to give away clothes to very poor people who can't manage to buy the most basic items.  She sells at a fair price and doesn't profit from the needs of other, mainly children.

Blanca's biggest dream is have her own house some day which she can give to her children to support them and also to have her own premises where she can continue with her work so that she no longer has to travel from place to place.  She would like to increase the number of products she sells as much as possible so that she increases her sales and offers a more complete service to her customers.  She also aspires to herself and her husband being able to offer work to other people who need it, to have another outlet and for her son to some day be able to complete his professional studies, so that he doesn't have to go through what his parents are currently going through.

Most of the people in this group are enterprising women who fight day by day to get ahead and have a better life.  They are faced with the havoc of a difficult life in which many times their dreams never get realized, above all when nobody extends their hand to help their neighbor.  They are responsible people who fulfil their obligations.  They always show that they have the necessary trust in each other and a spirit of mutual help.  They are supportive of each other in everything and have the necessary optimism to keep moving forwards.  In the name of everybody in this group, those of us in the Fundación Realidad team would like to thank those who with their financial help make possible the hope of those who have the least.

The names of those who make up the “Luna” group and their business activities are as follows:

Elvira Ofelia R. Pérez. – making clothing
Leobardo C. López.- electrical workshop
Alejandrina C. Sánchez.- jewelry sales
Adriana Kukene A. Baños.- taxi driver
María Elizabeth M. C..- shoe sales
Leonila D. Ramírez.- perfume sales
Rosa Erica Barragán Baños.- groceries
Fadia Oliva Baños D..- perfume sales
Blanca Imelda G. Martínez.- clothing sales
Gricela E. B..- clothing sales
Sinforosa Emerenciana Marroquín.- groceries
Ana S. B..- meat sales

loans.use: To buy clothes such as men's and women's jeans in different sizes and colors, men's shirts in different styles and sizes, women's blouses, socks, boxer shorts, bras, stockings, t-shirts, sports pants and baby clothes for different ages

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 43 años, es viuda y vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa. Casi toda su vida ha estado trabajando en las tareas agrícolas, desde hace 4 años vende animales en la ferias ganadera de su zona pero previo a esto siempre se abastecen de los animales comprando a granjeros que viven dentro de la zona. Sus hijos la apoyan en esta tarea que es vital, ya que es una fuente de ingreso importante, que le ayuda a cubrir las necesidades familiares. Lo que le agrada de su trabajo es que la venta de animales es más rentable que la venta de la cosecha, por haber un mayor movimiento de dinero, por ello desea incrementar su capital de trabajo. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de animales.
texts.en: Norma is 43 years old, she is a widower and lives with her 2 children in their home. She has spent almost all her life working in farming. For the last 4 years she has sold animals at the livestock markets in her area but prior to this she always stocked animals bought from farmers who lived in her area. Her children help her in this work which is vital, as it is an important source of income, which helps her cover the family's needs. What she likes about her work is that the sale of animals is more profitable than the sale of crops, as there is a greater movement of money, and this is why she wants to increase her working captial. It is her first loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has financial support. In addition she is grateful to be part of her communal bank because all its members are very supportive and responsible people. Likewise she gives thanks to everyone who will be providing the loan she is requesting as it will be very useful to her in progressing her business. With this loan, she will buy animals.

loans.use: Buy more animals to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel tiene 56 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a su hijo en el distrito de Pueblo Nuevo, una zona aledaña a la ciudad de Ferreñafe y que se caracteriza por tener a la mayor parte de su población concentrada en zonas urbano marginales, la zona se encuentra situada a veinticinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a brindar servicio de imprenta en un pequeño taller ubicado en su vivienda. Allí el ofrece al publico en general servicio de elaboración de afiches, paneles publicitarios, tarjetas de presentación, invitaciones para actividades sociales entre otras. Con el dinero que obtiene de estas actividades el sustenta los gastos de la economía de su familia, el negocio goza de muy buena acogida debido al tiempo que tiene trabajando y a la buena calidad con la que suele realizar sus labores.

Angel desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo mas material con el cual planea diseñar mas afiches y así cumplir con los pedidos que le realizan sus clientes. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1600 nuevos soles con los cuales planea lograr su objetivo.

Angel es una persona bastante creativa y responsable, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para mejorar gradualmente la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Angel is 56, married and lives with his wife and their son in the Pueblo Nuevo district, an area bordering the city of Ferreñafe.  It has most of its population concentrated in marginal urban areas and is located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past two years he has worked in a small printing shop in his home.  There he offers a service of making posters, brochures, business cards, invitations to social events, etc.  With the money that he makes from this work he supports his family.  The business has a good reputation because of the time he has worked and the good quality that is usually produced.

Angel wishes to enlarge his business, buying more materials so that he can design more posters and fill all the orders from his customers.  That is why he decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1600 new sols to be able to complete his goal.

Angel is a very creative and responsible person.  His principle aim to continue growing as a businessman and to gradually improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: To buy supplies to enlarge his business of designing posters and printing

loans.name: Jose Silvestre

texts.en:
Jose lives in the Anexo de Tinajones near the village of Huaca de Barro, which is located in the district of Mochumi in the region of Lambayeque. He is marred and has four children. The community is quite small and the entire population is involved in agriculture.

For the past fifteen years, Jose has worked in the agricultural industry in his community. He owns a hectare of land on which he usually plants cotton, corn and rice. He is well known and respected in the area for his hard work and knowledge of crop management.

In this season, Jose plans to plant a crop of cotton and has, therefore, requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa. He plans to invest the funds in seed, fertilizer, pesticides and other inputs.
