loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 40 years old, married to Musa Cheruiyot, a farmer, who also contributes to the family's monthly income. Her husband also supports her in business and in the family's financial needs. They are blessed with nine children aged between 22 years and 11 years. 

Christine runs a grocery shop in Sacho Mosop trading centre near Kabarnet town and she had been in this business for two years now. Her business gives her a monthly profit of Kshs 3,000. 

Christine does not have a previous history in Microfinance borrowing. She joined KADET and she has currently borrowed her second loan of Kshs 10,000 after being able to repay her first loan successfully. She will use the money to buy more items for the grocery shop like bananas, tomatoes, kale, cabbages and others to restock her grocery.

Christine anticipates using her profits to open a retail shop where she will sell other perishable and/or fast-moving goods like soap, toothpaste, tissue and many more. She hopes to give her children the best education.

loans.use: To purchase stock for the grocery shop

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en: Nasira S. is currently in the business of selling onions, beer, groundnut paste etc.  and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Nasira is 21 years old and is married to a husband who is a soldier. She has two children and one only of her children goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Estella

texts.en: Estella S.  is currently in the business of selling onions, tomatoes and cooking oil  and is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice and beans to sell.  Estella is 20 years old and is married to a husband who is a policeman. She has one child and her child goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: Stock bags of rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida I. is from the village of Brgy. Maddiangat,Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 54 years old. Loida is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Loida owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. Loida has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Loida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Loida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Loida is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Loida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Hak

texts.en: Mrs. Hak P. earns a living by breeding and selling pigs in a pen behind her house. She has been married for many years to Mr. Savorn, 43, who works at a company in Phnom Penh City that makes alcohol. They have two children, both of whom are enrolled in school. Over the years, she has raised a lot of piglets, and usually aims to sell them to buyers four months after she begins raising them. In order to earn extra income, Mrs. Hak P. has applied for a loan to buy more pigs to feed and raise, as well as expand the pen in which she keeps them.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise and expand the cage in which she keeps them.

loans.name: Ángela Del Carmen

texts.es: Ángela Del Carmen P. D. H. 47 años D. edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual cuenta con diferentes negocios con el enorme deseo D. salir adelante, vive únicamente junto a su esposo junto al cual resiD. en San Juan Opico, en el departamento D. La Libertad. DesD. hace 8 años que Ángela posee una venta D. tortillas, en la cual se encarga D. elaborarlas y venderlas, así mismo posee una tienda D. productos perecederos y una venta D. cosméticos. Estos negocios han  nacido con el deseo D. poder mejorar la economía familiar, ya que en muchas ocasiones no se contaba con el dinero necesario para solventar todos los gastos del hogar. Es por esta razón que Ángela desea poder seguir creciendo  con el negocio que le ha brindado estabilidad económica a su familia. Ángela solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor, D. manera que pueda obtenerlo a precios más accesible, así mismo comprar cilindros D. gas propano con el fin D. contar con una reserva D. este último, ya que en muchas ocasiones escasea y D. esta manera no se verá afectada como en otros años, así mismo desea surtir la tienda y la venta D. cosméticos. Esto será D. mucho ayuda para ella, ya que podrá mejorar las condiciones D. su negocio y así contar con más clientela.
texts.en:
Ángela Del Carmen P. D. H. is 47 years old and a hardworking woman who pursues different businesses with an enormous desire to succeed. She and her husband live by themselves in San Juan Opico in the Department of La Libertad. For the past eight years, Ángela has been managing a tortilla stand where she is in charge of making and selling tortillas. At the same, she also operates a store where she sells perishable goods and a cosmetics business. She started these businesses because she wanted to improve her family’s finances. There were many occasions when she did not have the necessary funds to pay for the household expenses. For this reason, Ángela decided to continue growing her business in order to proviD. financial stability for her family.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy corn in bulk in order to get a more affordable price. In addition, she will buy cylinders of propane gas so that she will have a reserve for later. Ángela also wants to restock her store and her cosmetics business. This will be a great help to her because she will be able to improve her business conditions and attract more customers.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies for her various businesses

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Catarino

texts.es: Catarino M. R. de 60 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. Catarino posee un pick up, en el cual se dedica  a hacer viajes a diferentes partes del departamento de La Libertad, mismo lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa. Él transporta frutas, muebles, personas y todo lo que se le solicita, la zona en la cual él se colocada a diario es muy buena ya que es cerca de un mercado, en el hay una gran fuente de trabajo para él. Catarino solicita un préstamo con el enorme deseo de poder brindarle mantenimiento al pick up y de esta forma brindar un servicio más seguro y de esta forma contar con más trabajo para sostener su hogar.
texts.en: Catarino M. R. is 60 years old.  He lives in La Libertad department with his wife who takes care of the housework.  Catarino has a pick up truck in which he makes journeys to different parts of La Libertad department.  He transports fruit, furniture, people and anything else which he is asked to.  The area in which he is based every day is very good since it is close to a market where there is a great source of work for him.  Catarino is requesting a loan as he really wishes to have  maintenance work done on his pick up.  He hopes that he will thereby be able to provide a safer service and have more work to support his household.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and pay for maintenance to his pick up truck

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 26 years old and married. She and her husband, Christopher Chemosong, have four children who range in age from eight to two years old. She makes a living running a posho (or corn meal) mill in Kabarnet town. Beatrice has been in this business for two years and earns a monthly income of Kshs 3,000. 

She has applied for her first loan from KADET, for Kshs 20,000, which she will use to buy maize to mill and resell to people in her area. She plans to use the additional profits made possible by this loan to buy more maize. 

Beatrice hopes to open a retail shop in the near future, and earn enough money so that her children can have as much education as possible.

loans.use: To buy maize to mill and resell

loans.name: Lilias

texts.en: Lilias A.  makes a living selling fish, onions and groundnut phase, and is applying for this loan to buy more fish and onions to sell to her customers. She is 25 years old and married to a nurse. She has three children, two of whom are currently enrolled in school. With the additional income made possible by this loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy fish and onions to sell to her customers

loans.name: Virginia Marta

texts.es: Virginia Marta C. D. R. D. 51 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos uno D. los cuales estudia en la universidad y el menor que estudia, educación básica. Ella resiD. junto a su familia en San Juan Opico desD. hace 30 años, lugar en el cual es muy conocida por la labor que realiza. Ella se dedica a la elaboración D. prendas D. vestir, las cuales elabora en su casa, y que posteriormente venD. D. forma ambulante junto a su esposo, Virginia venD. su productos en diferentes colonias, cantones y pueblos D. San Juan Opico, así mismo los fines D. semana se coloca cerca D. diferentes mercados, con la esperanza D. poder aumentar sus ventas. Ella es una persona muy humilD. y trabajadora, la cual desea salir adelante y D. esta forma contar con el dinero necesario para poseer una vida estable junto a su familia. Virginia solicita un préstamo por medio del cual le sea posible comprar mayor cantidad D. tela, así mismo comprar agujas para la maquina D. cocer y diferentes colores D. hilo, todo lo que le permita poder ofrecer mayor cantidad D. ropa y así aumentar sus ventas. Tanto Virginia como su esposo son personas que se esfuerzan a diario, dando el mayor esfuerzo que les sea posible para mantener su negocio a flote.
texts.en: Virginia Marta C. D. R. is 51 years old.  She lives together with her husband and two children, one of whom is studying at university and the other who is studying his basic education.  She has lived with her family in San Juan Opico for 30 years.  She is well known in her town for the work which she does.  She makes clothes in her home and then sells them in the streets together with her husband.  Virginia sells her products in different districts, cantons and towns of San Juan Opico.  She also sets herself up near different markets on a weekend in the hope of increasing her sales.  She is a very humble and hard-working person who wants to get ahead and have the necessary money to lead a stable life together with her family.  Virginia is requesting this loan so that she can buy a larger quantity of material.  She also wants to buy needles for her sewing machine and different colored thread.  This will allow her to be able to offer a larger quantity of clothes and to increase her sales.  Both Virginia and her husband are people who work hard every day, they make their best efforts in order to keep their business afloat.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make clothes

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Celiamar Homiel

texts.es: Celiamar Homiel R. D. C. D. 32 años D. edad, es una madre D. familia ejemplar la cual se dedica a múltiples actividades para obtener ganancias que beneficien a su familia. Ella vive junto a su esposo y un hijo D. 9 años D. edad, junto a los cuales resiD. en Ilopango. Celiamar, se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. chocolate artesanal, el cual se utiliza para la elaboración D. bebidas, así mismo comercializa huevos, zapatos, productos lácteos lo cuales comercializa D. forma ambulante junto a su esposo. Así mismo hace panes con pollo y almuerzos los fines D. semana en su hogar. Ella se destaca por ser muy trabajadora, y por ser alguien quien cuenta con el enorme deseo D. ser mejor cada día. Celiamar solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir su negocio, y así mismo invertir en la compra D. agendas 2011. Todo esto lo hace con el propósito D. obtener más ganancias y D. esta forma contar con una vida mejor para ella y su familia.
texts.en: 32-year-old Celiamar Homiel R. D. C. is an exemplary mother of her family. She undertakes various activities to make profits that benefit her family. She lives with her husband and 9-year-old child in Ilopango. Celiamar makes and sells artisanal chocolate, which is used to make drinks. She also works as a traveling merchant, selling eggs, shoes and dairy products with her husband. In addition, she makes traditional chicken sandwiches and lunches on the weekend in her home. She stands out as being very hard-working and someone with an enormous desire to be better every day. Celimar is requesting a loan with which she will be able to stock-up her business and also to invest in 2011 planners. She does all this with the aim of earning bigger profits and in this way have a better life for herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making chocolate.

loans.name: Nerea

texts.en: Nerea is a widowed mother of three. She is proud of the fact that she has been able to educate her children despite being the family's sole breadwinner, and is grateful for the support she has received from Faulu Kenya.  Her dream is to see her children through to the university level. To make this possible, she has worked very hard as a seamstress for the last 13 years. She is applying for a loan for 10,000 Kes to buy fabric, zippers, canvas and thread.

loans.use: To buy fabric, zippers, canvas and thread for a tailoring business

loans.name: Chu's Group

texts.en:
H. Chu Thị, age 50, is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Đức Lân nhóm (Nhóm 04).

H. lives in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. She and her husband have three grown children. She raises chickens for a living. H. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2016.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase chicks to raise and sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.496.000 VND, which will be used to purchase chicken feed and other supplies. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.
  
About the Other Borrowers in the Group:
  
1.  Trần Thị B., age 35, is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector, making and selling food.
 
2.  Đặng Thị D., age 44, is requesting a 2.016.000 VND loan to support her tailoring business.

3.  Tô Thị T., age 46, is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her livestock-raising business.
 
About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

----
  
H. Chu Thị (20213050025) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đức Lân nhóm  (Nhóm 04).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2,016 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.496.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Trần Thị B. (0) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


2.  Đặng Thị D. (0) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.016.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


3.  Tô Thị T. (0) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có T. nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed and other supplies

loans.name: Yanci Marilú

texts.es: Yanci Marilú G. C. de 27 años de edad, es una joven trabajadora, quien vive junto a su madre y su hermana menor, junto a las cuales trabaja en el negocio familiar. Ella posee una granja en la cual se dedica a criar gallinas las cuales posteriormente comercializa y así mismo vende sus huevos, este negocio es la única fuente de ingresos con la cual cuenta esta familia por lo que es muy importante sacarlo adelante. Yanci solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar más gallinas, así mismo comprar concentrado, vitaminas y antibióticos para el cuidado de ellos. Yanci cuenta con muchos clientes, ya que es una persona muy responsable quien desempeña su trabajo de la mejor manera, brindando un excelente producto. Yanci depende en gran manera de este negocio, ya que es así como junto a su madre logran solventar todos sus gastos en el hogar.
texts.en: 27-year-old Yanci Marilú G. C. is a young worker who lives with her mother and younger sister. She works along with them in the family business. She has a farm where she raises hens, which she later sells. She also sells the eggs. This business is the only source of income for the family, which is why it is very important for them to carry it forward. Yanci is requesting a loan that will give her the money necessary to buy more hens and to buy feed, vitamins and antibiotics to raise them. Yanci has a lot of customers since she is a responsible person who carries out her work in the best way possible, yielding an excellent product. Yanci is very dependent on this business, since it is how she and her mother meet the household expenses.

loans.use: To buy hens to sell.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en: Loice P. makes a living selling groundnut paste, bread and other food supplies in her shop, and is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. She is 20 years old and her husband works in a bank. They have two children, neither of whom is old enough to enroll in school. With the additional income made possible by this loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Усмонова Раъно проживает в районе Файзабад. Возраст, 48 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Более 6 лет занимается торговлей. Она в основном продает женскую одежду и национальные платья. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Rano U. lives in the Fayzabad region. She is 48 years old. She is married and has five children. She has secondary education. She has been selling for more than six yeas. She mainly sells women's clothing and national dresses. She is asking for a loan to increase inventory circulation and sales.

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: María Sara

texts.es: María Sara M. D. G. D. 61 años D. edad, resiD. en San Pablo Tacachico, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa una nieta D. 7 años D. edad. María posee una tienda D.  productos alimenticios y D. primera necesidad para el hogar, tales como: pan, huevos, leche, granos básicos y otros más, en el cual trabaja junto a su esposo. El negocio cuenta con muy buena ubicación, debido a que se encuentra en calle principal, esto le beneficia en gran manera, ya que le permite contar con muchos clientes fijos, ya que es un lugar el cual siempre esta lleno D. muchas personas. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda incrementar sus productos, D. manera que pueda ofrecer más a sus clientes. Este negocio es D. mucha importantita para ella ya que es la única fuente D. ingresos con la que cuenta para sostener a su familia.
texts.en: 61-year-old María Sara M. D. G. lives in San Pablo Tacachico, located in the department of La Libertad, along with her spouse and a 7-year-old granddaughter. María has a store where she and her husband sell food and basic home necessities like bread, eggs, milk, staple grains etc. The business is well-located, since it is on the main street. This is very beneficial, since it allows them to have a lot of regular customers, since it is in a place that is always full of lots of people. María is requesting a loan through which she will be able to increase her products, so she will be able to offer her customers more. This business is very important for her, since it is her only source of income with which to support her family.

loans.use: To buy food for her grocery store.

location.town: San Pablo Tacachico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy perishable products

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is grateful for access to business loans, incentive loans (house repair, educational and market day loans), and other services such as savings and insurance. With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, Lilia is hopeful that her sewing business will provide steady income and improvements in her family’s quality of life.

Because Lilia’s sewing business requires more capital to sustain its operation, she is requesting a loan through ASHI for that purpose and to meet the demands of her customers. Lilia’s dream is for her only child, Lannie, to have a good life. Additionally, she hopes to continue the sewing business as a sustainable livelihood to support her family.

Through the support of ASHI and KIVA, Lilia hopes to someday improve their standard of living and escape the umbrella of poverty. Her long term goals are to have a full-fledged sewing business and to buy a tricycle, a three-wheeled-vehicle used as public transportation. She and her husband want to offer a good transport business in their village. The couple believes that having their own tricycle would be a good additional income source. By then, Lilia believes that their lives will be changed and she will have her dreams achieved.

loans.use: To support her sewing business

loans.name: Victoria De Jesús

texts.es: Victoria D. Jesús M. D. P. D. 26 años D. edad, vive junto a sus padres, su esposo y dos hijos D. 5 y 2 años D. edad, junto a los cuales resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador. Con el enorme deseo D. brindarle ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, es por esto que ella posee su negocio propio, en el cual comercializa ropa para niños y adultos, su puesto se encuentra dentro del mercado Monserrat, en donD. tiene tres años D. dedicarse a este trabajo. Victoria solicita un préstamo con la iniciativa D. mejorar sus ventas, comprando ropa para niños y mujeres, ya que es esta la cual posee mayor demanda en el lugar, la cual ella desea aprovechar, con esto Victoria espera no solo mejorar su economía familiar, sino también poder realizarse aún más como comerciante.
texts.en: Victoria D. Jesús M. D. P. is 26 years old.  She lives with her parents, her husband and her two children aged 5 and 2 in San Salvador department.  She has a real wish to help her husband with their household expenses.  This is why she owns her own business in which she sells clothes for children and adults.  Her stall is in the Montserrat market.  She has been doing this job for three years.  Victoria is requesting this loan in order to improve her sales, buying clothes for women and children, as this is what is in highest demand and she wants to take advantage.  Victoria thereby hopes not only to improve her family's finances but also to fulfil herself as a businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Chu

texts.en: C. Chu Thị is a 59 year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. She is married and has five grown-up children. To make a living, C. owns and operates a business selling herbs and spices in her community. C. has been in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 dong (VND) a month. In 2008, C. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. C. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,026,000 VND from SEDA which was used to invest in renovating the business. C. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her fourth loan from SEDA. C. plans to use additional income to improve the general living conditions of her family. No. 20213050028. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ====================================== C. Chu Thị (20213050028) là 59 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 5 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành. Để kiếm sống, C. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các loại thảo mộc & gia vị trong cộng đồng địa phương. C. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, C. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2008, C. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. C. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư đổi mới công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. C. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Tatiana Margarita

texts.es: Tatiana Margarita A. M. de 18 años de edad, reside junto a su madre, en el departamento de Ahuachapán, ella es una joven muy emprendedora la cual trabaja para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar a su madre y así mismo para pagarse sus estudios. Tatiana posee una pequeña venta en su casa de habitación, en el cual comercializa productos varios como: cremas para el cabello y el cuerpo, perfumes, cosméticos y muchos otros productos más los cuales poseen gran demanda en el lugar tanto para uso personal como para regalar en diferentes ocasiones. Desde hace 1 año que ella posee este negocio lo que le ha permitido ser muy conocida en la zona, por lo que posee muchas clientes las cuales disfrutan de ir a comprar a su negocio. Tatiana solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir en su negocio, compran de los productos que ya posee y de esta misma forma comprar otros los cuales sean para uso personal y que cuenten con gran demanda.
texts.en: Tatiana Margarita A. M. is 18 years old.  She lives with her mother in Ahuachapán department.  She is a very enterprising young woman who works to help her mother with household expenses and, at the same time, to pay for her studies.  Tatiana has a small sales business in her home where she sells various products such as hair and body cream, perfumes, cosmetics and many other products which are in high demand in her area both for personal use and to give as gifts.  She has had this business for 1 year which has enabled her to become very well known in her district which means that she has a lot of customers who enjoy going to shop at her business.  Tatiana is requesting a loan to invest in her business.  Her customers are buying up the products which she already has and so she would like to buy more personal use products which are in high demand.

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Seema's Group

texts.en:
Seema lives in an industrial city of Pakistan called Faisalabad. She lives there in a 2-room brick house in the area called Anwer colony. She is 44 years old, married to P. M. and has five sons. She couldn’t educate her children due to financial constraints. All of her sons except the youngest one work to financially contribute to the family. 

Her eldest son is a sweeper. Her second and third sons work in a factory, and the fourth one is a watchman. Her youngest son is 9 years old, and he stays at home.  Her husband runs a small restaurant in the market where he offers different kinds of food and tea to his customers. He has  been doing this business for the past 28 years, and his restaurant is well known among local people for its tastiness and the quality of his food.  Seema herself is a housewife, who stays at home and does her household chores. 
  
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s restaurant business. He will invest the loan in purchasing of different items such as cooking oil, spices, tea, sugar and milk in bulk quantities to maintain the quality of his restaurant and  making a good quantity of food to sell.  She hopes that this investment will be profitable for her husband’s business and her family's standard of living will be better.  

Seema is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application. 
  
Note: In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Seema.

loans.use: To buy required items for restaurant business

loans.name: María Hilaria

texts.es: María Hilaria R. Vda. D. T. D. 50 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador, en donD. vive junto a su hija D. 18 años D. edad, y junto a su padre D. 87 años y su madre D. 85 años D. edad. María se dedica a la elaboración D. tamales, un platillo típico el cual esta hecho a base D. masa D. maíz, la cual se rellena con verduras y se envuelve en hojas D. huerta D. guineos, los cuales posteriormente comercializa D. forma ambulante, así mismo sus hija le ayudan vendiendo algunos tamales en su casa D. habitación, María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima para la elaboración D. mayor cantidad D. tamales, todo con el enorme deseo D. aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en: María Hilaria R. is a 50 year old widow who lives in San Salvador department with her 18 year-old daughter, her 87 year-old father and her 85 year-old mother.  María works making tamales, a traditional dish which is maD. from corn dough, filled with vegetables and wrapped in banana leaves.  She then sells them in the street.  Her daughter also helps selling some tamales from her home.  María is requesting a loan so that she can buy all the ingredients she needs to make more tamales as she has an enormous desire to increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy corn, vegetables and other ingredients for making tamales

loans.name: Tô

texts.en: Vụ Tô Thị is a 43-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Vụ owns and operates a business primarily raising chickens for sale. Vụ has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000,000 dong (VND) a month. In 2008, Vụ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Vụ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,256,000 VND from SEDA which was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Vụ is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her fourth loan from SEDA. Vụ plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. No. 20213050027. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ====================================== Vụ Tô Thị (20213050027) là 43 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học. Để kiếm sống, Vụ Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán. Vụ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Vụ kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2008, Vụ đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Vụ đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Vụ dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Choeum

texts.en:
Choeum R. is a 59-year-old woman farmer who lives in Battambong Province. Choeum R. is married to Mr. Yib, age 59, who works with her in the farming business. Her husband also plants sugarcane on his land; he appears in the picture above.This couple has spent most of their life working in the farm fields. They are able to plant crops at least twice a year, using both rainy and dry seasons. 

Choeum R. has five children, one of whom is single and living with her. The other four are married. Choeum R. will be using the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds to facilitate rice-growing. With the remainder of loan she will buy sugarcane for planting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds to facilitate rice-growing.

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: Juana del Carmen D. L. C. D. F. D. 35 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. L. Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos menores D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Juana posee una venta D. cosméticos, cremas para el cabello y cuerpo, perfumes, lociones, shampoo, colas para el cabello y ganchos. Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa D. habitación, en donD. cuenta con muy buena ubicación debido a que muchas personas prefieren comprarle a elL. sus productos, esta es una zona muy transitada durante todo el día y sobretodo en los fines D. semana en donD. sus ventas se incrementan. ElL. solicita un préstamo con el deseo D. contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad D. mercadería, aumentando L. cantidad D. maquillajes y D. esta forma ofrecer diferentes precios, así mismo comprar cremas para el cuerpo, zapatos y ropa lo cual es lo que posee mayor cantidad D. demanda. Esto llena D. mucha ilusión ya que espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Juana del Carmen D. L. C. D. F. is 35 years old.  She lives in L. Libertad department together with her husband and their three children who are still in school.  Juana has a business selling cosmetics, hair and body cream, perfumes, lotions, shampoo, hair bands and hairpins.  Her business is in her own home.  She lives in a good location and many people prefer to buy their products from her.  It is an area which is very busy throughout the whole day and particularly on weekends when her sales increase.  She is requesting a loan as she needs money to buy more merchandise, increasing the amount of make-up she has which will enable her to offer different prices.  She would also like to buy body creams, shoes and clothes which are in high demand.  She is full of enthusiasm as she hopes to improve her profits.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a hard-working man who runs a cafeteria.  He has employed two people in his cafeteria.  He also sells groundnuts.  He was previously selling fruit before he opened his cafeteria.  He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for helping him to increase his business stock through loans. 

 Julius is able to educate his six children with the income from his business.  He hopes to expand his business and open another outlet in the future.  He has requested 30,000 Kes to buy baking flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy baking flour, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Levica

texts.en:
Levica H. is from the village of Brgy. Maddiangat, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 46 years old. Levica is married and has five children. To make a living, Levica owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling scrap metal & other used goods in the local community. Levica has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Levica joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Levica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional scrap goods to sell. Levica is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Levica from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy perishables

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios M. is from the village of Brgy. Maddiangat, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 38 years old. Remedios is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Remedios owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling fruit and vegetables in the local community. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Remedios joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remedios has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Remedios from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Đinh's Group

texts.en:
Quý Đinh Thị (20213020007) is a 37 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Quý is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is An Tập 01 (Nhóm 01).


Quý is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, Quý owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling herbs & spices in the local community.  Quý has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, Quý joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Quý has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Quý  from SEDA.  Quý plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Đặng Thị T. (0) is a 58 year-old female who is requesting a 6,048,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


2.  Chu Thị T. (0) is a 39 year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Quý Đinh Thị (20213020007) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Quý là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là An Tập nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các loại thảo mộc & gia vị trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Quý thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Quý kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND.  Vào 2008, Quý đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Quý đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 6.048.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Đặng Thị T. (0) là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


2.  Chu Thị T. (0) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase herbs & spices to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes and aprons to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane C. is a 38-year-old lady who is married to William Chebii and together they have two children aged 11 and seven years. She runs a food kiosk where she sells food in small quantities to passersby and neighbors. Her monthly income from this four-year-old business is Kshs 8,000 per month but there is also the additional income from her husband as well.

Jane has applied for her second loan which she will use to expand her business by buying more foodstuffs to add to her food kiosk.  She repaid her previous loan well and on time. She anticipates some profits which she will use to open up a retail shop as a secondary business.

Jane hopes to have a stable business and be able to  assist the needy in her society.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock  his business

loans.name: Saldy

texts.en:
Saldy P. is from the village of Brgy. Maddiangat, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 34 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Saldy owns and operates a transportation business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a motorcycle transport service. Saldy has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Saldy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Saldy is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the Saldy's first loan from ASKI.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Trần
loans.use: To purchase bamboo materials

loans.name: Ana Beatriz

texts.es: Ana Beatriz M. M. de 21 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, junto a su único hijo de 2 años de edad. Ella es una joven que a su edad cuenta con la enorme responsabilidad de sostener su hogar ella sola, por lo que se dedica a la venta de calzado para hombres, mujeres y niños. Su negocio esta muy bien ubicado sobre calle principal, y cuenta con muy buenas ventas debido a sus excelentes precios. Ana solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad y estilos de calzados, y de esta forma aumentar su inventario para este fin de año en el cual las ventas aumentan considerablemente, lo cual es muy importante para Ana aprovechar. El mayor deseo de ella es el de poder salir adelante y brindarle todo lo necesario a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en: Ana Beatriz M. M. is 21 years old.  She lives in Usulután department together with her 2 year-old son.  She is a woman who, at her young age, has the enormous responsibility of supporting her household alone.  For this reason she works selling men's, women's and children's shoes.  Her business is very well located on the main street and she has good sales owing to her excellent prices.  Ana is requesting a loan so that she can buy a larger quantity and range of footwear and, in this way, increase her inventory for the upcoming end-of-year period in which sales increase considerably.  It is very important for Ana to be able to take advantage of this.  Her greatest wish is to be able to get ahead and provide her small son with everything he needs.

loans.use: To buy different styles of shoes to sell

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio O. A. de 50 años de edad, reside en Concepción de Ataco, ubicado en el departamento de Ahuachapán, en donde vive junto a su hijo de 10 años de edad, el cual se dedica a estudiar. José se dedica a la venta ambulante de productos lácteos tales como: queso, crema, requesón, y otros tipos de quesos los cuales son típicos de este país. Él cuenta con una ruta trazada en la cual posee varios clientes fijos, a pesar de esto José desea obtener clientes nuevos, es por esto que solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos lácteos y de esta forma aumentar sus ventas lo cual es muy beneficioso para el como para su hijo.
texts.en: José Antonio O. A. is 50 years old.  He lives in Concepción de Ataco, in Ahuachapán department together with his 10 year-old son who is still in school.  José sells dairy products such as cheese, cream, 'requesón' (a ricotta style cheese) and other types of traditional cheese in the streets.  He has a route which he follows where he has a number of regular customers.  In spite of this, José would like to attract new customers.  This is why he is requesting a loan from Integral.  He would like to be able to buy more dairy products and, in this way, increase his sales which will be very beneficial both to himself and his son.

loans.use: To buy dairy products to sell

location.town: Concepción de Ataco, departamento de Ahuachapán

loans.name: Lam

texts.en: Lam L. is a 24-year-old woman and is married to Kroeun Kun, who appears in the picture here. They earn a living by planting various crops on their own farmland. Lam L. currently plants a potato crop, which she will harvest and collect her productivity when they are mature. Lam L. will be using her loan to add to her personal savings to buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland near her house, which is a good location for farming. She will rent out this land to farmers for a fee. The loan will provide her with an additional asset.

loans.use: To buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland

loans.name: Tô

texts.en:
C. Tô Thị (20213020006) is a 52-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 3 adult children.  

To make a living, C. owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling metal & metal-related products in the local community.  C. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, C. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  C. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  

C. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by her from SEDA.  C. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


C. Tô Thị (20213020006) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, C. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm kim loại & có liên quan đến kim loại trong cộng đồng địa phương.  C. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, C. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, C. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  C. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  C. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To add inventory & working capital

loans.name: Pastora

texts.en:
Pastora V. is from the village of Brgy. Maddiangat,Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 48 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Pastora owns and operates a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Pastora has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Pastora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pastora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Pastora is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment, such as needles and threads. This loan will be the Pastora's second loan from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her  family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional tailoring equipment

loans.name: Josephin

texts.en:
Josephin is a single woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent.

She has operated a natural fruit-juice selling business for over two years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her greatest major challenge is seasonality. During the rainy winter season, the demand for soft drinks is low compared to the hot summer season. Josephin hopes to expand the business in the future.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase water pipes and taps to install fresh water for resale.

loans.use: To purchase water pipes and taps to install fresh water for resale

loans.name: Therecia

texts.en:
Therecia is a 60-year-old married lady. She is blessed with five children above age 35.  

She has been earning her living from tailoring for 25 years. She mainly makes and sells wedding gowns. She has three employees in her business. Apart from tailoring, she operates a posho mill (a grinding machine that crushes maize into flour) for extra income.  

She hopes to open other outlets for her business in the future. Being a member of the Masaa group in Faulu Kenya, she has been guaranteed a loan of 90,000 Kenyan shillings by the members. She will use the loan to buy fabric, cloth lining and threads.

loans.use: To buy fabric, cloth lining and threads

loans.name: Nghiêm

texts.en:
L. Nghiêm Thị (20213020014) is a 48-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, L. owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling herbs and spices in the local community.  L. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid a previous L. of 6.048.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous L. was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  L. is now requesting a new L. of 8.288.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital.  This will be the fourth L. taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


L. Nghiêm Thị (20213020014) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, L. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các loại thảo mộc & gia vị trong cộng đồng địa phương.  L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  L. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:
