*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra is a widow. She lost her husband a few years ago as a result of a sudden death. It was a difficult time for her and for her four sons. She moved to her brother’s home. She worked very hard to raise her children. Unfortunately, she couldn’t provide them with a proper education but she feels happy that she raised them with discipline and instilled in them good habits.
  
Her eldest son provides catering services to his clients. He offers his services at marriage functions and birthday parties. The next son works in a motor workshop as a motor mechanic. Her two younger sons stay at home and don’t work. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother, who operates a clothes-selling business. With the loan, he will buy clothes of different varieties in a bulk quantity to improve the condition of his business and to offer more variety to his customers. 

Azra is hopeful that by investing money in her brother’s business, his business will grow further and earn him more income. He has been doing this business for past 12 years and has a good knowledge about the latest trends of market. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she has paid her installments on time and attended every meeting. 

Note: In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Azra.

loans.use: To buy clothes for a clothes-selling business

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en: Rejoice G. sells groundnuts and simsim at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of groundnuts and simsim to sell.  Rejoice is forty years old and widowed. She has two children, who do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to provide for her family's basic needs and expand the business.

loans.use: Stock more bags of groundnuts and simsim to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites Sta. A. is from the village of Brgy. Maddiangat, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 34 years old. Marites is married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Marites sells vegetables at the market and around her village, using her jeep as transportation. Marites has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Marites joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for her vegetable business. This loan will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair jeep used to take vegetables to market for sale.

loans.name: Gulnaz's Group

texts.en:
Gulnaz lives in the third largest city of Pakistan called Faisalabad, which is known for its textile industry. She lives there with her family in the Anwer colony in a two-room brick house where she moved seven years ago. 

Gulnaz is 37 years old, and married to I. who is a hair dresser by profession. He runs a barber shop in the market. He is very good at his work and deals with many customers. Her brother-in-law also lives with her family, and is an employee in a private firm on a monthly wage. 

Gulnaz has given birth to four children; three sons and a daughter. She cannot afford to educate any of her children. She herself is a housewife, who stays at home and does household chores.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. He will use the loan to purchase different items such as a mirror, chairs and scissors for his shop to better serve his customers. The additional chairs will help him provide better seating arrangements to his customers.  
She is hopeful that her husband will be able to get positive results from his business by investing the loan money, and then she will be able to send her younger children to school. 

She is a new borrower of Asasah--this is her first loan application. 

Note: In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Gulnaz.

loans.use: To buy chairs, a mirror and scissors for barber shop.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose A. sells beer, simsim, sugar and groundnuts, and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. Rose is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a farmer. She has four children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo B. is from the village of Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 55 years old. Danilo is widowed with five adult-aged children. To make a living, Danilo raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for breeding. Danilo has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Danilo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Danilo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Danilo is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be his third loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Kean

texts.en:
Kean S. is a 26-year-old village woman who has had a job as a rice farmer in the province of Kompong Cham since she was single. She is earning approximately $1.80 a day to support her family. She has a life partner in her husband, who is a local farmer and fisherman also. The couple has two children who are studying in school. 

This approaching fishing season, the lakes are full of fish but the family is lacking fishing tools. Therefore, Kean S. is applying for a loan for her husband to purchase additional fishing equipment in order to support his business activities. She proposes to use the remainder of loan to purchase a sack of fertilizer and insecticides for her crop. 

Kean S. was not available the day of the photo, so her husband is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing equipment.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul, a married man, has three children and he operates a retail shop. He has been in his business for four years. He also does mixed farming so as to supplement his family’s income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business inventory. This has helped him to improve his business and, hence, growth of his family’s income. With the loan of 40, 000 KES, he will buy sugar and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar and maize flour.

loans.name: Trần

texts.en:
L. Trần Thị (20213020013) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 3 adult children.  To make a living, L. owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling herbs and spices in the local community.  L. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.048.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  L. is now requesting a new loan of 8.288.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by L. from SEDA.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


L. Trần Thị (20213020013) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, L. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các loại thảo mộc & gia vị trong cộng đồng địa phương.  L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  L. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  phụ thêm thu nhập cho gia đình.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Perise

texts.en: Perise M. is currently in the business of selling clothes at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of clothes to sell. Perise is 40 years old. She is Married and her husband is a businessman. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To stock more bags of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Agip Women's Group-Mukono

texts.en: 39-year-old N. Harriet, a married mother of four, is full of dynamism, enthusiasm and enterprise. These attributes have stood out as stocks in trade in her small beauty salon and water sales businesses in Seeta-Mukono. She has been operating these businesses for the last 7 years. These businesses generate her 75,000 shillings weekly. Harriet, who makes a common cause with Agip Women’s Group-Mukono, says it was her husband’s inspiration that laid the start-up financial path for her. In the preceding years, she was operating a charcoal sales business. Harriet says she is going to purchase more salon products, principally cosmetics, with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more salon products such as cosmetics

loans.name: Trần

texts.en:
Sự Trần Thị (20213020012) is a 53-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 3 adult children.  

To make a living, Sự owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  Sự has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, Sự joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Sự has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  

Sự is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by her from SEDA.  Sự plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her  business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Sự thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 15 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Sự kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, Sự đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Sự đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. loans.use: To buy young livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Monika

texts.en: Monika N. is currently in the business of selling rice, beans and sugar at a small shop. She is requesting a loan to stock more current goods to sell.  Monika is 49 years old and she is widowed. She has one child and her child does not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her shop.

loans.use: To stock more current goods to sell.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is a married man who has eight children, three have graduated from school while five still attend school. He lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

Augustine operates a second hand clothes sales business, selling at the market and from door to door. His potential customers are neighbours and passersby. Augustine faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to expand and establish a retail shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 he wants to purchase a bale of clothes and to pay rental bills for his sales stall. He decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes and to pay rent bills for his sales stall.

loans.name: Dương

texts.en:
Quý Dương Thị (20213020011) is a 36-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  

To make a living, Quý owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling rice products in the local community.  Quý has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, Quý joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Quý has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,944,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  

Quý is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & to use as working capital.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by her from SEDA.  Quý plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Jane Jepkorir

texts.en:
Jane Jepkorir C. is 31 years old and married to Barnabas Kemboi Maiyo who is a businessman. They have two children, age four and seven years old. They live in Kapsowar- Eldoret, Kenya.

Jane runs a cereal business and has been doing so for the last eight years. The business is doing well. She is applying for her second loan of Ksh.55,000 from Kadet Ltd to enable her buy ten bags of maize for sale. She was introduced to Kadet Ltd by a friend who is a client. Her cereal business is situated in a pre-urban setup. She has a lot of customers.

She hopes to have an established cereal store in the market. She also hopes to build a permanent house and ensure that her children get the best education.

loans.use: To buy ten bags of maize.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce A. sells beer, soda and a local brew at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and soda to sell. Joyce is 39 years old and married with a husband who is a carpenter. She has seven children--four of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her bar.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer and soda to sell

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en: L. Nguyễn Thị is a 30-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, L. owns and operates a business selling herbs and spices in her community. L. has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 dong (VND) a month. In 2008, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid a previous L. of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA which was used to invest in expanding the business. L. is now requesting a new L. of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her fourth L. from SEDA. L. plans to use additional income to pay the tuition fees of her children. No. 20213020015. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta C. is from the village of Wadya, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 56 years old. Julieta is married and with six adult-aged children. To make a living, Julieta owns and operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling locally-made pillows in the community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Julieta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products (pillows).

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 46-year old married woman from Binangonan in the province of Rizal, living with her husband and seven children. Two of them are college graduates and five of them are still attending school. In 1998, she opened her own business, selling fried” itik” (small ducks) in the community. Her avid customers come from the surrounding areas and nearby town. 

Virginia is now requesting a loan in order to purchase more “itik” to sell. She believes that having more fried itik will help her retain her current customers as well as attract new clients in the neighborhood. Her previous loan played an important role in developing the business and her increased profits enabled her to invest in her home.

A proud member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) since 2008 (a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines), Virginia has been a dedicated member, with regular attendance at weekly center meetings and a solid record in repayments on previous loans. 

Virginia hopes that, with the help of ASHI and Kiva, she can achieve her main dream in life: sending her five remaining children to school until they find jobs, and to build her own comfortable home to live in. Virginia also extends her helping hand to her niece and nephew to bring them to school, making education their priority. She also dreams of a successful business, and even has plans to have her own booth in the market in the future. 

Additionally, she hopes to continue her business to provide a sustainable livelihood for her family. Now, she says, her dreams are nearly within reach.

loans.use: To purchase more inventories of "itik" (small ducks).

loans.name: Mary Joy's Group

texts.en:
Mary Joy A. is from the village of Brgy.Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 24 years old. Mary Joy is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Mary Joy is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Joy owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling pork and chicken barbeque. Mary Joy has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Mary Joy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Mary Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food for sale. Mary Joy is requesting a new loan of 19000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 6th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase additional food to sell.

loans.name: Camlus

texts.en: Camlus is a married man with four children and he does tailoring for a living.  He has been able to educate his children with the income from his business.  Despite his business being in a very competitive environment, he has managed to keep his business running for 15 years.  So far, he has managed to employ three people in his business.  He hopes to become financially stable in the future.  He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kes through Miracle group in Faulu Kenya.  He will use the loan to buy more fabric.

loans.use: To buy more fabric

loans.name: Beronika

texts.en: Beronika S. is currently in the business of selling fish, groundnut paste and bread. She is requesting a loan to stock more fish to sell.  Beronika is 35 years old and is married to a peasant. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
M. Nguyễn Thị (20201070033) is a 36-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 3 school-aged children.  

To make a living, M. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  M. has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,800,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, M. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  M. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,704,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in the future.  

M. is now requesting a new loan of 7,840,000 VND, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The loan will be the 5th loan she has taken out from SEDA.  M. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


M. Nguyễn Thị (20201070033) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, M. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  M. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, M. kiếm được khoảng 3.800.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, M. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  M. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  M. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.name: Kydykbek

texts.en:
Kydykbek G. is a farmer from Tashkiya village. He is 43 years old and has three daughters aged 6, 8 and 10. Kydykbek was born into a large family with ten children but in spite of many difficulties, he was able to graduate from college as a builder and worked in this trade for 20 years. He is known as a very positive, hardworking person and a grateful son, who lives with his elderly parents and supports them.

In 1994, in order to find more means of subsistence for his large family, Kydykbek decided to start his own business in cattle breeding. Over the past 16 years, his efforts have been aimed at supporting and expanding his household. He has managed to multiply the number of cattle and today he has four milk cows, five sheep, five lambs and one horse. Also, Kydykbek began cultivating potatoes and holy clover on a plot of land and worked hard to get a good harvest of high quality products.

Now Kydykbek is applying for a loan of 120,000 KGS to buy five bull calves for fattening and resale. With the revenues from this investment, he plans to broaden his business by purchasing more cattle for fattening. His plans for the future include providing a higher education to his daughters; he dreams of seeing them as progressive-minded persons.

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are transportation and rent bills.

She sells purified water in a shop at wholesale and at the market. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Elizabeth faces a major challenge of transportation in her business. She hopes to establish two more branches for selling purified water in the future. 

With the Kshs 35,000, she wants to purchase 50 plastic containers to store purified water for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products for resale

loans.name: Daffodil

texts.en:
Daffodil is  38 years old and has five children, two sons and three daughters.   She lives with her family in the province of Rizal in the Philippines. 

To supply additional income for her family, Daffodil is starting a tricycle business.  A tricycle is a motorcycle with a sidecar attached, used as a public utility vehicle.

Daffodil would like to receive a loan to pay for the maintenance of it.  As a member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Daffodil is thankful for access to capital and loans to support her entrepreneurial dreams.  
 
With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that her business will generate steady income to improve her financial stability and her family’s quality of life.  Her long-term dreams are to continue to support her children and to build a stronger home that can withstand the flooding common in her area.

loans.use: Tricycle maintenance

loans.name: Houn

texts.en:
Mrs. Huon M. is a 33-year-old married woman.  She is a villager living in Ampil village, Kandal province. 

Mrs. Huon M. and her husband, Mr. Met Kuok, are farmers who own a plot of rice field that they use to cultivate rice for a living. 

For this farm, they do not have enough money to buy fertilizer and pesticide to cultivate rice. So Mrs. Huon M. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seed to cultivate rice.  Aside from being a farmer, her husband is also pig middleman.  

This couple has five children who are attending the local school and also help in their parents' businesses.  Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seed to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Majeeda's Group

texts.en:
Majeeda has 2 sons and a daughter. All of them are illiterate and could not get an education due to financial reasons.   She herself is a seamstress and stitches clothes for her neighboring clients to contribute to her family financially. 

Her husband is a scrap dealer. He supplies scrap to different factories and also to different scrap shops for profit. He has been doing this business for many years and has good experience in this field. 

Majeeda has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will invest the loan in purchasing scraps in bulk quantity.  That will not only cut his cost but also help him to fulfill the orders on time. 

She is hopeful that an investment will help her husband make his business better and provide better a financial life to the family. She has a plan to send her children to school after husband's business condition improved. 
 
Majeeda lives in a small city named Borewala with her husband and family. Her home is located in the area named Majid colony which is a small residential area of the city.  

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy scrap for scrap business

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia R. is from the village of Brgy. Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 57 years old, married and has 5 adult-aged children. Leticia owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. Leticia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Leticia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leticia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Leticia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Leticia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (20201070032) is a 30-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, H. owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling herbs & spices in the local community.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,600,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  

H. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  The loan will be her 5th loan taken out from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Nguyễn Thị (20201070032) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, H. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các loại thảo mộc & gia vị trong cộng đồng địa phương.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.600.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  H. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Jane Wangari

texts.en:
Jane has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 12 years.  She is 45 years old and married to Wambu Chege. They have seven children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her third loan.  She has paid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings, which she will plant.

In the future, Jane hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potato seedlings.

loans.name: Jomelyn

texts.en:
Jomelyn L. is from the village of Brgy. Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 35 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Jomelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling personal products in the local community. Jomelyn has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Jomelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jomelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jomelyn is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Jomelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Song

texts.en: Mrs. Song H. is a 35-year-old married woman. She lives in Ampil village, Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Ma Ny, are farmers who own a rice field to cultivate rice for a living. With the farm, they face a problem, because they do not have enough money to grow rice. Thus, Song H. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer to cultivate rice. This couple has three children: Two are attending the local school and the third one is just four years old. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun S. is a 48-year-old married man who currently resides in Siem Reap province. Bun S. makes his income by ferrying villagers and tourists across the river. He generates a profit of approximately $6 US a day to help support his family’s daily expenses. His wife is a housewife who manages many duties at home. Bun S. is blessed with three children, all of whom are single. Because his ferry is small, he wants to expand it. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to purchase some pieces of wood to enlarge his ferry. Bun S. was not available on the day the photo was taken, so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: to purchase some wood to enlarge his ferry

loans.name: Nora's Group

texts.en:
Nora D. is from the village of Cataggaman Nuevo, Tuguegarao City. She is 38 years old. Nora is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Nora is married and has 3 school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Nora has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Nora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nora has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Nora is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and feed. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Nora from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and feed

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
D. Nguyễn Thị (20201070050) is a 44-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  D. is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Trung Bạn 07 (Nhóm 7).


D. is married and has 2 adult children.  To make a living, D. owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a butcher shop.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from butchering & selling pork in the local community.  D. has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,900,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, D. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  D. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,496,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  

She is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & to use as working capital.  The loan will be her 4th loan taken out from SEDA.  D. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị L. (0) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


2.  Nguyễn Thị N. (0) is a 39-year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


3.  Trương Thị D. (0) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


D. Nguyễn Thị (20201070050) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  D. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Vào 2007, D. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  D. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 6.496.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

loans.use: To purchase inventory & use as working capital

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira U. is 41 years old and resides in Binangonan in the province of Rizal. She lives with her husband and their two dependent children. Elvira has a store in her house where she sells basic necessities and all types of products that people use in their homes. She is requesting a loan so that she can have the funds needed to buy more food products and basic household necessities. This will allow her to attract more customers and increase her sales. 

Elvira’s business is very important because it enables her to provide better financial stability for her family to live in a decent manner. She hopes to provide them with everything necessary to move forward against poverty. 

Elvira dreams of the best for her family: to have an expanded business and a happy family and to provide better education for her two siblings until they find better employment. She has shown herself to be hard-working and strong-minded. She hopes that her business will continue to be more productive and that her family's overall quality of living will continue to improve.

loans.use: to buy more food products and basic household necessities

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen lives in Borewala which is a small city in Punjab Province known for its agriculture industry in Pakistan. She lives there in a 2 room brick house in an area named Mujahid colony with her family.  She is a house wife and does her household work by staying at home. She is very supportive and caring in nature and fulfills her responsibilities as a mother and a wife very efficiently. She is the mother of a son and 2 daughters. All of them are studying in different classes. 

She is married to A. A. who is plumber by profession. He offers his services to his customers by repairing their water pipes and taps and also sells sanitary supplies to his customers.  Perveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will utilize the loan to purchase the water taps, water pipes, etc in bulk quantity for selling.  He has started selling sanitary supplies few years ago and Perveen is confident that after this investment her husband’s business will improve and make his income double in size.
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fifth loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself a responsible client by paying the installments on time.

loans.use: to purchase the water taps, water pipes, etc in bulk quantity for selling.

loans.name: Song

texts.en:
Mrs. Song M. is a 38-year-old married woman who lives in Ampil village, Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of rice field to cultivate rice for a living. 

They work hard on the farm, but they still lack some money to cultivate rice, so Mrs. Song M. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay to hire laborers to plow her farm to cultivate rice. 

Her husband, Mr. Phon Sophea, 37, works as house constructor who is able to earn a little income to support his family. 

This couple has three children: one stays at home and the others are attending the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer/pesticide and hire laborers to cultivate rice

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (20201070030) is a 33-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 3 school-aged children.

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,100,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  

H. is now requesting a new loan of 7,840,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & to use as working capital.  The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by her from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.100.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  H. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase inventory & use as working capital

loans.name: Jolinda

texts.en:
Jolinda A. is from the village of Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 35 years old. Jolinda is separated from her spouse and has 5 school-aged children. 

To make a living, Jolinda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling vegetables & spices like garlic, onion, ginger, cabbage, red bell pepper & tomatoes in the local community. Jolinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jolinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Jolinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional vegetables to buy and sell. Jolinda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jolinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase inventory & use as working capital

location.town: Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Nghiêm

texts.en:
Quý Nghiêm Thị (20201070014) is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. She is married and has three adult children.  To make a living, Quý owns and operates a business venture in the food sector – operating a butcher shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from butchering and selling a variety of meats in the local community. Quý has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,200,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, Quý joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Quý has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,392,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Quý is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Quý from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Viet Nam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Quý Nghiêm Thị (20201070014) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, Quý Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng T.t.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ giết mổ & bán nhiều loại T.t khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Quý thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 12 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Quý kiếm được khoảng 4.200.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, Quý đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Quý đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các vật dụng mới để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  Quý dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Babara's Group

texts.en:
Babara has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her husband in his car seat cover making business. He will invest the loan in buying foam, leather, and thread in bulk quantity.  That will enable him to make seat covers in larger quantity to sell.  

Babara lives in a city named Borewala, famous for its shrines in Pakistan.  She doesn’t have any children yet. She is a caring lady and carries out her responsibilities of a housewife well at home.
 
This is the first time Babara has applied for a loan from Asasah. She is hopeful that with the help of this loan investment, her husband will be able to up-lift his business by increasing his sales, and her family will be able to enjoy better facilities of life and she will return the loan without any problem.

loans.use: To buy material for car seat cover making business

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia C. is from the village of Brgy. Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 43 years old. Ofelia is married and has 3 school-aged children. 

To make a living, Ofelia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. Ofelia has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Ofelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Ofelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 16000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. 

This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Ofelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fruits & vegetables for resale

loans.name: Naranbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Naranbaatar is a 33-year-old single man who lives with his mother and two younger brothers in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His father passed away when he was child. He is the eldest son in the family, and he started to work straight after high school to help his mother. Together with his mother, he managed to provide a university education to his two younger brothers by paying their fees. He told us that now it is time to think about himself and that he is planning to build his own family. 

He has been running a taxi business since 2005. This year he has obtained a license to carry passengers between Ulaanbaatar and Khentii province, which is situated 360 kilometers away to the east of capital. Therefore, he is planning to sell his old car and buy a 7-seat minivan. He is one of our reliable VIP customers and the loan he is requesting will be used to pay for a new minivan to carry passengers.

loans.use: To pay for a new 7-seat minivan to carry passengers

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en:
Jameela is a house wife and stays at home doing her household responsibilities.  She has given birth to 2 sons and 4 daughters. She is unable to provide education to her children due to poor financial conditions.  

Her husband’s name is M. S. and he is a scrap dealer. He operates his shop in the market from where he sells scrap to different factories and other scrap dealers on order.
 
Jameela has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy scrap such as plastic bottles, used papers, etc. in bulk quantity to sell through his shop. 

Jameela is hopeful that with the growth of her husband’s business, her family’s living standard will be improved and they will be able to enjoy the better facilities of life.  

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her 1st loan application.  They are residents of a city called Borewala, famous for its shrines in Pakistan. Their house is located in a colony named Mujahid colony and contains 2 rooms.

loans.use: To buy scrap for scrap business

loans.name: Lodgie

texts.en:
Lodgie S. is from the village of Extension, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 40 years old. Lodgie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lodgie owns and operates a business running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as canned goods, soy sauce and vinegar in a pouch, detergents, and firewood in the local community. Lodgie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lodgie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lodgie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Lodgie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Lodgie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

loans.name: Phán's Group

texts.en:
Four people are forming a group. They are located in Kandal village, Kandal province. The group has selected Mrs. Phán M., a 37-year-old married woman, as its leader. 

She and her husband, Mr. Chet Phat, are farmers who own a 1.10-hectare field to cultivate rice and vegetables for a living. In order to support this farming, Mrs. Phán M. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to cultivate rice and vegetables. Aside from farming, Mr. Chet Phat also earns income with his plowing machine. This couple has three children who all are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide to cultivate rice and vegetables

loans.name: Sofia Nalamai

texts.en:
Sofia M., aged 48, runs a grocery at Bissil market in Kajiado. She sells her goods to the Bissil residents and also gets business from the hotels and butchers nearby. She is married to Senteu M., who is a farmer, and together they have four children; two daughters aged 20 and 17 and two sons aged 12 and 10. All the children attend school. 

Sofia has been running her business for 11 years and her monthly profit is 8,150 KES. With the loan she plans to buy more stock of beans, fruits, eggs and vegetables for sale. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

If the loan boosts the business, Sofia will save the extra income until it enables her to buy a pickup, which she will use to transport the fruits and vegetables from farmers in the upcountry to the market place.

Sofia describes herself as hardworking and dreams that one day she will be supplying fruits and vegetables to Nairobi business people.

loans.use: To buy beans, vegetables, fruits and eggs for sale

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester T. is from the village of Extension, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 29 years old. Ester is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ester owns and operates a business in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, detergents and junk food to the local community.  Ester has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ester joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ester has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Ester is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Ester from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Забиров Баходур проживает в районе Файзабад. Возраст, 27 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Рядом с домом открыл продуктовый магазин. Два месяца как занимается торговлей. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. Он хочет расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Bahodur Z. lives in the Fayzabad district.  He is 27 years old, married and has 2 children.  He has a secondary education.  Bahodur opened a food store near his house and has been involved in sales for two months.  He is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.  He wants to expand his business.

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sun V., a 44-year-old married woman, is a villager who lives in Ampil village, Kandal province. She and her husband are farmers who own a rice field. They do not have enough money for their farm to grow rice. So Mrs. Sun V. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to hire a farming laborer to cultivate rice. 

Besides farming, her husband also works as fisherman and can earn a little income to improve his family. This couple has four children: One is laborer, one is vegetable farmer and the others are students in the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and to hire farming labor to cultivate rice

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe P. is from the village of Thailand, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 45 years old. Fe is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Fe runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, biscuits and junk foods. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Fe is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Safari

texts.en: Safari is a single man who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food. He operates a green grocery business selling sukumawiki (green vegetables) and tomatoes on a retail basis to his neighbors and passersby. Safari faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. During the hot summer season, the supply of sukumawiki is low, hence not satisfying customer needs. He hopes to open a retail shop in the future. With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase iron sheets, timber and labor charges to renovate his house. He decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase iron sheets, timber and labor to renovate his house

loans.name: Orkhon

texts.en:
Orkhon, who is 29 years old, lives with his wife and two-year-old son in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. A carpenter by trade, since 2008 Orkhon has been running a taxi business and also working as a part-time handyman. His wife works in one of the “Khaan buuz”’ chain restaurants as a kitchen assistant.

Orkon's wife's younger brother is leaving for South Korea to work on a labor contract; such contracts are very hard to obtain due to the large volume of Mongolians applying to work abroad to earn some extra money, and they must pass through a very strict selection procedure. The loan Mr.Orkhon is requesting will be used to pay for his brother-in-law's travel to Korea and to cover some personal expenses.

loans.use: To pay for brother’s travel to Korea on labor contract and to cover some personal expenses

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 32-year-old married man and father of one child. He has been working in construction since 2003 and is talented at completing concrete blocks for home projects. He is thankful for his business revenue; it has allowed him to own his personal house and get married. He currently has a baby and needs to work hard to satisfy all of his family's needs.

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.al. to purchase additional tools needed to strengthen his business and produce more concrete blocks. In the future, he hopes to continue his work and is optimistic about the prospects for business growth in the coming years.

loans.use: To purchase additional tools

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie W., from the village of Wadya, Banisilan, Cotabato, is 46 years old. married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, snack foods and vegetables such as radishes, cabbage and ginger in the local community. He also buys and retails rice by the kilogram. Rosalie has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Rosalie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid his previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to buy and sell, he is now requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be Rosalie's ninth loan from HSPFI, and he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As working capital and to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Phe's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people who live in Angk village, Kandal province. This group members selected Mrs. Phe S., 49-year-old married woman, as the group leader. The members hope that the loan will increase their income to improve their family living. 

Mrs. Phe S. is a farmer who owns a one-hectare rice field to cultivate rice for a living. She works very hard with the farm, but she still does not have enough money to support the rice field.  Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Chay Ry, is a fisherman and he also helps his wife in farming. This couple has four children. Two of the children are seamstresses in the garment factory and the other two are students in the local school.
