Para Dina Fondo Esperanza ha sido una gran ayuda, por su bajo interés en los préstamos y por los talleres educativos, no solo de negocios, sino también de valores y de relaciones personales. 
Maipú es una comuna ubicada al este de Santiago, capital de Chile. Designada como la comuna más grande de Chile es llamada Cuna de la Patria debido a importantes hechos históricos ocurridos en esas tierras durante la época de la Independencia.
texts.en:
Dina is part of the Communal Bank, "La Hermandad," in the neighborhood of Maipú.  She sells lingerie, sportswear, toys, and herbal medicines in a booth at a fair in her neighborhood, which is installed in 3 locations.  She has been working 4 days a week including all weekends for 18 years.  Dina also manufactures products for the defined seasons with her sewing machine.  For example, on national holidays she makes typical costumes and for Christmas she makes tablecloths and napkins.

Dina shares her position at the fair with her daughter who sells dolls.  With this loan Dina will buy lingerie.  Her dream is to have more customers to increase her sales.

For Dina, Fondo Esperanza has been a great help for low interest loans and educational workshops, not only for business but also for values and personal relationships.

Maipú is a municipality located east of Santiago, capital of Chile.  Designated as the largest municipality of Chile, it is called the cradle of the country due to major historical events that ocurred on those lands during the time of independence.

loans.use: To buy lingerie clothing.

loans.name: Morris

texts.en:
Morris is 24 years old and has been in business running a retail shop for the last 6 years in a very busy environment. His main customers are the local residents and his neighbours. 

In his retail shop, he sells sukari (sugar), Unga (both maize and wheat flour), mahindi (maize), mchele (rice), and mkate (bread), among other products. 

He has requested for a loan of KES 50,000 to buy a plot of land to develop a business premise, since he is now renting.

He is married and they are parents to one child. He describes himself as focused and active, and plans to enlarge his business and invest in real estate in order to have a good living and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy a plot land to develop a business premise

loans.name: Dellys

texts.es: Delly M. de 53 años, ha tenido el desafío de trabajar persistentemente con tal de ofrecerle un mejor futuro a sus 5 hijos, que hoy están en las edades de 14 a 30 años; ella hace 20 años desde  su antigua máquina con la que inició, se ha movido en la actividad de confecciones en  las líneas femeninas e infantil, primero lo hizo "sobre medidas", es decir los clientes llevan sus telas e insumos, le indican la moda, que ella interpreta , para que finalmente  Delly tome las medidas del cuerpo y elabore el vestido; así se ha defendido aprendiendo sobre la marcha, pero  hoy está un poco mas holgada porque ha logrado tener toda la materias primas e insumos compradas por ella misma,  para elaborar vestidos en diferentes tallas y venderlos. Este es su segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y se siente muy satisfecha con la inyección de capital de trabajo, pues ahora  tiene un dinero  adicional para seguir comprando telas e insumos,  fabricar ropa, aumentar sus ventas y generar utilidades, que mucho le han ayudado a mejorar las  condiciones de su vivienda, porque este es justamente uno de sus sueños: “el de terminar de construir su casa, y también ver a sus hijos culminar su carrera profesional;  este es el motivo principal de  su inspiración diaria,  para hacer una oferta que verdaderamente mantenga a sus clientes rentables y aumente el número de ellos, porque conoce  que finalmente este propósito se vera reflejado en utilidades y así mismo en su bienestar y crecimiento personal. Delly es muy conocida en el barrio Villa del Carmen en el municipio de Soledad y en sus alrededores por su buena costura, y como de costumbre quiere vestir a sus clientes muy elegantes en este fin de año que está lleno de fiestas familiares,   está solicitando su Credikiva porque con él comprará telas, hilos, botones, encajes correderas, pellón y broches. Con esta inversión, aumentará el volumen de ventas en un 35%, por eso está expectante de recibir este dinero de crédito.
texts.en:
Delly M., 53, has had the challenge of working persistently in order to offer a better future for her 5 children, who range in age from 14 to 30.  20 years ago, starting with her old machine, she moved into the apparel business with women's and children's lines.   At first she was doing this on commission, i.e. customers bring their fabrics and supplies and show the designs they want, which she then interprets; then Delly takes the body measurements and makes the dress.  This she says was learning by doing, but today she is a little more comfortable because she has managed to have all the raw materials and supplies purchased herself, to produce clothes in different sizes and sell them.

This is her second financing with Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and she is very pleased with the injection of working capital.  She now has extra money to keep buying fabric and supplies and making clothes, to increase her sales and profitability.  This will greatly help improve their housing conditions, which is only one of her dreams.  "Finishing construction of her house and also seeing her children build their career", this is the main reason for her daily inspiration to provide an offering that truly retains her profitable customers and increases the number of them.  She knows that ultimately this purpose will be reflected in profits and in her welfare and personal growth. 

Delly is well known in the neighborhood of Villa del Carmen in the municipality of Soledad and the surrounding area for good fashion, and as usual wants to dress her customers very smartly in this new year period that is full of family parties.  She is requesting Credikiva so that she can buy fabric, thread, buttons, lace trim, interfacing and clasps. With this investment, she will increase sales volume by 35%, so this is why she is waiting to receive this credit money.

loans.use: Fabric, thread, buttons, lace trim, interfacing and clasps

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en: Robinah N. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school, and also takes care of additional family members. Robinah has had a restaurant in the market for eight years, where she works 6 days a week. She has requested a loan of 600,000/- Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, to buy more food like bananas, rice, beef, and potatoes, also charcoal. Her main business challenge is transportation and high rent. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a full hotel on her own premises. Robinah lives in a home that she owns without access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food like bananas, beef, and potatoes, also charcoal

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro vive en casa propia cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad Chijipina Chico. El es productor lechero y su esposa le colabora en todas las actividades agrícolas. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención.
Pedro y su esposa tienen dos hijos. 
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de una vaca lechera. Esto le permitirá aumentar su producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro y el análisis socio-económico indican que Pedro es sujeto de crédito.
texts.en:
Pedro lives in his own home in the Chijipina Chico community.  He is a dairy producer and his wife works with him in all his farming activities.  It is the main source of income for himself, his wife and his two children.

This loan will be used to buy a dairy cow.  This will allow Pedro to increase his milk production and improve his income.

This is his first loan from Impro and our socio-economic analysis indicates that Pedro is suitable to receive a loan.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase his milk production

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro vive en casa propia cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad Tipampa Achacachi. El es productor lechero y su esposa le colabora en toda actividad agropecuaria. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención, la de su esposa y sus dos hijos. 
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera. Esto le permitirá aumentar su producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Es segundo crédito con Impro su buen comportamiento de pago le permite acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Alejandro lives in his own home in the Tipampa Achacachi community.  He is a dairy producer and his wife works with him in all his farming and livestock activities.  It is the main source of income for himself, his wife and their two children.

This loan will be used to buy a dairy cow.  This will enable him to increase his milk production and improve his income.

This is his second loan from Impro.  His good repayment history allows him to access a new loan.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase his milk production

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence S. lives in the Kyebando neighborhood in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has 12 children, 8 of whom are in school. She also takes care of three additional family members. Florence has had a bar and a lodge at her home for over 10 years where she works seven days a week. Florence has requested for a loan of 700,000/- Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more crates of soda and beer. She also generates additional income through her rentals. Her main business challenge is defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are educating her children up to university and building more rental houses. Florence lives in a home that she owns with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are electricity, water, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy of beer and soda

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es:
Braulio vive en casa propia en la zona de San Pedro, de la ciudad de La Paz, es viudo, el señor tiene un taxi de transporte publico y con los ingresos que obtiene de dicha actividad se mantiene. En anterior crédito realizó la reparación de su vehiculo para continuar trabajando. El crédito que ahora solicita será utilizado en el terminado de obra fina de una de las habitaciones de su casa. Braulio se encuentra satisfecho con los créditos que le otorgamos.

Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito pues es  considerado un buen cliente.
texts.en:
Braulio lives in his own home in San Pedro district, in the city of La Paz.  He is a widower.  Braulio has a taxi and he supports himself with the income that he makes from this activity.  He used a previous loan to repair his vehicle so that he could continue working.  The loan he is now requesting will be used to put the finishing touches to one of the rooms in his house.  Braulio is happy with the loans which we have given him.

His history qualifies him to take out a new loan as he is considered a good client.

loans.use: To put the finishing touches to one of the rooms in his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 45 year old businesslady. She has been in business for the last 16 years in a busy environment. She operates a retail business where she sells cooking fat, unga (flour), bananas, tomatoes, potatoes, and vegetables like cabbage and sukumawiki (kales), among other products. 

She is requesting for a loan of KES 20,000 to add stocks of cooking fat, unga (flour), bananas, tomatoes, potatoes, and vegetables like cabbage and sukumawiki (kales). 

She is married and is a mother to six children, who are adults (over 18 years of age).  Two of her children are in college. She hopes to build a home with a proper water supply as well as purchase and develop a plot of land in the next 5 years.

loans.use: To buy grocery products for resale

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena A. Rodríguez de 54 años, procedente del departamento de Bolívar desde el año de 1999 en condiciones de desplazamiento, llegó a Barranquilla con su esposo y sus 9 hijos en las edades de 14 a 27 y  se le ocurrió la idea de elaborar bollos (Envueltos a base de maíz y queso) aprovechando el conocimiento de la técnica y su experiencia en el oficio; fue así como inició con 13 mazorcas y elaboró 12 bollos que vendió, y que desde ese momento, se han convertido en el sustento principal de su hogar, pues en la actualidad ha aumentado su producción a 100 bollos diarios. Si usted  visita a Elena puede encontrarla en pleno proceso, con sus compañeros de producción, que son sus hijos,: entre todos deshojan el maíz , desprenden los granos, que someten a molienda, para luego amasarlos, envolverlos en las mismas hojas del bollo, amarrarlos y finalmente someterlos a la respectiva cocción; para que cuando ya están listos, puedan ser adquiridos mediante su compra por los clientes, ubicados en el mismo barrio donde vive y especialmente  en tiendas del sector, allí son vendidos al consumidor final. Para el desarrollo de esta actividad, Elena cuenta con un molino eléctrico, al que ya es hora de hacerle una buena reparación y también tiene   todos las herramientas necesaria para el proceso; Este es su segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él comprará enseres menores, reparará su molino,  y comprará laminas de eternit, cemento y baldosas  para adecuar su pisos y proteger su espacio productivo, debido a que cuando llueve se filtra el agua, generando condiciones de deterioro e inseguridad al trabajar.
Elena cuenta, que antes de estar vinculada a la Fundación, mantenía créditos costosos para poder comprar su materia prima e insumos, ahora se siente mas tranquila porque está mas holgada con el capital adicional que le presta esta organización; igualmente manifiesta que su negocio ha crecido tanto en ventas como en estructura con este impulso. Su sueño se concentra  mas adelante en finalizar su vivienda, para mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales, que tanto convienen también al negocio, en su imagen y presentación y este es justamente su gran desafío.
texts.en:
Elena A. Rodríguez is 54 years old.  She has lived in Bolívar department since 1999.  She arrived in Barranquilla with her husband and her 9 children aged between 14 and 27.  She had the idea to start making 'bollos' (corn and cheese-based wraps), making use of her knowledge and experience in the business.  She started with 13 corncobs and made 12 'bollos' which she then sold.  From that moment, her business has become the main source of support for her household.  She has increased her production to 100 'bollos' a day.  If you visited Elena you would find her in the middle of making her 'bollos' with her children who are her production colleagues.  Between them they shuck the corn, remove the grain which they then mill, make the dough, wrap the 'bollos' up in the corn husks, tie them up and finally cook them.  When they are ready they are bought by her customers who are in her neighborhood, especially those who own stores where the 'bollos' are finally sold to the end customer.

To carry out her activity, Elena has an electric mill which now needs to be repaired and all the other equipment which she needs for her production process.  This is the second loan which Elena has had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy small utensils, to repair her mill and to buy corrugated metal sheeting, cement and tiles to adapt her premises and protect her production space because when it rains the water drips in which causes damage and lack of safety while she is working.

Elena tells us that before she was a member of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, she used expensive loans to buy raw material and ingredients.  Now she feels more relaxed because she is more comfortable with the capital which this organization provides her with.  She also says that her business has grown both in terms of sales and in structure as a result of this investment.  Her dream for the future is to finish the building work on her home, to improve her living conditions which are so important for her business too both in terms of image and presentation.  This is her biggest challenge.

loans.use: To buy small utensils, repair her mill and buy sheets of corrugated metal, cement and tiles to adapt her property and protect her production space
